DOPSfAawGCiqdPPmxjrrqw.text: I loved the sushi so much that I'd like to give 5 stars....but that would be overlooking other factors.  All the chairs there are high...the kind that make your feet dangle over the side as they can't reach the ground.  This is painful for people with certain medical conditions.  My wife was in pain the entire time we were there.  Also, the place was very tightly packed.  The tables were too small to allow you to stretch out at all.  The food was pretty good but I probably won't go back.

kyz5ICbmR7ssbp5R5wqX0w.text: Love this restaurant. Small place and very popular so we traditionally won't go with a party over 4 people. Bento box is the way to go for me. It's very well balanced with your entree, salad, etc. Service is always on point at lunch to keep the tables turning but I've never felt rushed.

FOYYPkgKCrw6NBhza78LDw.text: Always friendly service and very good food. Good size portions and great quality!  Try the bento box...you won't leave hungry.  Great sushi and intimate atmosphere.   A must dine at in Charlotte.

YLbK6HMw-jO8eDfYNkTMmw.text: My wife and I have enjoyed dinner here several times and have never been disappointed. The sushi is excellent as well as the rest of the menu. The staff is extremely friendly and they make you feel welcome. The space is small but it doesn't distract from the New Zealand cafe, it adds to it. So go ahead give them a try, you won't regret it.

1suK17EWiP_xNv1gBsLddw.text: I went here last night with a friend to try out a new Sushi restaurant. IT WAS EXCELLENT!! I'm a fan of Ru Sans, but the past couple of times I had been there much was to be desired....and it was noisy 9/10 times. The NZC is in a nice spot, and although the place is small, it's cozy and you can actually hear a conversation. The waitress was polite and tentative, as well as the greeter. The biggest thing though- was the Sushi. I had a ginger salad to start (yum), then the Vegetable Tempura Maki roll (yum) and sampled some of my friends crispy Tuna Maki roll- also yum. I found a new Sushi place to go- goodbye Ru Sans.

kESj1BCZWr3uzBVFCgoTlw.text: SO SO SO good! The sushi is always fresh & delicious and the wait staff is super friendly! Great sushi for spicy food lovers!

8EJa3B-zZXgRCD3rzu3zlA.text: NZ Cafe was recommended to me about 4 years ago. I doubt I ever would have found it otherwise since its location is hidden and unassuming.  The sushi prices are extremely reasonable and the best of the places I have tried. The sushi itself is fresh, creative and I've never been disappointed.  I also appreciate that Chef Jackie gives me a nod and a smile even though we have never officially been introduced.  I love this place. Just be aware that since it's so small there is typically a wait to be seated.  It's best to go when they first open or well after normal dining hours. Also keep in mind that if you place a to go order, make sure you order everything you need. On more than one occasion if I needed to add sauces, etc after I had already placed the phone order and hung up that I didn't get the extras when I requested them upon my arrival.

l4v7bPBWDmWtBChG7JxZEA.text: I really wanted to love this place, but it just didn't happen-at all. We got a to-go order of "potstickers", snow crab/shrimp roll, and a salmon tempura roll. We were told it would be ready in 20 minutes on a Sunday (about 8:30 P.M.)      To start, the place is like a broom closet. As you walk in, the register is at the far end of the restaurant - with literally 2 feet between the counter and the drink stand. While waiting in line to pay, we had to maneuver around the 2 foot space 3x for the wait staff.       The chefs didn't even begin to make our order until 10 minutes after our 20 minute arrival time. After paying, we moved to stand by the hallway to the restrooms, still seemly in the way of everyone- it was very uncomfortable. On to the food:      The salmon tempura roll was a sad sight, but tasted okay. The crab/shrimp roll: the shrimp and avocado were fresh, but the crab looked like little hairs and was poorly represented. The "potstickers/gyoza" were a pathetic excuse for their name. They were mushy and bland. Even the dipping sauce served with them was a pale representation of what it should have been.       I know of many others that are much better than this place. They can serve 1$ sushi all day long, but I'll never come back.

fp1N12mQ-ErTU6WEzryAsA.text: Love love love this place. We come here when we want good sushi. My favorite will forever be spicy salmon but they have several great rolls.   The place is small and can get super crowded but it's worth it. The staff is really nice as well.

5_XkQ2JkaNl63DDA_w0jSA.text: Overall excellent sushi. As a NY'er and a foodie and a sushi snob I fully endorse this place. Decent to good service.  Fresh fish.  Creative rolls. This has become my go to place.

qgKO2LtmoIuChhcyc7zMSw.text: This was, hands down, the best sushi I have ever had.  For that reason, it's no wonder locals tout New Zealand Cafe as having the best sushi in all of Charlotte!  The restaurant is a hole-in-the-wall in a somewhat dated strip mall.  It's very tiny with less than ten tables.  I went on a Saturday night and waited only two minutes before our party of two was seated at the sushi bar per our request.  Despite it's size and location, the sushi is absolutely delicious.

XlbikACcv_WRrYA79a01ZA.text: AMAZING sushi rolls. My favorites here are their tempura rolls or unique creations of the sushi chefs (they have 3 sushi menus...)  My favorites? Thousand Island, Ichiban Spicy, Spicy Scallop and Supercrunch. These are prepared to perfection and served by their very friendly waitstaff. They know thier NZ sushi--ask them anything!  ALWAYS packed at night, but worth the wait. Small dining room with even smaller sushi bar... but you still get outstanding service.

EaeohGH5qLRy6fKEOAgASA.text: After hearing about this place from a friend, and seeing it previously on Yelp, I decided to check it out for lunch today. Though it was a little cramped, and the service a little scattered, the sushi was very good and reasonably priced.  With so many mediocre (at best) sushi places in CLT, it's nice to find a quality place close to home.  I will def. be back!

ywLE8ItUt8GD41HxYENEjA.text: Never enjoyed sushi before, but wife loves sushi, heard this place has some of the best sushi so took the Wifey for a date night.  They did not disappoint! Really enjoyed it, really small inside but nice setup, and food was great.  Started with the chicken lettuce wraps which were awesome then we had some spicy shrimp tempura rolls, now that's some sushi I can get into! Glad we finally discovered this place..will be back for sure

k8mgLDi9hAlRltCvLH0LHQ.text: Loved the sushi. Very fresh and delicious. Great prices. Wish we had one in my hometown. I would eat here every week!!!

BbZO4JzKl-byurpLpnj5CA.text: Atmosphere was lacking- the wait was over 30 minutes and the air-conditioning was not working properly. The area was very crowded and left little room to move around or feel comfortable enough to relax. Sushi was pretty decent, probably would be good for a to-go stop.

8VB6LAzxISw2UsrtZTusPA.text: Wow. Delicious! Stopped by randomly and the place was packed on a Sat at 12pm, so you know it has to be good. The wait was long due to it, but expected and well worth it. All sushi rolls were great, soup and lomein were great and they even have a kids menu. Def coming back!

vKPYlPZLZsVIHapbh-0New.text: Kind of glad i wasn't the first one to give it 3 stars. i did really dig this place for making a cool little restaurant in a standard looking strip mall. It was quite a trek out there for us, but looking at 20+ reviews of only 4 and 5 stars was convincing.   Not being a huge sushi eater, i went with the H.O.T. rolls and something i knew i'd enjoy in the buffalo shrimp dinner. For non-sushi fans, the H.O.T. rolls really don't have any sort of gross sushiness to them, so a good choice in that respect. They didn't wow us all that much though. The buffalo shrimp came with rice, a salad and two sticks of chicken. The rice and shrimp were good and the salad was decent with a couple cucumbers, but the chicken on a stick was like something you find on a Chinese buffet.  My wife, the reason i frequently end up at sushi places was happy with the prices, but didn't think the sushi stood out from others (Nikko or Edomae) . She ordered the rainbow roll and the bagel roll. The rainbow roll didn't seem to have all that great quality of fish, some of it was chewy. The bagel roll was like a ground salmon that didn't have the typical salmon flavor she was expecting from sushi.  She's still convinced that the quality of Nikko's sushi is still superior.

YlvFSGehNdFk3JpNUB4Gig.text: Great sushi. Place is small but service is good and prices are right. Huge selection of food options.

rwyl9fp_IqJH5LWyKqVhGQ.text: We've only eaten here once so far but it was by far the best of all the sushi places we've tried since moving to the area. The rolls and sashimi we had were very good, my only complaint is the very crowded, tight space. We went early (5ish) which is fine with us but by the time we left it was a packed zoo. Not very enjoyable. If the sushi wasn't so good we wouldn't go back but it was so we will. Will def consider take out though and will continue our search for delicious sushi AND relaxing environment.

OhznkNv1Wkto1_TnSZDhcQ.text: I love New Zealand Cafe... is by far no the best sushi in Charlotte, but is always fresh and good... it is such a great place to visit, that I will stop for a quick bite if I am in the area

VnvpnCRMxMBUI4r90wuq8g.text: This is the best place for sushi in Charlotte... there is no room for argument... this is a fact. I live about a quarter mile from New Zealand Cafe, but I didn't know about it until a coworker of mine recommended it. It took me a couple of weeks to actually make it over there, but once I did I was hooked! I have been there 3x so far. It can get really crowded for dine in, so be sure to expect a wait.. a wait well worth it. Carry-out is also an option I have done a few times.  The sashimi bento box was delicious. The fish is very fresh and they roll the sushi right in front of you. They have $1 nigiri which is phenomenal and very high quality. The prices here are cheaper then most places and the sushi is better tasting and higher quality. My favorite rolls are the spicy tuna and the tempura rolls. I have a lot more to try!   5 stars

am_QvhzNbx7qwM58ziIs6Q.text: This place is one of the best sushi restaurants in Charlotte, and I have tried a lot of them. It may look kinda sketchy on the outside, but it is mucho bueno!  The place is pretty small, and sometimes you have to wait a bit, but believe me when I tell you it's worth the wait. Recommend the "boss roll".... Yum, yum and yum. Everything I have ever ordered here has always been great, I am never disappointed. Service is ok, friendly staff. I highly recommend this place. Very fresh sushi .

exqe2AiXAHBttzmFppJzfg.text: I've tried almost any and every place in charlotte that sells sushi and New Zealand has everyone of them beat!!! I've been going here for 10+ years now and have never had a bad experience.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yum!

5Y1Fvceq9RoSU8KPvzItDw.text: Hidden in a quiet shopping mall is a bustling sushi place that has boomed tremendously. I've always wanted this place to be my little secret but obviously its popularity has made it one of the best sushi places in the city.   It's nearly impossible to get a table here for dinner on the weekends; everyone is waiting outside. Hence, I try to come here for lunch (since they offer the same menu anyways). I always get the same things: vegetable tempura, salmon skin hand roll, and the boss roll. Oh yeah, the boss roll is my favorite. Great flavors with lightly battered tempura shrimp inside that's still crispy when they serve it to you. They are also very generous with the amount of salmon skin that they give you in their rolls.  Would I come back here again? Most definitely. The service here is outstanding as well and even though they're very busy, they make sure you're enjoying your meal and your drinks are refreshed. While I understand it's not Jiro's or any other fancy sushi hotspots, it is one of the best in Charlotte. Before you leave, you must try the fried ice cream as well! Crispy on the outside but chill and creamy in the inside.

eJoFNhUOzOjJVi4CqS_VdA.text: Waited to be seated for 40 minutes while they allowed people to come in and take tables without everyone in their party being there. One person sat at a table for 30 minutes before the rest of her party arrived. They have great food but customer service is just as important.

uEbIDi2S1nr-Rb4lnsU55g.text: Had the lunch at new zealand cafe one Saturday lunch.  Sat in front of the chef at the sushi bar.    After 10 mins of studying the menu, those pictures  does do a good illustration on their gigantic menu.  Tuna toro not available on the date we visit.  We order nothing but nigiri.  I hate rolls, especially those with all the sauces covering the rolls, that has no way to show the quality of the fish in there.  These are what we have strong comments on:  Marugai (geoduck), they gave us the tsubugai (conch). Hotate (scallop) was yellowish in color and dried.  Uni was bitter and brownish in color, very fishy smell.  (That indicates how long it has been sitting in their cooler) Others are not memorable, but overall is below average in freshness.  The waitress (owner) shows no interests in talking or having eye contact with customers.  Had yelled at the wait staffs couple of times.  The whole experience should warrant a 2 or 3 stars review.  But, the worst part was I had the diarrhea in the next two days.  I wish there is one decent quality sushi place in Union county.

8Juf0-Rj2yZqB4pikT27sA.text: My husband and I love coming here for date night!! The food is cheap, fresh and delicious! If your looking to avoid the swanky restaurant scene, I would highly recommend coming here. New Zealand Cafe offers a laid back atmosphere. The staff is very attentive to customers with allergies. Sadly my husband is allergic to shellfish, so he switches ingredients like shrimp for Imitation crab. I'm happy to report he's never had an outbreak here, and he loves the food.   I wouldn't recommend coming here for dinner, unless it's durning the weekday. Considering the restaurant is small, it's difficult to get a table. We typically arrive 10mins after they open, or order food to go.  I hope New Zealand Cafe opens another location one day!

VpaghG_kZlvtx1-2VVoDIw.text: The space is very small and tightly cramped! I always get my food To-Go and call ahead. It's usually ready within 20 minutes. This place is always busy. The sushi is amazing and I've been here several times now. The prices are very good for sushi. The hibachi is also good!

3p_kKLz2M398knsFRw_0oA.text: The food and service used to be good here but now is horrible. I called in an order and was told 40 min and an hour and a half later my food was still not ready. They gave us food that was not ours and then realized they hadn't made our food. Was told we would be given a refund but then only received a refund for one item which was the cheapest. You also have to continuously get bumped into while waiting because there is no room. Until they make changes I will not be back.

3yffulfl746nrVL80ILtyw.text: I always get my sushi from here. Sushi and sashimi combo with the soup and a side of ginger dressing. Their ginger dressing is soooo good. Unfortunately, the last time I had the dressing, it tasted very differently; more "mayo-y" than gingery. It's hard to explain, but I much prefer the former dressing. I took a star off for that and also because of the waiting time. These people get busy...like REALLY busy!! 95% of the time I order takeout and always leave about 10 minutes after they two me it's going to be ready, but when I get there I almost always have to wait an additional 10-15 minutes (sometimes even longer). Good things come to those who wait, so I don't really mind, but I'd just rather get told a more accurate time of when it'll be ready so I don't waste time sitting in a parking lot. Other than that minor thing the sushi is super good!!!!

Yn0A_nFsSreMIt4F4mNR6g.text: This place is a hidden gem!! I love the food, service, and prices!! They give you a free meal on your birthday! I will definitely be coming back!!

cwpWHhVoe69h3vQioKVHYQ.text: Dropped in this evening for the first time after having a craving for sushi .  After viewing the menu online via phone, I made up my mind.  There were a couple people waiting/hanging outside.  There was a line but it moved quickly.  They take debit and split tenders with cash.  I was told the wait would be 30 mins after I paid.  I used the restroom and sat in a chair in the hallway.  Quickly 30 mins went by and a waitress stopped to ask if I was dining in and I told her I had an order.  I gave her the order number and she never responded back about it.  Yet, she came down the hallway often (backway to kitchen?), checked low drinks at tables, and seated two sets of people from the hallway.  I was sitting in the first chair in the hallway yet felt I wasn't as important since I had takeout.  Then 45mins went by and I got up to ask a waitress passing through the checkout line.  She grabbed my bag which seemed to have been ready for a couple mins or while.  Needless to say the meal was delicious even the Spicy Tuna which was a second choice for a little something extra to complete my meal of the Sweet Dragon.  I brewed some Oolong tea at home.  I will return for the Bento Box but I will call my orders in for now on.  Please call out takeout order numbers or have a waitress notify people when they're order is ready.  I will check for weekly specials and deals.  I hope they'll open a bigger location or second location.  Too small of the business is normally like this.

OLrKZsv8YHcqVerrnGmmZw.text: Consistently good. You get a lot of food for the price. I always get the family chicken and it's delish

G-lX8bfN6oda2WSjhbRymA.text: Yummy! We have been here several times...sometimes busy but ALWAYS very tasty. We like the sweet dragon roll and the chicken and shrimp bento box. If you don't know what to get, then get that. Serves two. Delicious!

Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and shrimp bento box. A favorite of mine here, it&#39;s great.
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet dragon roll and spicy eel roll. The eel isn&#39;t that spicy but both are delicious!

0BFWxu8hNyu0B1LyqNxpxQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants!  Excellent food and atmosphere. Small place that is good on value and experience.

TmapJzJ9fC8atSzr1Xc0ow.text: Was looking for a good sushi place on this side of town. Saw the reviews of other and gave it a shot. My fiance and I got there just before 8pm. There was a 45 minute wait. Nothing to really complain about since it was a warm summer Friday night. After the wait we were seated at the sushi bar. My oh my....if you want to really see how a sushi restaurant works....sit near the sushi bar!!!! First thing I noticed was the 91 sanitation grade. Which isn't terrible but in no way is it great either. Second thing I noticed was how the employees who were taking orders, money and handing take out orders to paying customers, were also putting the new tickets they rang up, on the bamboo sheets thay are used for the creation of the sushi rolls and those bamboo sheets were never washed before being used. To make it worse, those tickets placed on the bamboo sheets by the cashiers often times touched the sushi rolls and the plates after the sushi chef made the rolls.  Disgusting. Your nasty money handling hands have just put a piece of paper you touched onto the clean plates. We also sat in front of a decorative lamp that my fiance mentioned was filthy. Now, on to the food. I ordered a few rolls for myself. A spicy tuna roll, a HOT roll, a Philly roll and another roll I cant remember the name of. All of the rolls tasted pretty good. Nothing to rant about. The creations were relatively basic and but decently fresh. My fiance ordered spring rolls which she said were great. For her entree she ordered the hibachi chicken. The first thing she said when she got her food was that the chicken was definitely frozen and tasted as such. She also said the flavors weren't as great as she expected. Staff was friendly. All in all I will not go back to this place. Cleanliness is the biggest drawback at this place.

9LBCs6XJYsEZF9NP0QMV5Q.text: I love their food, not a fan of their location. Its always super crowded and seating is just horrible. But I do have to say that the food is ridiculously amazing. I really do love coming here for the food and only for that reason. I wish they could relocate and get something bigger. You cant even walk in there. But everything I have eaten there is just to die for. Amazing food!!!

aKv0AufRyJg3lvR1SjZJlQ.text: The sushi here is great and I have been here many times but the last time I went the service was the worst I have ever experienced. Multiple people including myself were waiting on food for HOURS. After our appetizer it took 45 minutes for our food that wasn't cooked (sushi) to come out. Another note is that the restaurant was dead so it made no sense to take that long. I will never be coming back here I will take my business somewhere else. No one checked on us, apologized, nothing. Horrible service.

2riM24lk2bqg6H9ccfxoEQ.text: Only have taken sushi to go but really good. Restaurant feels a little dirty to me but again sushi is really good

KKBYau6mgkDjtJ6n3j-W3Q.text: I've eaten a lot of sushi and this place is great for the price! Family owned and a Charlotte staple for years!

h2oFApC1H6IW__bGip5K4A.text: The best sushi in Charlotte, the best I have ever had, and it is not close.  I have been going to NZ Cafe for 5 years or more and it is great every ... single ...time.  I have tried many of the rools, but live the tuna avocado and spicy tuna rolls.  I go with soy paper over seaweed and that's easily done here.  Service is great and prices are CHEAP!    I was a giant fan of Ru San in Dilworth for years.  Then Ru San picked up a poor score on the sanitary scale and that was the end of it for me.  NZ is always at "A", kinda critical for a sushi place (with a C, sushi becomes bait).

V2mjky-bUY00zOUfvGCNjw.text: Awesomeness! My only dislike is this place is tiny and so popular. Get here early so you don't have to wait. Other than that....OMG amazing!

vEihMjPa9cAlhKYm9c4o9Q.text: I had been looking forward to visiting this place after hearing how good the sushi was but I found the sushi to be just ok.  The place is quite small so timing is everything if you want to eat in.  I had the family chicken with mixed veggies, rice, salad, 2 shrimp, and 2 crab rangoons for $6.95, great deal for all that you get and it was pretty good.  I also had a crunchy lobster salad roll which looked great but it was way too chewy and the crunch was actually wet and mushy........yuk!  So, I'm not sure if that means the seaweed wrap was old or what but it was not cool.  The service was nice and friendly and it seems like a popular place but I doubt I'll return for a second visit.

Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Family chicken w/rice, shrimp, crab rangoon, salad for $6.95!

lqt2FTERYTxLqAiPYdddcA.text: There is no better sushi in this area of Charlotte.  Period.  When we lived in Elizabeth on the east side of uptown Charlotte, we would sometimes drive all the way to New Zealand Cafe simply because the sushi is that good, and the prices are low!  If you live in this area or just happen to be in the area and surfing Yelp for where to grab a bite, you have to try New Zealand Cafe!.  Very good sushi and extremely great pricing.

zB0P_iiGpADxR1vMQMyyYA.text: This place is amazing. The best sushi in town.  Made so fresh right on the front of you. The place is small so be ready to wait but the wait is well worth it. The owners are very nice and 1 of them is always there. I get the lobster roll and hubby gets the spicy tuna roll. Both are really good !!!

Z_Cagm0VHJbVk0KdDZ1efQ.text: This place had great sushi at affordable prices. The fish was fresh and the rice had good texture. The place is small but the service is good.  I will definitely be back.

ndCH9_Jm6Gql0Jmj1hq7ng.text: I am a bit of a sushi-head and in my opinion they have the best sushi in the Charlotte area! I kind of like that it is a hole in the wall type of place but at the same time wish they would buy out the place next to them and and make it larger. My #1 place to go when craving sushi!!!

uO-v0UgdPH3c24EIA9M9Ig.text: I absolutely love this place! The best sushi ever and even if someone isn't a fan of fish they have many other items to choose from. Excellent value!!

8AYsCpBLQI6La6Muhiregw.text: New Zealand Cafe is my go to place for Sushi for the past 8 years. They have never disappointed me in the quality of their sushi, taste or service. I love their cozy interior. Sometimes the wait is long, but there is always to-go available and they are always right and quick. They are amazing there! If you don't know what to get or are new to trying sushi the sushi chefs take very good care of you with their selections. They have other entrees available for the non-sushi lovers, but everyone that hasn't liked sushi, I have converted here. That is saying a lot! Love New Zealand Cafe!!!!

MozIZKRq3COFHNstzV9jUA.text: Wonderful little sushi place...and I do mean little. I had the crab salad and the app with spring rolls, dumplings and shrimp...amazing! Found out my Sister & Bro in-law are regulars. Great food, nice staff...we will be back. I do wish they had a better variety of drinks though. Wine, beer & soft drinks only.

cffRdaGnEnC6IdkDpZx_Qw.text: Average sushi, some creative rolls you won't see anywhere else. But it's SO crowded, we never go during prime dinner hours. And the strangest thing is there always seems to be at least six waiters, but service is always slow. Drink your drinks slowly, and ask for any extras all at the same time.

TnQKEKKNLy9SvDvLbL38Xg.text: Don't let the 4-star review fool you, this is my favorite sushi spot in Charlotte. I've been here several times, and will say that this place stays consistently excellent.   Although you may be tempted to go for the bento / cooked food - it tends to be way more affordable - stay True and stick to the sushi! The magic of NZC truly lies in their rolls. You can't really go wrong with whatever you choose, but my recommendations include the following:  -Negi Hamachi: Classic, delicious. -Super Spicy Roll: Spicy yellow tail, tuna, salmon, avocado, smelt roe  & scallions -Favorite Roll: Tempura shrimp, snow crab, avocado, spicy mayo, wrapped in soybean paper :)  This place is boss, give it a visit!

p5sFZlOCwBYAIsZV20JB_g.text: I was very surprised by this place. It had a great selection of food and it was delicious. I will definitely be going back. Also, try the fried banana. I'm not usually a fan of fried bananas but my girlfriend made me get it and I'm glad I did.

M9QzifB_WzFGoHkclE42HQ.text: My one complaint about this place is that it's too far from my home :(  I used to live closer and this is my favorite sushi in Charlotte by a long margin.  They are super consistent with their quality.  I've tried most of the major sushi players and there are others that are great at times, but they just don't have the consistency.  If you love sushi and you haven't been here, make it your next destination and you'll be impressed.  The place is small, and it's not fancy.  They deserve to be on a wait every night.

lDg-iphktOYuJXpSVYZShw.text: Awesome food. Very good value for the money. Sushi as fresh as can be and the meal trays can't be beat.

T4VuYzns5iIbSuwHH-4Q8w.text: When we arrived to the location, he said, OH OH, this is not going to be good, the outside look does not invite you to go inside, but this place was highly recomend for a friend, that we said, well let's try... Inside it looks much better...  The attention was really good, the ladies were really nice and check on us all the time.  The food, well, GREAT  food!! Fresh and tasty!!!! I highly recomend this place for a great sushi experience. I did not give 5 star because it took a while for them to bring our food.

6Mg1-tp5xNnz-1cG_Vy5xQ.text: The best value for sushi in CLT. Hesitant to write this review as if word spreads about this place, will never be able to get a table.  It is very small and just a shade above "hole in the wall" category.  The only place that rivals this is Enso, but prices there are 2-3x higher.

w7uX81XJ4t3PV3M3_QMyzg.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat. I've been coming here for years! The food is great and you can't beat the prices. The place is pretty small so it's always crowded but it's worth it for the food that you get.

5Y5xr3PgCLXbSXYq8kIoXQ.text: I don't know why I don't frequent this place more often, it's literally right across the street from me. Quick, friendly (sometimes a little scarily friendly) service, and inexpensive! Had an Ichiban Spicy Roll last time and it was tasty and spiced with sriracha. Also tried some sort of fried roll with a mayo based sauce, it was just aiite, and the Wasabi Salmon Roll that also had some sort of sauce that included sriracha, also, aiite.   Overall, pretty good for a sushi place in Charlotte, and just right in the budget range.    There can be a bit of a wait, even when you call ahead and are told there's no wait.

SQB89X04SDd7vPQd0UYFSw.text: This is my cheat day go-to from the herbivore diet. The sushi prices are phenomenal! The sake is great. The overall quality and quantities are worth your pennies. The customer service is hospitable and communitive. The only reason I gave four stars is becuase of the size of the facility. I dig the quaint appeal; the charm emphasizes the food. However there isn't much seating, making it snug on a packed night and you'll most likely have to wait. Nevertheless, the food is worth the wait and will distract you from the close corners. I don't think it's family-friendly - not that the atmosphere is too mature or the staff shuns from children, (they're really sweet toward the younger guests). Again, the size of the place that would make bringing your family rather awkward. But great for business meetings, hanging with friends, or date night. Go there this Friday night! You won't regret it!

JQ6d4udEya_y4msjtIFMZw.text: I hate to write bad reviews, but I am literally blown away with how bad the sushi was from here. My husband has been wanting to try this place for a while, so we took the opportunity to order a bunch of rolls from here since we have family in town.   First of all, when my husband called to place the order, they told him it would be ready in 15min....which seemed pretty fast for a Saturday night, but whatever. My husband shows up 20min later, only to end up sitting there waiting for the food to be ready for ANOTHER 55min (which means it was an hour and fifteen minutes from when he called, as opposed to the fifteen minutes he was originally told). Sadly, the odd wait and takeout situation wasn't even the worst part.  I've had really great sushi before (at a few different places in Charlotte), and I've also had really bad sushi. Now, I get that sushi taste can be sometimes subjective; but there are some things that everyone can agree are just bad. This food was one of those times. How do you screw up a shrimp tempura roll?? It wasn't even that it was takeout of a fried item, it was clearly WAY over cooked, and had brown avocado. Just nasty. And the rolls we had that contained tuna (or I should say were supposed to contain spicy tuna) actually looked like there was dried cheap canned tuna in them. When you spit a bite of something out, and throw the remaining entire roll into the trash, it's BAD. I've never been so embarrassed about our food choices before, but I was mortified that every persons sushi rolls were basically inedible. We ordered 8 rolls + a bento box...how you can have that bad statistical probability that all of it was that bad?   Which brings me to my question: how on EARTH were they as busy as they were, and how do they have 4stars on yelp, if their food is this bad?  I'm lost. But you literally couldn't pay me good money to eat here ever again. Sad.  Side note: because I'm desperately trying to find something positive about this place, their side sauces were good. Also, the way that they packaged up our order was very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

9kdq6MXharXBk1QFsdrMTA.text: Quaint place. They have an item they don't put on the menu called crunchy chicken and shrimp. It comes with a spring roll, crab rangoon, ginger salad and fried rice. My favorite!!!

jufFrspLLnEhkbGXgn8aEQ.text: My favorite sushi spot in Charlotte. It's off the beaten track, about 15 minutes outside the uptown area.   I cannot speak high enough of the quality of sushi from New Zealand Cafe. The food is always fresh and flavorful, the portions are big and the price is incredibly low for the quality of food you'll receive.   Everything from the basics--tuna avocado roll, California roll etc. to the more complex played--sweet dragon roll, bigger roll etc. are fantastic. I couldn't even list my favorites because it would be the entire menu.   Go!

U6cYwvolzQNo9WjO133pNw.text: This place has great Sushi at very affordable price.  I have not found other Sushi place that serves quality Sushi cheaper than this place.  Service is nice and personable.  The place is tiny so be prepared to wait (worth waiting) or order to-go (call in advance).  I have never had a bad experience at this place.  Don't let the location or the name to fool you.  It is a great place.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

b9J04P7q9VN-IrJg5Bh7wg.text: Best sushi in Charlotte hands down. I've tried almost everywhere in charlotte, this is by far the best place.  I've been coming here for years.

uSUa7ErO7uHvOksRbUIEvA.text: After completing my first dining experience at New Zealand Cafe, it's no wonder this place is so highly rated and raved about. It look's a little dive-y / hole-in-wall from the outside, but inside this place is a real gem.   I opted to go with the bento box so I could get a little taste of everything. The hibachi chicken box ($12.99) came with chicken hibachi, white rice, a California sushi roll, ginger salad, 2 pcs shrimp tempura, and a few tempura battered/fried veggies. What a steal!  The chicken hibachi was full of flavor and veggies. The sushi was fresh & the ginger salad had a great taste. The other sushi I saw coming out of the kitchen looked awesome, so I'll definitely give that a try next time. A real sushi gem the Sardis area.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento Box with chicken hibachi. $12.99

Fa4-qtey3vXLLE_27sOmmA.text: Tight space. Those are the two words you need to remember when dealing w/ New Zealand Cafe! Know that the best experience is squeezing yourself into said tight space to enjoy the ambiance of watching the sushi chefs prepare behind the counter glass && take an array of orders quicj

tARhQ1Ze7HpGmBjlOkWITQ.text: Food was amazing. Very fresh sashimi. Probably best I've had in CLT!  Service was good as well.  We will be back soon!  Thank you!!

zVbrWfjP0vfqJ0ADMapX7g.text: Consistently fresh food--everything from the sushi rolls to the seaweed salad to my mom's chicken teriyaki entree--at awesomely affordable prices.  I have yet to try their sashimi, which I'm hesitant to order at new places, but based on quality of dishes thus far, I'm excited to explore unchartered territory on my next visit.  Bonus points for friendly staff and speedy service, even when New Zealand Cafe has been packed.

Dmu24Ieu-HSsfALU_dBkPQ.text: I've heard rumors of a nondescript place around Costwold that served one of the better value sushi around.... they weren't joking.   New Zealand Cafe is nestled in a strip mall, the dining room is small and the decor is not super inspirational... but when it comes to their sushi they don't mess around. Since it's so small, they only have one sushi chef and it takes them a while to be served, but man is it worth it. The flavors are succinct and as imaginative as some of the other 'fancy' sushi places around, but the value here can't be beat. They are an old friend that you can always come back to for a nice conversation and a good time.   It's a very casual environment and the service is clean. During lunch try to come early because this place fills up to the gills... I'm sure to visit here again and again...

reOmx9HUhDiby6S9I5A3Ig.text: What can I say about New Zealand other than I LOVE it!  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it's difficult to get a table, or even to get to the counter to pick up a to go order, and I hate those hi-top tables.  But the sushi?? Excellent!  The staff is helpful and attentive and the menu has something for everyone.  If you don't like sushi, no problem, they have plenty of Asian dinners on the menu to satisfy anyone, and they give you lots of food.  If you have time to wait for a table it is well worth the trip.  I recommend going at odd times, like after the lunch rush or right after work for an early dinner.  You are less likely to have to wait the standard 30-45 minutes for a table.  I wish they would move to a larger location, but at the same time I worry that would affect the quality and pricing of their food.  I've tried other places, but always come back to New Zealand.  The freshness of the fish, inventive rolls, and value for your money can't be beat.  If I have friends visit from out of town, I always take them to New Zealand.  It's a hole in the wall gem that most people, who aren't familiar with them, would drive by.

o3vIG5tPBm0oEu2NwNulYA.text: This is a great sushi place in Charlotte! I'm so sad I only discovered this place after 15 years of living here... Anyway, I wouldn't say this spot is a secret - it gets super busy. And by super, I mean a 2 hour wait on a Wednesday night. Well, technically it was like an hour wait to even get seated. Once inside, I realized that this place is pretty small and cozy, so seating is limited. We chose to sit at the bar because spots opened up. We ordered 4 rolls to share amongst 5 people. Our server was friendly but it still took a long time for food to come.. almost an hour I'd say. It was interesting to see the talented and very speedy sushi chefs crank out rolls, but at the same time it was sad just wondering if they were finally making ours and watching the plates being whisked away. I think they felt bad that we were waiting so long, so they put 4 of our rolls onto a sushi boat without us asking. I think my favorite roll was the big boss roll (it's their most popular one), and the discovery roll was also good. All the rolls were unique and flavorful. I never really tend to opt for the more traditional options so I can't really speak to those. Their selection is quite expansive.  Honestly, this place should expand to a bigger space - I think that's their main problem right now. I would come back again in a heartbeat, but I'd advise coming here early or else you'll likely be hangry like us. Quite a few people called and got their order to-go, which is also a smart move.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. big boss, catepillar, spider, discovery rolls
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

Shk2Wqzm5fUXpRVHSyCJnA.text: This place is a hidden gem! I had never had sushi before coming here, but I'm glad I made New Zealand my first stop! The sushi is so delicious and affordable- they even have $1 and $2 pieces. I recommend the Crunchy Eel roll or the H.O.T. Roll!  They also have different meals to choose from that you would find in a normal Chinese restaurant and you get a lot of food for the price- I recommend the Queen City Chicken- which is their take on sesame chicken.  If they're busy, seating is a little cramped because it is a small space, and it can get a little loud will all those people in such a tiny area.   I've been several times and the food & service are always great! Definitely will be my go to sushi spot!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

I-Emz4lYi9p5b5lV_NokgA.text: Love this place. Great sushi and good service. My wife and I have been here numerous times! However - only thing that bothers me is the size of the restaurant. I believe it is time to expand! A bigger location will definitely help their growing clientele.

_IYqoeO9lGxrJfjXT22dXw.text: Doesn't look like much from the outside, but the food is really good.  Biggest complaint is the wait can be long.  Local gem, hole in the wall type place.  Great sushi!!!

BABuIa4PRGcX5j5OQABGNA.text: We had been looking for a place that provides fresh sushi like we had back in our home state, and this place was "close". It is undeniable that New Zealand Cafe is a very busy and popular restaurant. But "busy" is not always a good sign; sometimes it just means there are a lack of other restaurants of high quality. Such is the case with New Zealand Cafe. It is a good restaurant with good food, but it stops there.  The food seemed fresh, but it was not like, "oh my God this is so fresh!" kind of feel. When you taste really fresh food, your taste buds will scream for joy! Again, food was good, but not "OMG I can't wait for another bite!".  I wanted to give this place five stars, but it fell short in a couple of areas: (1) service was fast, but not friendly; (2) if you like fake crab meat in your sushi, this is your place; (3) the soda dispensing machine is right next to the bar and some tables; this is constantly in use, inhibiting your privacy at your table plus the fact that constantly falling ice is noisy. It should be re-located away from the customers' dining experience.  I would not say the restaurant fell flat. Rather, it fell short of what we had hoped and read. If more sushi places were available, I don't think New Zealand Cafe would be as busy as it was, unfortunately.

tP9BDltuShvf5XaEM2uLow.text: Serious sushi fans are always stunned by this small spot tacked in the corner of a Harris Teeter shopping center. Excellent fish quality and delicious rolls. My favorite is the Christmas roll (available year around). The best value is the daily special which is bento meal for $6.95. Amazing value!

H6Awpqf8t0Bn78Jrtb6x6w.text: New Zealand is my all time favorite sushi spot in the Queen City. I always enjoy the quality of the fish, the grand size of the rolls, and the undeniable flavor. Although the restaurant is small and a little crammed, I will always return for a delicious sushi meal at New Zealand!

iIS7QlrLQslM63uPDnO-mw.text: Fun place. Small so be prepared to wait. Everyone loves this place. Great menu. Large selection. Delicious food.

djfcSRUNxNz2UT0VP3o-Jw.text: We took a drive to check this place out after hearing about it from friends.  It is extremely affordable when it comes to sushi, hence the 4 stars.  The sushi was good, not amazing, but again, we didn't spent the normal $80 for two people which usually happens with my sushi-obsessed husband.  The best deal here are the meals!  For $6.95 you get your meal (we got chicken teriyaki) which includes actual chicken breast and fresh veggies, rice, salad and two small fried appetizers.  It's served on this giant tray- great value for the money!  If we are in the area we'd go again, but not driving the 20 minutes again.

I0RwoRN90UgNOUerlhd6Ew.text: This is probably some of the best sushi I have ever had. Fresh, incredibly flavorful.  There is usually a wait, but as soon as you get the food, it makes up for it. If you are looking for authentic Japanese food, you NEED to come here!!

cUAEPdPhnrzMreYZjRobNA.text: Sushis ok our server was really nice but we didn't like the caterpillar roll and we told her we felt really bad but we just didn't like it and we wanted to order something else our server was super nice about it and said she was just gonna let the manager know when the manager came up to she asked what was wrong and we told her that we just didn't like it and it wasn't what we were expecting and that we were sorry and she told us very Rudely that next time we should just get a piece  to try and not do that again and she was very angry and rude and when  we told her we would like to see the menu to get other stuff she rolled her eyes at us and angrily walked away and told our server to get us menus, after being treated like that from her I just wanted to leave don't think I'll be coming back and I hope she fixes her attitude !

02NTWxM9o55nRT7vTsHouQ.text: Years ago I was in this shopping center and I looked at New Zealand Cafe Sushi and I thought to myself that place looks like it would be sketchy.  It looked like it was a large space and would have a lot of televisions.    Fast forward a couple of years, some good Yelp reviews and an invitation from friends, well maybe I should give it a chance.  The place is tiny, it has about 9 tables and 4 seats at the sushi bar with a bunch of televisions. Televisions are in the darndest places. The food is delicious.  There is more to offer than sushi, but I have only been twice and sushi is the only thing that I order.  I might go as far as saying it is my favorite sushi restaurant.  Every roll has been delicious, well, except for one.   Tonight we ordered a California roll with tuna and the tuna was mushy on top, my husband said it was like cat food.  That was a bit disappointing, but not enough to make me deduct a star and certainly not enough to keep me from returning.  My favorite roll tonight had diced jalapenos and it was burn the baby hot. It made me cry tears of happiness. Booooohoooooo.

7Gy_39p9qSfnQMBUf03_Vg.text: I have NO idea why people are raving about this place!  It may be cheap, but it is NOT good sushi.  It is not fresh, it is not cold, it is just not good sushi.  It may be the worst sushi rolls that I have ever had.  I would not go back here!!

XpRzuL-LYfoJ679O0d-MPg.text: Sashimi Bento Box was good. It could be better but for the cheap price I paid it was worth it. Toro & Ikura nigiri were splendid! The food service was quick! The atmosphere here is great too... Very casual but good. I will definitely come back.

OYDINcQo3G9FrBue2-wK4g.text: I posted a review about this place before, but after going last night for the 3rd day in a row... YES it's that good... I had to post more.   I've come to realize that New Zealand will always have a wait when you get there, no matter what time of day. The reason, it's THAT good. People have waited 30 minutes or longer for a table at this place. I should know because I am one of those people, and I'd wait even longer if I had to just to get inside to eat.   For those who are hungry now, call in a take out order, that way you can run inside to grab your grub and be on your way. I just love this place, and every time I've gone I've gotten the same thing. I order a tray with the honey chicken and shrimp & it's enough to make me start drooling at my desk just thinking about it again.   Well, last night I decided to go to try the sushi after my friend twisted my arm a bit. She said, "You can't go to New Zealand and not try the sushi!!!" I informed her that, yes I could, and I did it often. But, she was right.   I ordered a tasty roll, which is salmon, cream cheese, and some other concoctions lightly fried. I almost fell backwards in my chair and passed out because the taste punched me in my face. God parted the clouds and a beam of light blew up my taste buds when that sushi entered my body. I swear to you, I've NEVER had better sushi than this in my life... and I'm a gal who enjoys her sushi.   I'm convinced that there is nothing bad you can order on their menu. It is just insane how good the food is here. The prices are beyond reasonable, the taste is fantastic, obviously and it's in a close proximity to my house. But if it weren't I wouldn't care, I'd drive an hour to eat here. Oh New Zealand, I heart you a bunch.

ieZXUQapCsrni9VwyKT3CQ.text: It is located in the Harris Teeter shopping center,next to the "Chinese Food" sign. Tiny restaurant,the lightning is a little dark,limited seating and yes the tables are really close to each other. It feels a little uncomfortable.  The sushi is really average, it taste like grocery store bought sushi,except it's not cold. Most of their rolls are deep fried.  The quality of food and price are both lower compare to other sushi restaurants. I would maybe just order take out from time to time if I'm feeling cheap and need a quick sushi fix.

YFq8i9zOu7qxLdwgT2uMIw.text: Amazing sushi! But takes forever to get in any night of the week. Monday's, Tuesday's it doesn't matter. Get here early!

to95gd06qaTPtbJhoX91Yw.text: Sushi is great! But the wait is crazy long even if you call in for carry out. Dine in is hard because it's always jammed and you have to shuffle around people. If you have small children, you probably can't eat here because the tables are really jammed close together and they don't have booster seats available. Most tables are bar stool height, so it would be really hard to eat as a family here unless you have bigger children.

1mdaTvD_S73CeyhycJjoFw.text: Excellent lunch location - quick and really spot-on sushi and nigiri. The Century Roll and Unagi were particularly tasty.

N2wrxwjd25QmQvF3HWDCIQ.text: If you are looking for affordable sushi, this is the place. With that being said, the quality is okay. You get what you pay for!

Txe2sriPhUPzjX4t16W1-g.text: My wife and I love this place. This is our go to sushi place in Charlotte. The wait is always long but it is well worth it. I keep telling everyone I k ow about New Zealand and how amazing the sushi Rolls are. If you want great sushi come here. Best place in Charlotte in my opinion.

FjIjyl1VcAmpoka7Tchn_Q.text: The food is good but the atmosphere is not so good. I think this is a good takeout place but I would not recommend if you're looking for a quiet, intimate or semi private dining experience. The tables are super close together and they packed 20 tables into a space designed for 10.   Will try again when they expand.

Most of their dinner entrees are under $10. Seriously, this place is wonderful, I highly recommend trying it out.  P.S. Place is small so you may wait, but it's worth it!

o9Fzke1MWhvXdQdwTqptyg.text: Great service! Plenty of choices. I wouldn't say five star sushi quality. However, the price and variety make it completely worth it!

krrDz7t6KSkqn6lbTvrvgQ.text: Affordable?  Yes.  Fresh?  Mostly.  Cramped?  Yup.  Slow?  Absolutely. Worth it?  Depends on how much you like sushi.  Those that rave about this place really don't know quality sushi.  Harsh perhaps, but True.  I went all nigiri here; I appreciate that all fish has its Japanese name, even though the server couldn't understand my white-guy pronunciation.  Anyways, some things I tried were fresh, some were clearly thawed from frozen.  Some items that I ordered were subbed out, (e.g. I ordered ama ebi, got ebi...that'd be like ordering raw tuna, and receiving fried catfish).  and some simply were not served (where's the hamachi)?    It was by no means terrible, and for the price I would go again, but don't expect to get blown away here.  NZ cafe is affordable sushi in a strip mall, no more, no less.

Y23ILyeD-g6dxtC80e4MVw.text: I'm a regular at this place because of it great sushi rolls and onion soup. The other evening on my visit my spring roll was cold when u bit into it. I didn't cause a commotion just requested another one. The owner gets a attitude because I sent it back. She took it upon herself to be a waitress for the remainder of the evening. OMG the service was dry, we were RUSHED and she didn't apologize nor said thank you after returning with my receipt. I don't think I'll be returning...

0OEkdxYmiwcVG6SHeglgMA.text: I have very mixed feelings about this place. I love sushi and think the sushi here is pretty good and the rolls are creative. However, the place is realllly small and cramped and the service dining in is mediocre. Take out service is awful, they tell you 25 minutes on the phone and you end up waiting up to (or even longer than) an hour. Last time I was here I waited for my take out order over an hour and when I asked for a second time if it would be much longer (politely, but I'm sure you could detect slight irritation in my voice) I was told very rudely that it would come out soon and to sit down and wait......like excuse me? At least apologize that I've been here for over an hour...or just don't snap at me! Personally, I would rather go somewhere with decent food and better atmosphere.

kwha7MdbhJiekEY2wtx4QQ.text: By far, a sushi gem in Charlotte. We ordered the sushi boat and it was amazing! One of the best sushi spots, fresh, creative decor, and delicious. With that said, why not a five star review, unfortunately the service is somewhat slow and the location is small, so on a crowded night, there is a wait...with no bar or seating area. With that said, we will be back.

jV67uuftZuE7YbYcUQYX1A.text: This restaurant is WONDERFUL!  I have been here multiple times and have never been dissatisfied with my service.  My only complaint would be that they are always busy and the seating is very close to other patrons.  Despite this fact, I still love it here!  The food is amazing and hot, the waitresses are amazingly friendly, and they are quick!  I have tried several dishes on their menu and none have been dissatisfying.  My favorite on the menu would be the thai chicken curry.    The prices aren't bad either.  ;-)

kpDAH3gjK9GtgMQZfuVmUA.text: Long wait, but the fried oyster roll is so worth it!!!!!! The best sushi in Charlotte!

r4qz_zdj5V35t10DllZwnw.text: Great hole in the wall. I have been to many sushi places from NYC to Chicago even LA. This place is an awesome must try place. Very small cafe location but looks can be deceiving. Would highly recommend for someone looking for a casual dress sushi spot in Charlotte.

2l-c_3oOS7oztzrHXNh6zA.text: I want to give this place a bad review so people will stop going here so this place will be less crowded. But I think it's too late. Secret is out. This place is awesome.  Even though this place is very small and can be very crowded the wait for a table or food is never too long.  Sushi menu really delivers and the bento box are always a solid choice.

bpOE1VqhrjOxyu3rgPSlCw.text: This place is snappy, fresh and has awesome customer service!  Every time I've been here around 6pm or later durring the week I've been seated very quickly.  I've gotten the Crispy Tuna Roll, Volcano roll and the New Zealand Chicken a couple times. All thier food is of very high quality and tastes fresh.   The host, servers and all of the sushi staff are very nice, accommodating, and are very knowledgeable about the menu.   You will not be disapointed. This place is so good and is a almost a hidden gem!

JLH94e8yZdNmmrBkk1533g.text: Great sushi at great prices. It's a little hard to find in the strip mall but it's well worth it. It's small so go on off times or early.   We ordered a lobster roll and tuna roll. Both were fantastic. Fresh. Crunchy. Flavorful.   My new favorite sushi place.

HacrU9vPOHpKW9XIKq4kjw.text: Cilantro roll is not on the menu but GREAT! Also their "Thai Hot Sour Soup" is to die for. Was not impressed with the Mango Chicken platter-- the sauce makes the chicken mushy.

sjTcrtgd6tw2WHHCpRrFbA.text: I love the soup, salad, and rice here! It's very tiny, and sometimes has a long wait, but is worth it!

VBpfbaJPCnWvtvn0TqJ5VA.text: *Poor Customer Service.  They got the order wrong and refused to admit that our order was missing an entire roll when we called back insinuating that we were lying. Sushi was above average but the terrible service left a bad taste in my mouth.

Should always ask for the high tables if you want some privacy because the middle tables are way too close to one another that it feels like you are dining with strangers (and yes..they could hear all of your conversations)

-4yXLFrrLZc_KMdo6uG3TQ.text: Best sushi.  Great staff!  Love this place.  It is small, so, you go during peak dining hours, be prepared to wait.  It's worth the wait!

W2IuuwPOhs8-GOAHvxLPwA.text: Visiting from out of state.  A couple of friends wanted to eat here. I thought ok. The waiter wasn't friendly at all. Didn't seem to know much about the menu.  Seemed to be annoyed because I wanted to do a substitute.  Food came out.  The teriyaki chicken was coated very well in the sauce.  I wouldn't comeback.

7IFYyKtKl-1jkU5cnU_YLA.text: I was one of those "I hate sushi people.  Until I was forced to eat at new Zealand.  Delicious. I recommend take out because the restaurant is always packed

47ItphgaFrH4KokIEDXv-g.text: My friends and I stumbled on this place while in the area and looking for something to eat. This place was surprisingly good for a hole in the wall joint. I ordered a Big Boss roll and it was beautiful, fresh and delicious. The service was fast and curtious. I would recommend.

Csamudi9z6P5jE20uFNf-Q.text: Very good food that is inexpensive. Nice to find a gluten free spot near the movie theater.

S8ZSTqp4GS61a_hG-ufoYA.text: New Zealand Cafe?  The name totally confused me when I visited a business a few doors down to get some signs made.  I thought "what do they eat in Australia?"  Then a friend suggested that I try it out for sushi.  I don't so sushi so again, went about life.    Well, I've tried it now twice and while I haven't tried the sushi, the other dishes are great.  This place is pretty cool.  It's in a divey plaza wedged into the corner next to a take out chinese place and something else on the other side.  They have a sushi bar and about a hand full of high top 4 place tables and a few lower ones in the middle.  I've been in larger walk-in closets.    The food is good...really good.  I ordered a lettuce wrap and it was exactly what I wanted.  Why can't more places do a decent lettuce wrap?  The hibachi chicken was a little unexpected.  It came in a bento box-like contraption with rice in the corner, the chicken the veg in the center, more chicken on skewers, salad in another corner and even two crab rangoons (I guess - who knows how it's spelled...and I know what you're thinking "Why not just use google to find out how to spell it!..."  I just did and it is rangoon".  You sushi people, don't fret. I'm sure someone else had that and thought it was good.  If you order a lot of sushi, they bring it out in a boat which is pretty cool.    I grew up thinking that Japanese food required a bunch of pageantry and pantomime but I don't want that.  I want some rice or noodles, some lettuce and veg that's crisp and some meat prepared properly.  This place get's it for me.  Definitely one to put in the rotation.

BIi-cxvTTlDtWXFVex2leA.text: The sushi is on point. I had been hearing about this place for a while. Had the chance to stop in for lunch. I ordered the Itchibon Roll, it was over the top good! I have been back 3 times since. Great staff also, GO THERE NOW! !!!

JzASzThXIPcukfMAh_qRkw.text: This was my second visit here , dont let the outside fool you its a hole in the wall lol The food is amazing you can get Sushi or Bento box an its much food an such a great price.  My friend ordered the sushi she loved it an I had bento box with sweet n sour chicken, crab ragon, salad, egg roll I ate it all lol  The staff is very friendly they also have a small bar. If your in the area make a stop you wont regret it.

PileOAfajD1qzlIwzuW3Hw.text: This location is incredibly small, they had people crammed in the hallway to the bathrooms waiting for a table. I would highly recommend they seek a larger establishment. The hostess greeted us immediately and was incredibly sweet. Unfortunately, that was the only positive thing I could say about this place. The sushi was mediocre and not very flavorful at all. My boys had the chicken teriyaki bento boxes and the chicken tasted like frozen chicken from a bag. The spicy tuna rolls weren't spicy at all and the sushi was poorly wrapped. Although fairly priced, I'm seeing you truly get what you pay for. I was greatly disappointed in this restaurant, especially after reading such great reviews.

nTlaxqM1L5zRMsvBzJ87xw.text: Coming from the west coast we really Missed the convenience, quality, and cost of sushi.  We tried a few places and were left unimpressed by the quality and the prices here are crazy.    Then we found NZC. This place is great. The sushi is always excellent and the staff is always pretty quick.  This is our go to spot and the closest thing Charlotte has to Offer to the west coast.    The only downside is that the restaurant is a bit small so it can be quite a wait at peak hours.

Yv2AtMzNEPfx5QnCTzjJew.text: This was a win for us. We recently went here because it seemed like a good compromise for us (I like sushi and my fella likes more stir fry / Chinese dishes). We got there and were sat at one of the tiny tables in the middle of the restaurant. I felt really close to the people next to us but was okay with it. We got there just in time because there ended up being a wait and quite a bit of congestion with to go orders.   We started with pan fried potstickers. Only one side of the potstickers were crunchy and the other side had a steamed consistency.  I liked them and my boyfriend thought they were just okay. For our meals, I ordered the tasty roll and big boss roll. My boyfriend got the fried pork chop meal. I loved the big boss roll and the tasty roll was okay but a bit too heavy for me and I only ate a few pieces. I don't fault the restaurant for that, I am just not the biggest fan of fried rolls. My boyfriend loved his meal and all of the sauces that came with it. He said he would definitely get it again.   I took one star off because it's just sooooooo small and congested. That said, we really liked it and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pork with plum sauce
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tasty roll (we already ate a piece) and big boss roll. Big boss roll was by far the better of the two.
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pan fried potstickers

HYcRaVEo2flnGNZ4WZ69Qw.text: The best if the best! You will have a hard time finding better sushi in Charlotte! Such a small place though the wait can be long but they are also great for take out!

KTK8LEWXN6pFKchCk15auw.text: This place is great! We come here often, never had a bad experience. The food is consistent. The sushi is what this place is known for, but do not sleep on the bento boxes. They are under $8, for a nice combination of food.  New Zealand is really small, so get here early or be prepared to wait.

Bm8e5iqYVHnVgND5_LIOOw.text: My wife and I went here for the first time yesterday after hearing all the hype around this place.    Not sure if it was an "off" day but it was hands down some of the worst service we've ever had, despite ordering nothing cooked (all sushi).  Our entire meal took 2 hours.  There was a 45 minute gap in between our appetizer (soup/salad) and our main entree (sushi).  The restaurant seemed more interested in fulfilling the take-out orders rather than attending to the dine-in customers.  The sushi itself was okay - not totally blown away by it.  Very disappointed.

eUrLzQla18UDRDQykfwmkw.text: Their fresh, melt-in-your mouth Uni and beautiful Toro are always a favorite. The servers at this place are absolutely wonderful. The sushi chefs at this place really are artists!  The wait can be very long with no place to wait but outside because of the small dining room. Hopefully the owners will see their success as an opportunity to expand so the diners aren't so cramped. Also, the wine list really needs a makeover.  The Uni is worth the wait!

sSBKnZzSJ4UNH3nP9Xx3zQ.text: So delicious! Tried it for the first time today and the spicy salmon and eel avocado was delicious. I've been hearing about this place for a while and it was totally worth the drive from Huntersville! I wish they would open a location up here! I have tried so many sushi places around north Charlotte and central Charlotte and this is hands down the best one. Nothing in north Charlotte/Huntersville area is that good, just tolerable for my sushi cravings. This place is Small but so fresh, great prices, I will def be making the 40 minute drive more often! This is what I have been looking for, too bad it's so far away!

ueqxB8ehk0y1hLw8Pt-uVA.text: This place is great!!!! Never had bad service. It's very small but makes you feel cozy

fy9itbZbE3cPoK5fVX_Oqg.text: Best Sushi in Matthews- found by sheer luck. A hidden gem that never disappoints. Food is always fresh, and offers a variety to meet many people's interests. Very reasonable in prices

cFUFurMZ1NJ0DX5bC7dIdA.text: I'm from Charlotte and can't believe I waited this long to try this place. I know it's been around for years. The sushi was delicious and so affordable! I came with friends and we all loved what we got. Service was great and we were lucky to nab the last big table during our visit.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

eE5w0tcbFfQDhApjyJMaHA.text: 100% amazing! Worth everything , money, time and being crammed into the small space! I know that sounds negative but the food is so good! We order take out a lot to avoid the wait time and being squished in the restaurant but honestly it's apart of the experience

GbPXKTH1Lwmd3ZgO8O52_w.text: Wow, just wow. For a hole in the wall restaurant in a strip mall who would've thought you could get this kind of quality sushi?? So the bad...the place is packed and you'll have to wait, once you get seated be prepared to wait some more. This place has a very high demand for take out, I'm assuming via phone orders...so even though they have a full staff making sushi non stop the wait for your food is going to be longer than what most people would be accustomed to. Now, why is this still 5 stars?? Because the quality and price for the sushi is unheard of! Excellent specialty rolls, high quality nigiri and sashimi and all for a very affordable price. Try everything you won't be let down!

6mggyaY1XOnzmp6OVpgi3A.text: We have been here numerous times, the sushi is very good and the prices are fair. So why not 5 stars?   While the food and prices are good this by far is one of the most uncomfortable restaurants I've ever eaten in. If you are seated in the strip of tables down the middle of the place you are literally shoulder to shoulder with the other people seated next to you.  Everyone is on top of each other, there is no room. It's so small people wait outside for their name to be called for a table. No big deal unless it's 40 degrees outside like last Friday. People stand there with the door open to give the hostess their name, people are constantly coming in and out getting takeout, the hostess holds the door open while calling out names to be seated and so on and so on. It's like sitting outside and it's ridiculous.   As much as we like the food the actual setup of the restaurant is just plain awful to the point that it's just going to be take out from here on out.

m4u4j-aL2xKYEeHYnN8jLQ.text: Yum! This place is tiny and almost always packed. But that's because it's delicious. I would eat here every day if I could. Love it!

CyZxKXmG9jpQIbkwIXkcQg.text: Not sure how this place doesn't have 5 stars. The sushi is hands down the best in town and they have the awards and praise posted on their walls to prove it. Not a whole lot of seating area and the place is small, but I think that is what makes this place just a cool little hole in the wall with 5/5 sushi.

lJER8I1ABhJ2gEXb_Hg-Hw.text: The service was great and the food exceptional. We were a party of four and there was a wide selection of dinner choices allowing us to all try something different and share.  We'll definitely be back!

UmXYiSFWL88cg3qrnsaX7w.text: Been coming here for years. Great hole in the wall restaurant for sushi or any other Asian fusion dish. Best sushi in town and also best value, very afordable. Get there early as it has a small dining room and there are always lines out the door. Staff and owners are also great people and very friendly.

LUWs5GvOlYd8pucuHpILmQ.text: Have brought friends and family here and they all agree that New Zealand is the best in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. The boat tonight!
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. My husband &amp; I love the atmosphere, the food, and the people. Jackie, the owner-chef is the best!

9z0tyBGUYQTkUMiL5LKSlQ.text: I love you, New Zealand Cafe. Wanna make a sushi baby with you. Don't go anywhere else in/around Matthews for sushi. Or else...

_e09M2qT2O6GYHnvHZ0aXg.text: Oof.  Came here on the high opinions of others, but found the sushi to be severely disappointing.  Buddies and I ordered a boatload of sushi and most, if not all, was not fresh.  It was on the cheaper Monday night and I'm assuming that the reason it's priced so low is because it is the leftover sushi from the high volumes they probably move on the weekend.  It only makes sense that they charge like a dollar for a piece bc the sushi isn't as fresh.  I probably won't be back bc I really wanted good sushi and didn't like it very much here.  If there are other recommendations, pls suggest away.  dmo out.

NFAJLmTP_KnHq1OB99Dxeg.text: Definitely the best Sushi (so far) in NC. I've had amazing Sushi/Sashimi back in NYC so I might be a little jaded with what's here in NC. I will definitely say that this place is my goto for Japanese! Still very trendy and crowded, so plan to wait.

lu2orfxCuqd_DZqKegZyZw.text: I'm going to give this place a 4.5 and an extra .5 star for the wait staff enthusiasm.  Have to agree with most of the reviews of this place since it is very unassuming and located in a strip mall.  The place has a lot of charm and personality and I am really glad it is in my neck of the woods.  I can totally see myself becoming a regular here.  I had the Tuna Crunchy Roll and the Sweet Dragon Roll which were both outstanding for the price.  We did have a little bit of a wait because there was a huge sushi order prior to ours... It was pretty amazing to see 4-5 sushi boats filled to the brim be delivered over to a 4 person table.  They ended up not finishing everything and having 3 full size take home boxes of sushi!  Maybe they were bringing them over to an adult baseball league afterwards...  It was a ton of sushi.   Can't wait to go back and sample more rolls and maybe a bento box or 30.  The menu took a while to read through, but I'm sure all the options are just as good as what I ordered.  The wait-staff was very warm and inviting... one of the waitresses in particular recognized some regulars and it was hard not to be swept up in her enthusiasm.  Definitely hard to find positive people like that now a days especially in a tough position serving others.

TkYWaOcYIGRCNgkmNeBkJA.text: I love this place. The BEST SUSHI IN MATTHEWS! They are very far price for their food and they have a really friendly staff . I would eat here everyday if I could.

i3voBF6SOv9YBqOlCNLptA.text: I am always pleased with this establishment. Portions are great. Service is fast. Prices are good. Fish quality is good. Rolls are tight and keep together. Roll size is large but not too large for your mouth. Great carry out and nice relaxed atmosphere for dine in. There is one middle aged skinny Asian waitress that will rush you for your carry out or dine in order so if you get her be warned. The other staff is fantastic. The middle aged sushi chief has been there forever and knows what he is doing. Be sure to tip him and look for his big thankful smile and genuine gratitude while he nods in courteous gesture.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. My carry out was delightful. Rainbow roll and crunchy spicy tuna. Yum.

fNw4oRD3sMbqqmJPdG970w.text: YES. JUST YES. best sushi evvvveerrrrr. You can get an AMAZING philly role for just $5!!! Small seating so be ready to wait a bit on weekends. Very cool sushi bar that you can sit at!

x7qNScelu09Q9Z5Od22j7Q.text: Only okay. Cheap sushi, garlic noodles were dry and tasted nothing like garlic. I wouldn't go back.

D2pN8ltOOVAOX_mjbozaAg.text: AMAZING SUSHI!!!! Wonderful service! Only issue is, don't come super hungry because you will have to wait on a weekend as it is VERY busy. But it's only that busy because the sushi is so wonderful and so cheap!

yn-H2P0G1B9HI9YxOYyb8w.text: This is a difficult review. 4 star sushi & prices...ZERO for customer service & wait time..not our 1st time here..and every time is at least a 1 hour (don't take reservations) wait (if you're lucky)...tonite tipped the scale to never coming back..EVER!! Front of house was so far out in the weeds! After 40 minute wait time,  was told at least 30-40 min longer still wait time..Great spot that needs a much larger space for eat-in customers..judging by wait time for eat-in & volume of take out, they could easily support a larger place..sorry New Zealand, we are done with you

crMG_ppYkU3jL0i2MapfIA.text: Kudos to my fellow Yelpers that drew me here. New Zealand Cafe is a small, cozy sushi joint tucked away in the strip mall. What I like the most is their wide selection of both hot foods and sushi.   Maybe it is the Japanese hospitality, but the servers were all extremely nice.   For sushi, I had a tuna hand roll, tuna, Iidako (baby octopus), salmon roe and tamago nigiri. They all lived up to my expectations. On top of that, they even gave me an extra baby octopus!   On the benzo side, everything was very standard, well-executed. I would highly recommend the black pepper steak.   Overall it was a good experience, and I'll be back soon.

f2JfX36yfxV-OdR920ilRQ.text: I've been coming here for years. I love their food - Asian-style, "fusion," even. If you come at peak dining hours, be prepared to wait. It's a "cozy" joint, but well worth the wait. The sushi is ALWAYS superb, and there's always a chef's special of the day to try. There's a variety of Asian beers and sake to try (and I love hot sake). Everyone is very friendly and the service is fast (although, they get very busy at times, especially on the weekends, which can affect the speed a little). Everyone I know, who's been here loves this place.

1H1K7Wq1fH88mJ7ZTHy6Cg.text: Place is small but it is GOOD! My new favorite sushi spot!

QhLYlhgZfiPXRg9B9SkhIw.text: This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Charlotte. They have an amazing selection of all different types of sushi and Asian inspired dishes. The restaurant itself is on the smaller side so there might be a wait if you come with larger parties. Prices are unbeatable, sushi is amazing, service is great..what more can you ask for? NZC definitely delivers.

gbjE-BVzVozvJllmZlejZg.text: This is hands down the best sushi in Charlotte. Get the boat! You get an amazing amount of sushi for a great price. The only downside is the wait--the restaurant is SMALL.

SnRwmv-opdkYc2Y44ujlvg.text: Good sushi and Bento boxes. My wife is gluten free and always gets the Hibachi Chicken with gluten free soy sauce and substitutes the shrimp tempura with additional California roll.

ab5n1pJNMfdslnn_HMrMcQ.text: Not over the top amazing like some people are commenting. Not in my opinion at least. And the wait....the sushi is definitely not worth it.

dSh52oSkQspjOrTIuAj2JA.text: Delicious sushi! Great service. Most likely, best sushi in town. My husband and I go there very often

JZUbDMN9nKzwzizCarbdjQ.text: I have been on the hunt for good sushi places since I moved to Charlotte from AZ / SoCal. This is my all time favorite place. As close to west coast sushi as you can get and some of the rolls are better then what I get in San Diego. The servers are always nice and I sit at the sushi bar to bs with the sushi chefs. If I could give them more stars I would.

gfS8b7JHtnCX4aePBUAMpg.text: Get the Garden Salad (bigger salad) with ginger dressing. And any cool roll you'd like. It gets crowded. Perfect spot for that local feel. Its tight though, so watch out for toes and elbows. The younger team of girls seem to help each other. Take out at prime time is a must, really. Reservations; I would. Strip mall look. Miami sushi taste.

zBFuPgYeksImxJ6_slnpxQ.text: Best Sushi in Charlotte! Good for SMALL groups. Very very small restaurant, always crowded. But the food is so worth the hassle. I don't go anywhere else anymore. Be prepared to have a wait and to be sitting close to other people and have your taste buds blown away!

UpsGYZkmUU9OTnGSHd90jQ.text: The dining space is a little bit small, but Jackie does phenomenal job with this restaurant. Make sure you get there early if it is a weekend evening. Been voted best in Charlotte many times and all you have to do is try it once to see why.

4bikhv8TcSxrgtI0pN6Kkw.text: Our favorite sushi place, despite the long commute (30+min on 485). Great variety of rolls and nigiri/sashimi. They have delicious uni which is a huge plus for us. We like the casual environment this place offers.  One of the waitresses knows us so well, the first thing she will ask us is if we'd like to put in our order for the Fantasy Shrimp bento and to give us a pen knowing we always order about 20 pieces of random fresh nigiris and sashimis. They take care of you here, if you give them a chance.  Our only complaint is that the place is tiny which means there can be a bit of a wait for seating and your food, but it hasn't stopped us from coming back. This place isn't for everyone, and we are OK with that. :)
