Jo38IKHmaDWzfKcIzQHBpw.text: This place has amazing sushi. It's a very small place, so I would probably recommend getting takeout and eating at home. We have only ever eaten there 1 time, and it took awhile to get a seat.   Call ahead and order take out, and bring it home. I usually order the dynamite roll (which is only like $6), and a few others. Easily some of the best sushi in Charlotte.

_gmRoCG8YM7f6WYBSax9_A.text: Hands down, some of the best sushi I've had. I had the Rose Roll and the Discover Roll. My favorite was the Discover. The presentation for all of our sushi (my husband and I ordered 4 rolls between us) was beautiful. I will definitely be back!  Pro tip: This place is small, so I recommend arriving early for lunch or dinner! It gets crowded -and fast!

viZh2wAi9Q32jXsnjmNGog.text: My favorite sushi restaurant of all charlotte. Great sashimi and my favorite roll is the spicy dragon roll one of the best rolls on the menu

6I8kyE9GNdFfLjoYuW2BBA.text: Aweful.  Worst sushi I have had anywhere.  The sushi is thin and skimpy and the other dishes were so terrible. I could tell the other patrons have not had real sushi.  It's cheap and the reason there are so many great reviews.  Quantity not quality here.

TtB5u31tM_w7YpmirdL8aA.text: Adjusted for location, being a sushi snob from Marin county, California, I'll go five stars.   It is not quite as good as my favorite place back home but better than my second favorite.   Everyone says it's the best sushi in charlotte and I believe them.   Had an excellent lunch.  Couldnt wait for dinner the night previous because it was packed.  And only reason I got in for lunch was I showed at 1130.  Go early.

vzgOmDEqRhIwxDpfdtfv6g.text: Expect a wait. It is worth it! The sushi is wonderful with lots of other cooked Japanese options. I usually get a couple of rolls and my husband gets the salmon bento box. Plenty of food, very reasonable prices, and the wait staff is always kind. Access to plenty of parking. The restaurant decor could use some updating, the restaurant is small. I keep hoping they expand. Food is always sumptuous. Please tip your server!

ptD0H5iLyUKKjj-lw0gzWg.text: The sushi here is amazing! I don't know what it is but its so delicious and I'm actually full after my meal.  I'm a New Yorker and our sushi portions are so small its usually 6 pieces, not very filling.  The atmosphere is nice and quiet. They even have seating outside and you can bring food out (you just have to pay first).  The owner's really nice and friendly and clearly knows his stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi heaven!

PcKpfOI2kJs7ipTw3ilF-A.text: Since I'm review #259, I'll keep it short-ish. The fella is a serious sushi-lover, and after the numerous places he's eaten, he still thinks Musashi in south Charlotte is the very best when it comes to sushi. After our first trip to New Zealand Cafe (thanks to Yelpers' suggestions), it just leap-frogged to No. 2 of all time.   We started with the steamed pot stickers, which were fresh and delicious. I'm not a sushi eater, so I appreciated that they had other options. I got the chicken bento box, which came with chicken and broccoli in a delicious, homemade brown sauce, two fried shrimp, two crab rangoons, brown rice, and a salad. I also appreciated that they offered me a fork! He got a special roll - the Bamboo  - along with a few pieces of Nigiri. There weren't as many pieces in the Bamboo roll as he hoped, but that was the only bad thing about it.   Service was outstanding, and since they were even more packed than usual and running a little behind, they brought us complimentary edamame. The only negative thing I can say isn't even their fault - their food is so delicious and their space is so small that it was a 30-minute wait at 5:30 on a Saturday with hardly anywhere to stand inside on a cold day.

yVFLELhjxB7K9z_Kmcm4vA.text: Excellent sushi! My favorites are the big boss roll and the Valentine roll. We usually get takeout since the dining area is fairly small.

c65U0HeK12_nLNga9wGASg.text: By far one GREAT place to eat Sushi, aways a packed house when I'm there, be prepared for a wait while they create your meal....it's a work of art.

8acubM_hwJCP8I0YqPQx_g.text: Best sushi in Charlotte.  It also routinely takes all awards for it as well.  Not a fancy place.  Make sure to place your carry out order early as the line here can be crazy.  Wait for a table can be ridiculous but definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

KdkoZoAIQzkUvZsUqh2FsA.text: New Zealand cafe is delicious, but Geez... it's time to expand your restaurant... it's SOO cramped in there. Just waiting for a to go order, they send you to the hallway to sit in a chair so you're out of the way of the servers... but then you end up awkwardly being squeezed past by patrons trying to use the restroom at the other end of the hall

EyN1aS3EHcRO1RrN0Hqn6A.text: The sushi may be great, but I will never know because my husband and I left after waiting for our food for almost an hour.  Very small place with no ambience and takeout orders seem to receive priority status. If you cannot serve your in house customers you should really stop accepting phone in orders at some point.

01Aez5jHnQttk5J1zif7Aw.text: After reading all the rave reviews about NZ Cafe, knowing I'm still on the search for my go-to sushi place in and around Charlotte, I had to give them a try.   Per the suggestions of others my bf and I went for a late lunch during the week to try to avoid a crowd. We got there around 1:45pm and there were a couple tables open - no one is kidding when they say this place is tiny. But, that wasn't necessarily a shot against it - our waiter could see us from essentially anywhere in the restaurant so when we were ready to order it was super easy to flag him down. Speaking of which, the service in general was pretty good. My water was always filled and they checked up on us a couple times to make sure the food was satisfactory.  We ended up going with a few rolls and several pieces of nigiri. The fish itself tasted very fresh, I would almost just get nigiri next time, and I enjoyed the rolls but I have definitely had better. The prices are pretty much unbeatable and the list of options is fairly extensive. It seemed like many of the rolls had a lot of the same ingredients though so if you're looking for variety (and sans cream cheese) you might be looking for a little while.   All in all, if I was in the area already I would definitely stop in for a late lunch again. But it's a little too out of the way (35min drive) and didn't knock my socks off enough for me to justify going regularly.

NGIy2COTCf_vaVVG8F0Egg.text: Best sushi you will eat. Ask for the cilantro roll it's not on the menu. I'd have given a 5 Star but it's also the worst service you will ever get. For take out order 45-1 hr ahead. They tell you 30 minutes and it's never that. They're not the nicest people at the counter either so you just got to suck it up and know the food is phenomenal.

wJbu6sHySNl1YpzmifnzZw.text: Love this place. awesome sushi for great prices. I've been ordering from here for years and it's still one of my favorite place to go out to

R0i0eEaah2ti7zw-GQGGrw.text: Oh.my.God. I've had this place bookmarked for almost a year, and when visiting family wanted sushi last weekend, I thought it would be a good time to try it out. When we pulled up we were all very skeptical - it is not much to look at from the outside. Well, it was incredible. Best sushi in Charlotte, no argument. The two rolls I ordered -- the Big Boss (I think) and the Shrimp and Crab (I think - I can't remember) were perfection. It is 100% worth the trek out there if you do not live nearby. Service was great even though they were slammed. It didn't bother me too much, but you should know that many of the printed menus contain different items - so take a look at the 100 menus they give you. I cannot WAIT to go back and I'm hoping it becomes a weekly tradition (or hopefully more often!)

6xuAoLKW1BgyaKijrsYvZQ.text: THE BEST SUSHI I HABE EVER HAD! Always fresh and delicious. My only issue is that this place is super small. If you are sitting at the short tables you don't have any privacy because you might as well be sitting with the people next to you.

YiM7wZFlzKDK3BpUZk9rJA.text: Always fresh here! Love the free birthday meal too! Small space so show up early if you want a table. Best to call in advance for take out too.

0v-TRTntYHV5P9ytyWIwrA.text: Sushi is my favorite food, and being new to Charlotte, I relied on Yelp to give me some recommendations. Therefore, I gave New Zealand Cafe a shot, despite the already questionable restaurant name.  I suppose it is unfair since I am comparing my experiences to sushi restaurants in Los Angeles and Boston (hometown and schooltown), so I will just cover the things that should NEVER happen at a sushi restaurant just to be fair.  1. If you are going to be a sushi waitress, please pronounce the menu correctly! Tuna is said, MAguro, not maGURO. Please get the inflection right.  2. When ordering nigiri, it should not turn into an order of sashimi and rice. Nigiri means sashimi STICKS to the rice, which = not falling apart.  3. It is very unappetizing to see blood from your sashimi on your dish.  4. Green tea from a tea bag? Really?  5. If you offer fried ice cream (I'm assuming this is tempura?), why does it only come in vanilla when you have green tea and red bean on the ice cream menu as well?  See, I haven't even got into the freshness of the sushi (which not all of it was made to order since I sat at the sushi bar) or the sashimi, or any complicated standards that I usually have. I am sorry, if this is the best sushi in Charlotte, because it was the worse sushi I have ever had, then I suppose it says a lot about the food scene.  If anyone has any recommendations for sushi, please please please send me a message!

tbK2TpHHIw_wB2PtyCbcrQ.text: Some of the best sushi I've had in the Charlotte area! Tiny place and tucked away in a strip mall but you'll be a happy camper that you found it. Very fresh, I know this because it took a bit longer than  most sushi places to get my order (wasabi  tuna roll and yellowtail maki) but well worth the wait. The fish was cold and firm, a must for me to qualify the sushi as "fresh"! Some places have "wimpy" green wasabi, not this place, it's the very dense kind with a kick. I love the "sinus clearing" effect, great pickled ginger too! Very reasonable prices and they have lots of specials and a huge selection of rolls, some are even on a picture menu for the "novice" sushi eater. I did not try any of their hot entrees but saw several and they looked like good portions and tasty. The service was excellent, I was kind of in a hurry to get to a movie, they got me my check and cashed out right away when I let them know. I will be back here again soon! Definitely worth checking out :-)

LJRekYiPjad_5Y0K5Mi3kA.text: This place is great! I used to think it was my own little secret, but it is always packed...guess the secret is out! I don't like shshi, but if you do, this place is for you. They have all of the classics, and on Tuesdays its all $1. I love the teriyaki chicken,  garlic noodles, brown rice, and love the fries shrimp! I've never dined in, but get to-go often. The food is always fresh amd always meets my expectations. If you find yourself near the corner of Monroe Rd and Sardis Rd N, you should stop in! It is hidden in the Harris Teeter shopping center.

oQUYOaKCOzL-zr5maZYWng.text: I kind of feel bad for writing this review but I'm highly upset! After sitting at the sushi bar for a good 10 minutes after being sat. Nobody came to take my order after they gotten me my water. I've been coming here since 2007, service here has gotten worse every single time I come here. I'm a server myself at a local sushi restaurant in Charlotte. Maybe because I am a college student and they think I can't tip so they wouldn't pay me any mind...? Who knows. With 3 servers and under 10 tables during lunch, nobody can provide me any service?! My money is just as good as the next person. The older Asian lady, I assume she is the manager gives the worse service especially when my friend and I came here for lunch. My friend who is also in the food industry agrees. If you get great service from her than your probably a regular here or not of a minority group. 2 stars because I love the food and its close to my house but sadly, I won't be returning.

-LDqusYyaAt0x1IisRPXcg.text: There's a reason it's cramped and the service is sometimes a bit slow.  This is the best sushi for the price in a hundred miles.  I would love for the place to move close by but to a larger location but that is really our only complaint.  We have always had fresh delicious sushi here.  We also have young children and have been surprised more than once by an impromptu dessert of free sliced oranges for them sent over by Jackie the lead chef.  If you want to go to Center City and pay $10 for a California roll be my guest but the sushi here is worth the wait.

_zPfZSvft_Kt0dHJMCRZ3A.text: A bit on the small side for dining space, but don't let the small size fool you.  The delicious food, friendly service, and wide variety way compensates for size. Good things do come in small packages.

ia8zdxjOLQ8QJF0l1WmWLw.text: I am a rookie to sushi, but this place is very good and has an great menu selection.  Don't let it's location in a strip mall fool you, it's a very popular place so expect having to wait for a table.

kATvj7X_j-FQml4KyEi-PQ.text: Such great sushi, but if you call an order in, double the wait time that they give you. Last time I was here, I overheard a frustrated customer say it was the 3rd time she'd had to wait and wait on a to go order. Now here I stand, about 50 minutes into what was supposed to be a 25 minute wait, crowded against the drink station and hoping my order arrives soon. Miserable! But at least the reward at the end will be good...

w0v8aU0taov6aPtBpQzBdA.text: One of the best kept secrets in the Charlotte area for sushi! My favorite roll is the crunchy spicy tuna roll, but everything I've tried has been good. The restaurant is a little small, so get there early to avoid a wait. Amazing sushi for the price.

tsmVP0wu0wKCJ23YxjWsng.text: A friend recommended this place otherwise we never would have found it. Dont let the strip mall location turn you off. Its a tiny hole in the wall but the sushi is amazing and almost as good as RuSans! It is now our go to sushi place almost weekly! Rolls are creative and delicious... Try the favorite roll -ironically my favorite roll! Salt and pepper calamari and lettuce wraps are are good starters. Also good yo go with people who are not sushi fans as their dishes are really good too. If you go on the weekend go early... Gets crowded and its small.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baby octopus

0m79TlUj3UNOT20bd_HGsg.text: I am always in search of a great sushi place with fresh fish and decent prices and I was really hoping NZ Cafe would fit the bill. We walked in and the place was absolutely slammed for a Monday, so that was a great sign.  The seating is a bit too close for comfort in my opinion- conversations next to us were distracting as I am sure we were to others as well. Service was poor and slow . We had two servers (I think?), my point is that I really had no idea who our actual server was.  we ordered four rolls:  christmas, sweet dragon, crazy, and discovery  We only really cared for two out of four (s.d and christmas) - disovery was one of the worst rolls I have ever had - very fishy tasting and honestly sloppy.I had an issue with the overall temperature of all the rolls - very warm and the avocado on the rolls was a mushy mess.   We must have read the menu wrong because we thought we were getting three unfried rolls and one fried but two ended up being over-fried almost to the point where they lost any of the delicateness of sushi. Lastly I am a big fan of wasabi and tend to add quite a bit to my low sodium soy, but they must have super-salty wasabi paste because it was almost inedible....and not spicy enough.   On a positive note the wooden boat displays were a really cool idea and certainly warranted us taking a few photos.   Overall though, the distance and quality make this a no-go for me ...

Xad667MPvVl2KZp8RqNoWA.text: Nothing to see here!  Move along, move along!!  (to my chagrin, this is a well-kept secret no longer....)  Very fresh, affordable sushi.  Tiny location in a strip mall, seating is very limited.  Best sushi option in the Matthews/SE CLT area, by far.  If you are doing take out, give yourself plenty of time -- they can get backed up, especially on the weekends.

Wf29pK9bUjPOxSrfK9C2kQ.text: Pretty good sushi. I've only been there one but very solid. Really good service.its one of the best places in the area

N9npcnNsB7-mzRqNx1btNg.text: When I first visited Charlotte back in September, this was the first restaurant I visited (seeing its very close to Inner Peaks).  The rolls are cheap/moderately priced, the staff are friendly and the atmosphere is very homey.  The one thing that really stands out is the sushi chef's attention to detail and focus on ACTUALLY giving a dang about presentation. They're also relatively innovative with the rolls offered; my one friend had the Island Roll which was wrapped in cucumber strips rather than seaweed and rice. Pretty rad.  Yeah, I'm pretty sure I'll drop in here quite a bit whenever I'm in the area.

iJAbqIKpzVYySYCOZZoE-Q.text: Love this place! I got here for lunch from time to time because I love sushi and you can get some really good sushi for a very low price. Their other offerings, such as the Chicken and Crab Bento Box with a bunch of fixings, are excellent as well. Not one complaint or bad thing to say about their food.  The place is small but there always somewhere to sit. I love how the have the sushi chefs at the back wall of the restaurant so you can see all the stuff being made.  Great selection of different dishes if you're not into sushi and decent selection of standard Asian beers, wines and sake.  My only complaint is the wait time which is why they did not get the 5th start from me. It seems that every time I've gone it takes longer than usual to have our food delivered to the table. Not unreasonable but noticeably.  Aside from that you're gonna love this quaint little  place.

h4NpNrtKU_S4uCgEiwlAAQ.text: Decent sushi but Im a bit weird when it comes to feeling comfortable in spacious settings and this place is way too tight for my taste.  Service was fine and so was the food (nothing to write home about) but I felt that I had about 10 people who I did not know all on my table because its so tight together.

KxDv78hy8PYgPSgkIng19Q.text: Not as good as they used to be. This is my go to Sushi spot for the Fried Oyster roll but recently, they've not delivered on the taste.

WShOoytuL9y9RuM4QMPQXA.text: I have a confession... I'm slightly obsessed with sushi .   My husband and I were in the area for dinner.  We walk into New Zealand and there is a line waiting to be seated.  This is on a Monday night.  That is a strong testament to how good this place is.  I was told there was a 20 minute wait.  I asked the hostess if I could place my sushi order so it would be ready when the table was ready and she said sure!!  She even brought drinks to us while we were waiting.  Our table was actually ready way quicker than she thought!  Our sushi took a while to come out because they were so busy!  Everything was delicious.  We devoured it quickly!  We ordered the valentine roll, the Christmas roll, and the favorite roll.   My favorite was the valentine roll.  I highly recommend New Zealand if you aren't in a rush for lunch/dinner.  The prices are also very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Christmas and Favorite roll
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Valentine roll

-WW1jiwrrQ-9gdwSbyOjZw.text: This cafe is tucked into a shopping center and if you're not careful, you'll pass right by it.  Deanna and I went at the height of lunch hour and it was noisy. The tables were close to each other and it felt tight and loud.  But, as we got into our dining experience and a few people started clearing out, we started really liking the vibe. We both had the grilled Hibachi chicken and shrimp lunch special, which was very fairly priced. It was served in a Bento style box with rice, and a few small chicken skewers and a few fried triangular shaped spring rolls filled with cream cheese (and maybe some Crab meat), and some slaw.   I liked most of it, especially the chicken and shrimp.   The slaw was not my favorite, based on the heavy dressing on it.  A lot of people around us were ordering sushi. I am not a sushi fan, but it looked absolutely fabulous.  I wondered why the sanitation score was only 91.5.  I realize that is an A, but I like restaurants to have a 95 or higher. I know that I am not alone in this opinion.  Regardless, it was a great choice for our lunch date and I would recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

GcpXJNLI0lQadinNqyQaDw.text: This spot is a standout amongst the BEST kept privileged insights in Charlotte. Situated in a strip shopping center territory, this small eatery presents enormous sushi flavors. I have never been frustrated in the heavenly sushi. In spite of the fact that I have not wandered far from my "go-to-supper", I may wander out and attempt the lo disposition next time. The ONLY reason I didn't give this a 5 star rating was a direct result of the administration today. The server was somewhat discourteous and go my request off base. When I got the sustenance, it was delightful. I will return.

89Ph-JmTsqf_rlhwhIR8ZQ.text: Good food, great prices ... Three people for $33.   Sweet dragon roll, shrimp and scallops and teriyaki steak  Small place but good service. Worth the wait!

Ht_jopXdAPl9-cxNg1QMtg.text: Little hole in the wall. Great price and great food! My boyfriend and I love to go here. This is our favorite sushi spot for a good price!

3HLhDdwiXOAXuNH8b9RUoA.text: This place has the absolute, hands down, without a doubt, slap your momma best sushi PERIOD! Go there any night of the week and you'll wait for a table. We order take out but give it 40 minutes. I doubt you'll find better tasting sushi anywhere in Charlotte.

uNudTv2dUMJ9C8wdnI6bfg.text: Loved their sushi! It was packed which is always a good sign. Servers were pleasant and friendly. I'll definitely be returning.

iZPwnTRk0hqQ32coqktdgA.text: This might be my new sushi go-to in Charlotte when I want some amazing sushi for great prices!  The restaurant is small and usually very busy so you have to wait for a table, but it is so worth it!  The sushi is fresh and so good and doesn't cost you an arm and a leg, which is a nice change from many other sushi spots around town.  We could see that many people take advantage of the take out also since the line looped around the restaurant for pick up orders.  We've already been back a few times since trying it and will keep going back for more!  Drink prices are very reasonable, as well!

M3ml4FYNdjaYa0PW8JF0Lw.text: The service leaves you with a bad taste in your mouth, but the food itself is decent. I suggest calling atleast half an hour ahead of time if you want take out, again, the service. Its a small place and is usually busy, so if youre going to dine in, its worth it for the price, but bring your patience.

2Rs0wRonjKCNSNb6dCaTzg.text: The best sushi in town, maybe all of the Carolinas! It seems like a hole in the wall where you wouldn't be safe in, but look past that! It's amazing sushi in a great community! Anything on the menu, it's delicious. I have been here frequently over the last 2.5 years!

xDio5iSNT04oW3vPe91yKA.text: Went in on a Saturday night after hearing a lot about this place over the years and I now get what the hype is about! The sushi here is wonderful and so fresh. It is a small space so we ended up sitting at the sushi bar and observed everything being made--the attention to detail is very evident. The presentation was also lovely and we even got an edible orchid on one of our plates! I was really pleased with the rolls we chose and we will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

zgC3NQjIN5liUehnV6nK4A.text: This restaurant is a hidden gem! Its humble exterior houses some of the best sushi I have ever had. The restaurant itself is small and cozy, and I enjoyed dining in. However, if you are claustrophobic or do not like staying in close proximity to others make sure you don't dine in during peak hours or else you will feel squished.

72qZVr5EYa5vpd4qZWbPFg.text: It's the best restaurant for almost anything especially sushi and I personally like the trays that come with so many different flavors!  The service is great also. It's small so sometimes there is a wait....but get out your cellphone as it's worth it.

RiM0mHbtLIt_28ujkycJ0g.text: I love everything about this place. The service is wonderful, food is spectacular, and atmosphere is lovely & intimate. My only warning: if you dont like to wait for food (dine-in or carry out) this is not the place for you. But if you love authentic Japanese food, this is you place!!  Almost always, I order the miso soup and veggie tempura roll -- both satisfying and delicious. The deep flavor of the miso soup will not disappoint. Sometimes I get the rice & veggies, if I want a larger meal. The regular veggie sushi rolls are great, but occasionally they'll do a vegetarian-rice free roll that is AWESOMELY light & refreshing (though a wee bit ugly to eat, so dont order on a date night ;).  Love this place, just wish I didnt have to wait so long.

TWxBdMoiYGFLAQRWF2YZlQ.text: Another good sushi meal last night at New Zealand.  Good crowd there for a Tuesday night.  Had several pieces of Nigiri and several rolls.  We even had enough to take home.  We will return.

k7x9Z9yHfGDxmRdX0Y0q3g.text: This is still one of my favorite places to grab sushi and a drink. It's always packed so be prepared to wait.   They have a decent list of sushi and plenty of cooked menu items as well Incase you have someone in your party that doesn't want sushi.

KKslstsQxiXVVKmAiLvXGA.text: I was happy with how the sushi tasted. We did take out so I can't really comment on the service. When I called they said it would take 20-30 minutes and that was accurate. My only issue with this place was the health rating of 91.5. It clearly states that on here, but I didn't check that before ordering. I realize there is dumb things that make a score low, but I really don't like eating at places under a 95. Maybe it's just me, but that means a lot in my decision making on eating somewhere. If you don't mind a low heath rating give this place a try.

ZU9sl5DtqbhkQDlf7kh7HA.text: I come to NZCafe about 3 times a week. I really love their sushi and the prices. The place is always packed. And for good reason. They know what they're doing and they do it well. Yum!

3ePy5EfJtLKuJjCB2HzUKg.text: I've only been here twice, but I AM IN LOVE with New Zealand Cafe. This place is tucked away in an nondescript strip mall and I'd say it's a hidden gem for sushi!   The both times I've been here, we had to wait to be seated because it was busy and it stays busy (rightfully so because the food is so gooood). The restaurant is pretty small, cozy, and always packed with patrons so it takes the sushi chefs some time to get the sushi out. I can't complain though, their sushi is absolutely worth the wait!  I came with a party of 8-10 each time, and everyone just picked an order of sushi of their choice and then we all just dug in and shared. I've probably had 15+ different orders of their sushi and I can't complain about a single one! Their sushi ingredients are fresh and their rice is done right. Not only is their sushi DELISH, it's completely affordable and they're actually a pretty big size. The service has always been wonderful as well, the staff is so friendly and attentive.   In summary, New Zealand Cafe is hands down one of my favorite sushi joints in Charlotte. I don't want to go anywhere else for sushi! Love this place! I'd eat here every day if I could but I'd rather not see a huge spike of mercury levels in my body.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi galore! 12 orders of sushi.

K6pXDrbN4AZ7-QGOVx3c5g.text: Been three times. Steadily worse each time. Not another chance. I expect frozen fish, this is Charlotte. I expect crowds, this place is tiny, and in a strip mall. I DON'T expect an hour to get 20 pieces of mediocre nigiri, even if it is on a nifty little boat. (Not sure how they are getting those CLEAN enough to eat off of, but hey, I don't work for the health department).   It took 30 minutes to get two of us in, and 10 to get in an order. 30 mintes later, still just a beer, nothing else. Others around us just keep getting fed, we just sit. Better yet, when I have the audacity to ask what's taking so long, the waitress gets huffy and kept blathering that nigiri takes longer to make. Gee, I've never eaten sushi before, please guide me sensei.  Just admit that you screwed up somewhere. Cut the BS. Don't keep coming by and making excuses AFTER 30 MINUTES, 45 mintues, an hour. Say something like it's on a slow boat...  30 minutes more, boat time. Ordered a small beer. Happy just to get my order in the end, but clearly some of it had been on the boat for some time. After saying so, one of the sushi chefs came out and apologized for the time taken and told me they would comp my second beer...so that's something, I suppose.  $3.50 for an hour sounds more Chinese than Japanese, but I digress. Two and a half hours I won't get back, and felt like a waste then and now, but maybe I can keep others from doing the same. In sum, save your money and keep looking for better, it HAS to be out there.

G_nGLStixFS3pZzB-Snnsg.text: I'm not really sure where the name fits in, but New Zealand Cafe has great Asian food. I admit, when we pulled up I struggled to put aside my preconceived notions about strip mall restaurants. The Yelp reviews looked pretty decent and my companions swore it was safe. I didn't get any sushi, but the sushi my companions ordered looked good (and it came out on a cool wooden boat!) I ordered the Queenstown's chicken entree which came with 2 fried shrimp, brown rice, 2 crab Rangoon patties. All that food for around 6 bucks! Great value! The chicken was crispy and battered then covered in sweet & sour sauce. It was really good. We were seated at a 4 person high-top as we arrived. The restaurant was kind of small, so I imagine it gets crowded quickly. Service was good, lunch was pretty cheap all around a great experience.

JH5akrCAxbq5lxxvxHTp5Q.text: We came to check out New Zealand Cafe based on the great reviews. I had my doubts once we pulled down a long road of dead strip malls. The restaurant was busy so I figured, "hey, maybe it's ok?" Turns out our rolls were nothing special and not worth the drive. They were big and hard to eat. The search for a place better than RuSan continues!

LekEqGaa7FF8s4dtMf34ig.text: We have been visiting New Zealand Cafe since it opened.  Sad that I am so late reviewing it.  What can I say about this place?  It is one of the top sushi restaurants in Charlotte.  It looks so unassuming from the outside in a strip-mall but boy does this place deliver!  It is small so if you get there right in the lunch or dinner crush, be prepared to wait...awhile.  We have waited for up to 1.5hrs and it was totally worth it.  We try to get there early.  The food quality is superb and the menu is extensive.  Plenty of options for the sushi fanatic.  Our kids started on Kani years ago and have graduated to more exotic and spicier rolls.  Of course they still love Kani lol.  Very high quality for reasonable prices.  Chef and his wife are super people too.

yEZyHS8eu4KqaWeL2T3HYg.text: Never had sushi and never been to NZC. Food was amazing and atmosphere is great too. Really small hole in the wall, but truly great food. People were lined up to be seated as it's a very crowded eating area. Will be back soon!

iO6iAsxs1ItxIaymFHAcvg.text: Raised in the South Pacific, I saw New Zealand cafe and in my mind I was immediately transported to the islands and I was consuming good ol' island grub. This however was not the case when I walked into New Zealand Cafe. BUT, I was not disappointed, for being from the islands I also enjoy SEAFOOD! And sushi is New Zealand cafe's forte. Great sushi nonetheless. Their service is a little bit slow, but who can complain when their absolutely divine sushi hits your tastebuds. Yum! It's small so you really have to hit it at lunch or early dinner or else you'll be waiting forever. Try the pot stickers and then make your way to the plethora of sushi choices!! See you there.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. I love a place the offers lunch specials!!

VsYs0SWSjX0jLylNCsSR2w.text: We were on a mission to find an amazing sushi boat and New Zealand Cafe delivered! Service was exceptional and prices reasonable for the quality of sushi. I love finding hidden spots in ho-hum strip malls.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

k-QPcmCOuiKRhBSf6DBOsA.text: This is my favorite sushi place in Charlotte! Words can't describe how happy I am that I have discovered this gem of a place. I wish the absolute best for the owners but sometimes, for my own selfish reasons, I hope they don't expand because most restaurants that expand, often don't do things the same. Such as, the chef's are different and the prices increase because of whatever reason... It's just.. This place is perfect and I don't want anything to change. And plus, I don't want any more people to know about this place because this place can get packed real quick. I'm just joking... Sorta.  The sushi here is spectacular and at a reasonable price too. The quality of the sashimi is just incredible and especially for the price. It's a bang for your buck!! And for my non sushi lovers out there, the bento box is great also, really good portions.   Favorite dishes: Big Boss Roll Lobster King Roll Century Roll Sake Nigiri Tuna Tataki  Poke Squid Salad Fried Ice Cream

c9epBH6a6_psD4zILT7JkA.text: Oh New Zealand Cafe, I really wanted to love you...but unfortunately, I found you to be "meh".    When I walked in around lunchtime the other day, there were a good number of people in the small dining area, but there were quite a few tables open, so I was seated immediately.    Unfortunately, when I walked in, the place smelled fishy, not good. Based on the smell of the place, I was a bit worried about how fresh the sushi was, so I decided to pass on that.    Instead, I ordered a shrimp & chicken hibachi which was served "bento box style" with brown rice, salad, chicken skewers, and some sort of 'cheese-filled ravioli' (odd!).  The shrimp & chicken was ok, but was a bit too salty for my preference.  The brown rice was oddly flavored, a bit greasy, and cooked with corn or something odd like that mixed in (WTH?!). The chicken skewers consisted of 2 small skewers with oddly reddish looking chicken that was seriously dry & overcooked.  The cheese ravioli thingies were also odd tasting and not especially good. Sadly, the salad was drenched in some sort of yucky salad dressing.  Overall, I was very disappointed with the food.   On the plus side, the food was pretty cheap, and service was pretty good.  I just wish the quality & flavor of the food was better.

3gNn6jo8fTijJVWjVOa9lQ.text: This place has an amazing food, average customer service, cozy atmosphere. I had few issues with their sushi few years ago (which made me stop going there) but my recent visit changed my mind in a positive way again.

FQA_IngG6qGM5R7vYnI25A.text: Waited for a long time but when the food came my spicy tuna sushi was very dry and not spicy at all. Pretty disappointed because a girl referred us to it. Plus my husbands sushi was not good and the spicy mayo is gross and thick

4Wmx_ua04N6OY3MZWHcTmw.text: This place has been one of my favorite resturaunts for over 10 years. Good quality sushi at great prices. They are always packed so you know they are doing it right. They are also very creative and come up with their sushi rolls. Jackie (head sushi chef) does a great job of crafting his own rolls. Also, go for one of their Bento Boxes as well. Generous portion and it comes with a lot of items for a good price.

a9ciWBqKC3z4rGnuqshsQg.text: Amazing!  Jackie never ever let's me down.  Ive eaten hear at least 50 times and it is always excellent.  I east sushi all over the country and this is some of the best I've found stateside.    Tip:  ask for a spicy smoked salmon skin hand roll.  I eat two to three each time.    Don't bring a large group but do bring patience as they are busy EVERY day during lunch and dinner.  Worth the wait!

shlZw6eEh0Q8X8GYq7B5Kw.text: Undoubtedly the best sushi around at an incredible price.  Best service in town . Small place & excellent food means they are busy.   Always a wait between 6:49 and 8:30...but well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Master Roll

WYKU48VF0guRpB2sC1ePVA.text: The service has gone down hill tremendously. We waited an hour for our food while everyone around us got their food. We were offered no apology at all and were never told that we would be waiting for a long period of time. Also, I am vegan and ordered vegetable sushi and it came with smelt Roe all over the rice due to lack of care. They brought out a replacement, but between that and the wait I was not pleased. The last four times I've been there my experiences have been similar and poor. It is sad because this used to be my favorite restaurant.

K4-RG8WM5lacTznu6UEpKg.text: Really great place. It's small so you'll probably have to wait to get a table during busy times, but that's really the only negative. The food is terrific, especially for the price. And this is the restaurant that convinced me that I like sushi. I've had sushi at several other places since but none of it is quite as good as what you'll get here. Recommend all the way.

2TchdYdcRbM6kMXMjYmXqw.text: Don't let the name (or the strip mall) fool you. It's really a diamond in the rough when it comes to sushi places. Once you try it I guarantee you will go back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Valentine roll

47ZuOWGWGam8VZOtOaRxYw.text: New Zealand Cafe came highly recommended by friends and neighbors around town. Labeled as "a hidden gem of Charlotte," my expectations were set. I was ready to be wowed. I decided to make the 30 min trek out to Matthews to give this place a try. When I arrived, it was very crowded and we had a 30-45 min wait which seemed normal at a place with so much hype around it. Once we were seated, we ordered 2 rolls of sushi and toro nigiri. The sushi was very salty and had no flavor. I remained hopeful as we still had their infamous sushi boat on the way. Once the boat arrived, it was the same thing. Salty, no flavor, not fresh. This place was extremely disappointing. Not only was it under average sushi, it was the same price, if not more than some of the better sushi restaurants around Charlotte. New Zealand Cafe is great for people who are not regular sushi eaters. Anyone who knows good sushi, is better off going to Jade or Ru San's. Also, be prepared for the dining experience to take at least 2 hours (even on a Sunday).

LmIX7I47ZnGKBchy1j9TKQ.text: My coworker recommend this place. She was right! It's the best sushi that I have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. The best sushi!! Yummy! #bigbossroll

9TgyQpMV157A07R8QkMg_A.text: So its our anniversary and my wife would like to get some sushi....living in Matthews that can be difficult. I had seen the restaurant in the past but was not sure. WOW - a great venue for sure. Very small - close in tables for couples and medium sized groups - lots of attentive waitrons - and a nice menu for any tastes. We went with three big rolls that did not disappoint. The house Vino Tinto was good for the price. Folks were cutting up and talking and having an all around good time. The food was good - fresh and tasteful - but everyone else around us was the cinch!

CxE2OE4s0olbjaQKkRmc_g.text: Have been going here since 2007, sushi is consistently great! Excellent pricing! Love Cathy and Catherine, excellent service even better sushi. Love this place, the food and the staff. (Mexican roll, Favorite roll, Valentine roll...personal favorites)

3MZmpmH0aXLMrBnRM6Tz2Q.text: This is our go-to place. The sushi is always amazing. They also have really great chinese-style stir fries that are great for people who aren't fans of sushi. The staff is great, and it's a cozy place. Always busy so give yourself extra time in case there's a wait.

-BVPicJIW_1kCz37oTGoag.text: Stuck alone in a new city driving around looking for a place to enjoy my lunch hour, a sign caught my eye in a strip mall.  New Zealand?  My mind flashed back to my college trip to the Kiwi Isle.  Back then I was determined to eat something New Zealand other than the fruit.  Everytime I asked where a good "New Zealand style" restaurant would be I ended up directed to a mediocre Chinese buffet.  Sorry, New Zealanders that is from China; the Maoris did not invent General Tso's chicken.  Perhaps my culinary quest was at an end.  I pulled in to the boring suburban strip mall and 'Sushi bar' was stenciled on the windows underneath.  Slightly disappointed I decided to give it a whirl anyway, though a bit skeptical that sushi in a southern suburb might resemble that in a King of the Hill episode that was derived from canned tuna.  Opening the door however I delighted to see a very tastefully decorated and quaint interior with what looked to be actual Asians and not disguised Mexicans.  I, of course, tried the local Charlotte roll which was an Avocado on top style, my favorite.  It was delicious.  I'm quite pleased with my strip mall gem.  Update: Since eaten here around a dozen times.  I've tried tons of their specialty rolls.  My favorites were the: HOT Roll - jalapeno, spicy tuna, cream cheese! Ichiban Spicy Roll - Spicy Tuna, Crab, Avocado, red sauce Bombing Roll - Fried in mint leaf Wasabi Salmon Roll (w/ out mayo, eeg) - it's beautiful Rainbow Roll - Even more beautiful and delicious  Also, good is the fried banana 'sushi' (which is more than enough for one person), the red bean ice cream and the really good service.  It was a sad goodbye my last week there eating 5 times.  Thanks everyone there!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Storefront

UA9ow_Ft4-dI4UvaQpZK5g.text: its been all said already ,what are yo u waiting for, you want some good sushi or not. took one star off for the small seating area, foods is great tho, go go go

WQjrIVCl5OYOmVJ82HMfEw.text: i love this little place.  And I do mean little!! The menu is twice the size of the restaurant.  But it's a great place to load up on affordable sushi.  The servers are always super friendly.

H7y9IxAAbNkQEwnKzJ8Jkg.text: Had take-out from here the other night... We were in the mood for sushi, read the reviews on Yelp and just decided to go for it. We weren't disappointed.   I can't comment on atmosphere, (as we had take-out and my significant other picked it up.  I still haven't seen the place, but I am familiar with where it is.   We had an order of edamame, and 4 maki rolls (Crispy Bagel, California, Crispy Spicy Tuna, and Crab Cream Cheese Avocado) as well as an order of their garlic noodles. Everything was delicious aside from the noodles... yuck. Won't bother with those again.   The sushi was fresh and fabulous. We'll definitely be back, at least for take-out! Yum!!

drwg-4v-El3zybkFqwEMaQ.text: Wouldn't have thought to go in here for sushi, but on the recommendation of several friends we tried it, and the food is fantastic.  Also, I personally find the small and slightly unfinished dining area welcoming, and for a Sushi place, very unique.

0EdpReT_cEidg6TTmvID9Q.text: We called this restaurant before we got on the road to eat here because we had a 25 mile drive to eat here and had heard good things so we wanted to give it a try. I informed the lady we had 4 small kids and would be driving a good 25 miles to eat there so I wanted to see what the wait time was. She said they weren't too busy and it would only be about 10-15 minutes. We immediately left and drove the 25 miles and when we pulled up we noticed a huge crowd outside. I called the lady again and she again informed me it wasn't too crowded and would only be about a 15 minute wait. We got our kids out and got inside, and the hostess at the front said oh no the wait would be an hour or more. I said what? We just spoke with a lady and she told me differently. She said oh I'll have to let her know it's longer. They were very unsympathetic and could care less that we had 4 hungry kids and just drove 25 plus miles to only get turned around and find another place to eat! I am very appalled by how their customer service was and the lack of sympathy or apology. I will NEVER eat here. I understand we came on a Friday night, but all they had to do was tell us the real wait time and there would have been no issues! No matter how good a place may be, if there customer service is bad, it ruins their whole business!

C_G_JQX7R_RiDk-Jt4O4rw.text: *Ding, Ding, Ding, Ding* I've found a winner!   Ok, so for the past two days (June 7th & 8th), the hubs and I have been celebrating and partying like we were back in College. It was our 3rd Anniversay and my 27th birthday so we hit up a few places in Charlotte and we were not disappointed. After we checked out of the Sierra Hotel (which I will be reviewing in a lil' bit) the hubs took me to New Zealand Cafe for lunch. It's off North Sardis road in a strip mall type setting.  I was really excited to be having lunch here b/c all the sushi buffs I know have been saying this is the best sushi in Charlotte. AND THEY WEREN'T LIEING! At first glance I didn't know what to make of the decor, it's a hodge-podge of japanese design/nautical elements/viking-esque wall art. But I wasn't here for the decor, I wanted to inhale some SUSHI! We were greeted instantly and told to grab a seat, so we sat near the door as everywhere else was taken. I can't remember the name of our server, but she was very petite and wore a big smile. She took our drink order and handed us three different menus. The hubs told her it was my birthday and with that she smiled and said, "Oooh you get a free meal today!" I was estatic, I showed her my DL and she pointed out what I could order for free. I chose the Hibachi Chicken and Shrimp platter, I also ordered a Sweet Dragon Roll and the hubs ordered a Rainbow Roll.  It took about 10 minutes and I was in Sushi heaven...the sweet dragon roll was perfect dipped in my concoction of soy sauce, wasabi and mayo dipping sauce. Now on to the Hibachi Chicken and Shrimp platter that came out in a cute little tray. It was an assortment of crab-n-creme cheese wontons, chicken on a stick, broccoli, onions. zuchini and of course shrimp and chicken. It was sooo good! The sushi was so fresh, you could tell they use the best ingredients. The portion was the perfect size although I could not finish the entire roll but the hubs was on hand to polish off what I couldn't.  All-in-all, New Zealand Cafe gets five stars for it's friendly servers, mom and pop feel and quality sushi! :-)

E1ff3SE2tk52IIopn7Rdzw.text: New Zealand Cafe is the best sushi place in Charlotte, hands down! Especially for the price. It may be small and not as trendy as Nikkos (which I love as well), but it constantly delivers!

K9efdpUNhvtO-0m_CH7qgw.text: This place never disappoints - probably the best sushi place that I have found in Charlotte.  And yes...gulp...it's in a strip mall. But the atmosphere is cozy and the wait staff is very friendly. The sushi is great and fresh - and there are a variety of options for those that aren't into sushi. They also serve beer and wine.

gq1WQTuIrTKpZ1Xn5-Db4w.text: This restaurant is a delicious steal! Their prices are so low, no wonder it's always packed! Great for a quick bite or take-out. Don't be deterred by the strip mall, the food is great.

pZ3cdbNwTs2lupYp-y3ieQ.text: This is my favorite sushi spot in Charlotte. Great customer service super friendly staff!! Give it a try!

5qR-67n5A2Oc_x9SoHGdmA.text: I have been dining there for many years and even if I go 6 months between visits, they still remember my first name. I LOVE their sushi! It might be a small restaurant but it's got a big heart. Great food and service.

pG-9Q9WQg9JT3Lb0l16TGA.text: This place has good food at reasonable prices, it's more of a Chinese menu, but very good.

yzHLblq-YFJPOhbOYqfAlg.text: This place is horrible. Horrible food. Horrible service. I have come here twice because this place has such great reviews and both times have walked away confused because I have no clue what people like about this place. I guess see for yourself. I mean, after all some people love olive garden and that lobster place. This seems like the sushi equivalent.

voSvgpc3MQZRaTm088NW0Q.text: Overall the place is fairly good. The prices are reasonable (probably due to cheap rent) and the portions decent.  BUT, 4 stars is generous considering it was pretty dirty... the bathrooms, the sushi station, uniforms, procedures, etc.  And that's a big dinning turn-off, especially for sushi.  Also, maybe it was just the setting, but the fish tasted like a lower grade than other places I like around town.

2ZxEhVYodcVNipJU8vxFTQ.text: These people are very friendly and accommodating. The sushi is amazing. We get a lot of to go orders for a large group and they are always helpful and accurate on all our orders. This is definitely one of my favorite spots.

Srlww7Z7PBPXlQotzsKKFg.text: Best sushi ever.. Been coming here for more than 4 years and still cant find any better! Love it.

w0Qyg5HGYda8qBGbm3unyw.text: Outstanding sushi and exemplary customer service!  I only wish I lived closer!   I was visiting from out of town and was searching for sushi on my way to the airport.  I looked at the Yelp reviews and knew I had to make NZ Cafe a stop on my itinerary.  The sushi was amazing! The Wasabi Salmon Roll was one of the best I have ever had.  But the customer service really impressed me.  I lost my receipt and a week later called to get a copy.  The person who answered the phone took the time to search through their records to find it for me.  She was going to fax it to me, but their fax could not dial a long distance number, so the owner faxed it to me from her home fax at 1:30 AM that night when she got home.  I don't know many restaurants who would put that kind of effort into helping a one-time customer.  However, if I ever am back in Charlotte, I will be going back!

2bdRUFHwE-BBb8XzOblNgQ.text: Oh New Zealand, I wanted to like you for so much more than your wine from Marlborough, especially after the drive to find you, but unfortunately a 3 star s all I can commit. The place is small and quaint and deserves the "cafe" name. The menu is extensive with pictures (not a fan of pictures food on a menu as a norm) and the prices are CHEAP, which is the best part of the place.   Had some steamed pot stickers for an appetizer and while good, they could use a bit more flavor. Then ordered 4 rolls, most recommended, and they came out on a funky boat which was cool. They tuna crunchy roll was way too hot and fried for my taste. My favorite roll was the pink roll and would order it again and again. Ichiban and Dynamite roll were good too, though the Ichiban could have used something extra.   All in all, the price is hard to beat and I will try it again when I'm in the area and try a few different rolls.

wud1uaIXOagqqK7N9AK9Vw.text: LOVE THE SUSHI...its always fresh and delicious....the only thing i hate its how small and over crowded always busy it is....if ur Starving...DO NOT go eat here.... bc u will most likely have to wait...other than that....its great!!!

7o2aYYNLC1j8cigUJoryuw.text: Another one of my favorite places to dine. Everything is delicious, from the Kami Nigiri to the Teriyaki Chicken Bento Box. I highly recommend eating here. Even when it's busy, service is still satisfactory.

9XyiDnuXKmEZrE-Z6PHthw.text: Best sushi in Charlotte. Prices are fair. The only reason I gave it four stars is because of the cramped quarters and the wait, but trust me, it's worth it. Oh, and I really wish they'd condense their menu into one. They give you four different menus (but now I'm nitpicking).

MJ73yL1EAG-aQ9Wn091nYA.text: Best sushi in town. Hands down. Just saying. =)  But no, seriously, for the price, you couldn't do better! People go for atmosphere these days rather than the quality of food and getting your money's worth. This is the place to be if you actually want good sushi!

AigELFIPad6YVtR4zXY2bA.text: New Zealand Cafe is a treasure hidden in an old strip mall.  The food is good and inexpensive -- a great combination, in my book.  Sushi is one of those things I am always hesitant to order (although I usually enjoy it once I do), so I have yet to try any of NZC's offerings in that area.  However, their bento-box esque dinners are delicious.  For $6-10, depending on your selection, you get the main entree, two chicken skewers, two crab rangoons, rice, and a salad.  It's hard to beat that value, especially when it tastes so good.  I especially recommend the Fantasy Shrimp (with a unique, delicious fruity mayonnaise sauce) or the Crispy Scallops.  The only reason I New Zealand Cafe doesn't get 5 stars is because the inside is cramped, which means that the lines can be long and the dining crowded if you don't feel like take out.

GrKpxPvrM4_FOwKl3wkrog.text: Fresh and fun and tiny and cozy.  Friendly service. Sports tv playing on the screens in the corners.   Good food, good prices.   I've had the mango chicken and the bento box with sushi. Very tasty chicken (along with sesame noodles, salad, shrimp, and crab rangoon).  Bento box was a winner as well...the sushi was fabulous and fresh.  First time had the NZ white wine, second time the Kikkoman plum wine. The NZ was especially nice with the mango chicken.   Eclectic mixture of people both times. I love the mood at this place. Hard to define. Welcoming but not intrusive.

u7IXYHcgEEo6jYeHtUvLog.text: I am not sure where all of the 5 and 4 star reviews are coming from in regards to New Zealand Cafe.  We were told to try this restaurant by numerous people when we moved to the area, they told us it was the best sushi in Charlotte and that we would love it because we love sushi so much.  We tried it two different times, on two different days to be sure of our opinion.  It is not good.  Definitely not the best in Charlotte, or in the area for that matter.  The sushi is huge, HUGE. It is a serious challenge to eat without falling completely apart.  Most of the sushi is rice, not a lot of fish going on.  The salmon was good but the tuna tasted off so we didn't even finish those rolls that had tuna in them.  The restaurant is tiny. We were sat no more than a foot from the people on either side of us, so their conversations were basically our conversations the entire time. We did sit outside the first time but with people waiting it was kind of awkward to have people hovering over us while trying to enjoy the over-riced-over-sized bland sushi.  Other reviewers have mentioned it tastes like grocery sushi, that I agree with.  Maybe the prices draw people in and that's why they think it's great.  Most of the rolls are fried in some way, which is probably necessary because some of the fish simply was not fresh and we could not continue eating it.  The service was not great either time we went, if they change things, perhaps we will try it again, until then, on to the much much better sushi Charlotte has to offer!

As8mRqK-0O33Pd3ZhfW3rQ.text: I love this place. I feel that if they expanded, it just wouldnt be the same, I think the atmosphere is conducive to its size, and having a small wait at the door is perfect for this small little joint. The sushi i ordered, Spicy Tuna Maki, Eel Dragon, Fire Cracker Roll and Shrimp Tempura roll, 4 orders total, came out on a giant boat, which made me feel like a pig, but after the first bites of each roll, I wasnt caring what anyone else was thinking. Service was friendly and attentive, and we got everything we ordered, and fast. This is s great spot. I look forward to doing it again soon!

PKw9En-64PBI-I0Q_LAZIg.text: Hands down one of the best sushi places in the area!! This place is hidden in the south east part of Charlotte and very underestimated. Fresh, quick and cheap.

RwyL93Ly7URqNtVpzB7Vmg.text: This was a little bit out of the way for me, but it was worth the drive. It's a cute little place, and I mean little--it probably seats 40 if all the tables are full. If there is a wait you have to stand outside, which is not so great on a chilly night. Despite the small size and large number of people waiting for tables, it only took about 10 minutes for us to get a table. This might have been because we were just 2, but they do seem to turn over tables efficiently.  In terms of food, the sushi was fantastic and reasonably priced. They have a tempura vegetable roll, which is a welcome change to the "typical" veggie sushi rolls that involve some combination of avocado, cucumber, asparagus, and carrots. They also have fried tofu nigiri, which is one of my favorites. The rest of the menu isn't super vegetarian-friendly, but there are a couple of options.  I will definitely be visiting again!

2-q_lNMFsR1VUfeMRaoCBg.text: Hands down the best sushi place in town! And you wouldn't even believe that when you see the place, but its super yummy.   I love all their sushi rolls! The prices are well price, quality is good, sushi is good and you will not leave being disappointed if you are a sushi lover!  The only downfall is that this place is so tiny, it only holds about 40 people. So if you go during dinner time there is usually a 20-60 minute wait. I like to go during lunch hour or before the dinner rush. But there has been time where I've waited for over an hour to get a seat.   Recommended Sushi Rolls:   Sweet Dragon Roll Crunch Max Roll Caterpillar Roll  Spider Roll Dragon Roll

Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Ice Cream

lo_TLpmQRPG7bH891yzbvA.text: As a front desk agent in a hotel, I just love great customer service. I am well aware that dealing in customer service is very hard.  However, the guest deserves a nice experience.  I had heard so much about this place and decided to give it a try.  The food was ok. I did like the mango chicken plate but the service was awful.  It was a Wednesday and the server obviously did not want to be there. She was so rude without even saying hello to us. Her first words were only two of you referring to my friend and I.  In a small nice environment, she made it even smaller and obviously did not want us there.  My experience was not great at all because of the service.

Uo2UFDjkp5bISV3eyVz0aw.text: I finally made my first trip to New Zealand Cafe to find out what all the fuss is about and dang if you kids weren't lying.  We made it there just in time on a Sunday evening so that we didn't have to wait for a table and started things off with some edamame and a couple sushi rolls.  The edamame was extra salty (just how I like it) and the sushi was delish!  I ordered the Trio Special as an entree (I think that was the name).  It consisted of chicken, beef and shrimp in a spicy brown sauce along with your choice of brown rice or garlic noodles.  It is served with a small salad, with what seem to be a watered down shrimp sauce as the dressing, two crab ragoons, and two small chicken skewers.  All for $6.95, are you kidding me?  The service was excellent I considered deducting a star because the place is so small, but hey, I like it like that.  I had a to go box that did not survive very long and as others have mentioned the leftovers were awesome!  I definately recommend you check this place out and you can get out real cheap if you skip the apps/sushi/alcohol.

Vugyz05Yf_VvfOjYn12v5Q.text: Maybe I caught them on a bad, but their reviews do not match my experience. Sushi was not fresh and service was dull. I will give the waitress props for jacking my tip, I paused while putting my change in my pocket and she scoop my left over change about a 25% tip

S5LlizHeLfdZuTAJHCMecQ.text: I was skeptical about all the rave reviews of NZ Cafe's sushi. But they were spot-on correct! Best sushi I've had in the Charlotte area. Very fresh. Balanced flavors and textures. Also loved the seaweed salad. Our waiter was attentive and helpful. The tiny place was packed with a happy, friendly crowd. My new go-to place for Sushi.

DwBesbu-YGPN5PfvuDmT6g.text: I've eaten here well over two dozen times.  The prices are great, service is fast and friendly, and the sushi is great.  When they bring you 3 menus for food, one a huge laminated menu with pictures of some rolls, you know there's bound to be something good awaiting your selection.  I notice that around lunch, if you are not seated by noon, it may be hard to get a table - so duck out a little early.  They have sushi and other Asian food.  I see a lot of folks getting Bento boxes, but I only eat the sushi so can't comment on them.

TmvwX8wIB-p3mr1a8tq8JQ.text: I just wanted to update my review by letting everyone know that not only is this the best sushi in Charlotte but some of the best in the country. Jackie is the man at making mind blowing sushi creations. Don't let the strip mall that this place is located in or the size of New Zealand Cafe deter you. All the people you'll see waiting for a table should be a good indication of just how good this sushi is. If you don't want to wait for a table I would highly recommend going early (before 6:30) or later (around 8:30). It is definitely worth your time to experience some of the best sushi around these parts!

JA6pOdsJqOaip0OUuZmnCQ.text: I was very confused when I first arrived not at all what I was expecting but my friend had been a few times and said it was good so I of course listened and met him there!  First off pretty small and we were lucky to get a table. I recommend to go on a not so busy time (meaning not 7-7:30)   The food was pretty good we just did an assortment of rolls and some edamame and Pot Stickers.   I was most impressed by the service they were very attentive and made some really good recommendations

kvVCrCUBiJ_dJF9-h6fwyw.text: Awful. Both food and ambience. After a 30 minute wait (that's OK for a good restaurant) we were seated at a small table wedged into a cost efficient row of similar two foot tables literally inches from other diners. No way to avoid their conversation, and that's not what their website photo shows.  The food was badly timed with my meal, Mayalasia Buttered Shrimp,  coming before we had finished our appetizers. It was dry and unmemorable. My wife's main dish--a large rainbow roll, didn't even arrive until after she remided the waitress and then I had completed my meal and needed to look anywhere but to the side so as to not stare at elbow-buddy fellow diners as my wife completed her forgotten and then delayed dish.  There are many good reviews but unfortunately we found nothing memorable in any positive way.

I6mhLP7udc0DyPFIBnUTHw.text: I will begin by stating that I am far from a sushi connoisseur. I have been to some fine sushi places (nobu etc, cldc in Barcelona) etc.   I got the lobster avocado shrimp roll and my date got the "master roll"   The rolls very honestly very good and delicious. I especially liked the master roll.   The reason I am giving it 3 stars is because the service is abysmally slow.   The sushi took at least 45 minutes to get here.   It took at least 10 minutes for the server to get my check back to me after I placed my card in the card holder.   These wait times are simply unacceptable. This place could be even busier but they need to get the turnover higher.

WxUo9lzmRaXeECXhXfZCQA.text: Awesome sushi great service   Never disappointed when I eat at New Zealand Cafe!!  Hidden amongst the Chain restaurants that litter the Charlotte landscape.
