OrGut2KiJvE0bCeR29vZgQ.text: My boyfriend likes this place a lot better than I do. But he likes sushi, and I don't.   Very crowded when we went, ended up ordering our food for takeout. It was evident that people loved this place over the Chinese restaurant next door.   I had the mango chicken, wish it came with more chicken and less mango. Hated the rice. Boyfriend loved his two huge sushi rolls but I forget what they were called.   Not sure I would go back unless he begged me to get sushi, but I am glad we tried someplace new.

8V0RAWSjTDlv6tiwRFUO6w.text: Amazing sushi at an incredibly cheap price!  Having lived in Hawai`i for 9 years this was a pleasant surprise to find in Charlotte.   The Poki (poke for the Hawaiians) is amazing as was every sushi roll we ordered.     This place is small and PACKED.  The take out orders and queue for being seated are ridiculously large.  Go early (6pm) or plan to wait!  Or, order take out and arrive when it's ready, it'll probably be a better choice than showing up at 7:30pm any evening.

jxMzehMjrgJY6U0Mcscrsg.text: Sushi was really good.  The place is a little small.  The sushi was fresh, the service was pretty good.  There was a 5 minute wait on a Wednesday around 7:45.  I would go back again

Uck8_AWqdT6lyeBIX8o8Gw.text: This place has gone down. From the mediocre place it had before. The food isn't good at all save your money and the time it takes to get in there.

OC7eDC6lcEJ-z6A16LudNA.text: We got a pretty good selection of different rolls - it was just OK it wasn't special and it definitely wasn't fabulous so I can honestly say we won't be back

3gPHb7WKTZMZPqiqpJnAjg.text: This happens to be my favorite sushi spot in Charlotte! It's a small little place but it's definitely a hidden gem in this area! I always get the teriyaki beef bento box & philly roll! It's always perfect for me!!!

aysKRAQwHeDbgU-Uw-GOBA.text: Great sushi! I had an issue with an entree I ordered but management took care of the issue and removed the order from my bill.   Giving 4-stars only because my waitress was very nonchalant and had an issue with MY dissatisfaction with my meal. I only wanted what I ordered.   Just hope her day got better. Will more than likely come back if I'm on this side of town but won't make an effort to travel across town again.

isu9DP8mY0LR-Hj4H-iGWQ.text: I am such a fan of New Zealand Cafe. My favorite sushi roll there is the Super Tom roll. It has shrimp and cucumber inside and shrimp and avocado on top. Simply delectable. I love it!   Staff at this restaurant are very efficient and helpful. It never takes long for any food to arrive. I really have no complaints about New Zealand Cafe except that the restaurant is small. I wish they were able to expand, because some evenings there are so many people waiting outside for a free table.   However, I usually try to get there before the crowd. Great food!

dROvAFm1h5SK0lM3f_47FQ.text: If you are tired of trying to find the best Sushi in town, this is it. If your friends or family say different just stick to your guns on this wonderful jewel of a place. The best Sushi I've ever had, bar none!!! If you're not sure of what you'd like ask for Kathy and describe what texture and taste, she or her husband will nail it!!! Everything is wonderful, been going here for over 10 years, nothing compares. I hate to tell you about it because it's already busy without you!!!

Q2dxjQRs9VNwPOe2t1fjSQ.text: My all-time favorite sushi place! I think they've been voted one of the best sushi places in Charlotte for a long time now. I'm never dissatisfied and it's always delicious. The only negative thing is the dining room is tiny but we always get takeout anyways. If it's on the weekend be ready to wait! They're good.

QZsA31WM4myalVYEQqQQ9w.text: Sushi and service is great. Jackie, sushi chef is sweet and is great at making sushi.  This is the best sushi restaurant in mecklenburg county. I've tried many other restaurants and they are good but they aren't consistent. Consistancy in restaurants are very important and this place got it down.  Thanks New Zealand for great food, quick service, and customer service.

XxZk0q57THX3fHUpe5enQA.text: It was fine, but didn't really live up to all the hype imo. I had a miso soup, which was good though I really wish they had more soup options. Then we shared 3 rolls: the Master Roll, the Sweet Dragon Roll, and the Lobster King roll. All were good, but nothing really blew us away. We agreed the Sweet Dragon was our least favorite, but we were split on our favorite of the three. Service was friendly, and took an average amount of time for everything. I would chalk this up as a good place when you don't want to travel far for sushi, but I've had better sushi in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Top: Lobster King roll Middle: Sweet Dragon Bottom: Master roll Left: baby octopus nigiri
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. 7 High top tables, 6 two-seater tables, and 5-seat sushi bar. This place fills up quick.

fzDN-EcmkUwwTc5LoChRsw.text: Got there at 5:50pm, waited 50 min for a table (was told 20) and then waited 1hr 10min for food. Crazy. Luckily I had nothing better to do. Ha! Almost nobody in the restaurant had food, yet it seemed that there was a steady flow of take out orders going out. This is not the first time this has happened while I've been here either. I guess I'll never understand why they don't suspend take-out orders while there are lots of tables sitting with NO FOOD for extended periods of time. That said, the sushi is great and the price is fantastic. I'll stick with going for lunch in the future.

SBCGrkCFdNspzV-hM5xnMA.text: Looking for fresh sushi? This is the place to go in Matthews. Fresh, tasty, generous portions. The staff, and owner, Jackie, are super friendly! It's always busy. And if you come in five minutes before closing, they're still eager to serve you!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crabmeat salad! Incredible!!

VsziULsvl5mV8utUtp0K1A.text: Absolutely love this place.  Tiny restaurant with a big heart and great food.  Great service from Kathy every time, all of the other ladies are great too.  Food is always fresh and so delicious.  Prices are very reasonable.  Do yourself a favor and check out these awesome people.  The place has about 10 tables so best to go for a late lunch or early dinner.  Rolls to try: Spider-Man, lemon salmon, bombing, sweet roll, crispy seafood, cilantro roll, volcano, wasabi salmon..... Just go, do it now.

HoyDltNUsYmc-gspaidSiQ.text: One of my favorite sushi places in Charlotte, actually the best in my opinion! The prices are reasonable for sushi and the taste is excellent. We come here often and wait it out since there is always a wait. If you do a pick up make sure to call in at least 30 mins before because it usually isn't ready even when you come in to pick it up. They are usually always packed but it is worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi heaven.

2L7MurYfSkWw0zUcRIxq6g.text: I've only gotten sushi and some apps here. Definitely one of my favorite sushi places. Knocked off a star because there is always a wait. This place is tiny but worth it.

cHk1bFW3mwGkN5-ZcwcsEg.text: A new go to for my sushi obsession! Reasonably price for large portions, this restaurant knows how to do fresh sushi. Go early to avoid waiting, this place is very small on the inside; but even with a wait it is so worth it. I'm told the menu all around is great but my eyes never left the sushi menu. Service is alright and the food doesn't come out very fast; neither bothered my group because we came for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Go for the Boss Lady

ZM5BWZlcCOfxn6jeLo266A.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a long time. We came for a late lunch and I was surprised at how busy they were. We were lucky to get a table without a wait. Our server gave good suggestions and answered all our questions. The sushi tasted very fresh and they have a HUGE selection of sushi as well as other stuff so there is something for everyone.   I got two rolls and I noticed one of my rolls didn't look right. I ordered the spicy crab salad roll and I noticed that the filling looked really clear. I questioned the server and she realized she made a mistake and clicked on spicy scallop roll instead. They quickly replaced it and I was happy with the roll.   Food is good. Great local place. I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy crab salad and cucumber roll
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bigger roll, yellowtail roll, eel hand roll and white salmon nigiri
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charlotte roll

Wnoom2_XeHDjrc_FKB0mVA.text: I've had this place bookmarked forever. So I'm glad I finally got the opportunity to try it.   We stopped by for dinner, when we arrived there was a 40 minute wait. It was worth it!   I started with the vegetable spring rolls. They were pipping hot, crispy and delicious. For my meal I ordered the Discover Roll. Oh my goodness. It has all of my favorite things....spicy tuna, crab and avocado topped with spicy mayo! It was so good. It might be my new favorite roll.   I can't wait to come back. There are so many more things that I'm looking forward to trying!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Discover Roll
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet Dragon Roll
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable Spring Roll

inO8dSwvCJrTV1uZe9Uy0w.text: Best sushi you will find. Long waits are common but it is worth it. But save private conversations for Elsewhere unless you want to share them since tables are so close together. we love this place. Never a disappointing meal!

0l3WDlsFTemLjKYpIA976g.text: Charlotte' best sushi hands down Expect to wait this place is small and very busy but after you taste the sushi all is forgiven as you know you are with a True sushi master yummy

uWNVrDs_LKDWWZ5lBs9qgA.text: We initially found this place because it was right around the corner from our apartment. Our first visit was for takeout and I couldn't believe how busy they were! Food was great and fresh and the prices were even better!   On our second visit last week, we decided to eat in. We went early assuming there would be a wait, but seeing as though it was rush hour on a rainy night, we got seated right away! How lucky! From reading reviews, we assumed we would have to wait awhile.   For an app we got the crab ravioli which was essentially a crab rangoon, which were great. Since I am pregnant, I got a couple cooked sushi rolls with eel, and I hardly missed the regular fish rolls, because they were really good. My husband got a few pieces of sushi as well as a few rolls and he really enjoyed his.   The prices here are great, the servers are very attentive, making sure you always have a glass of water or whatever you are drinking as well as checking in to make sure everything is going well. Luckily for us, we got to sit at a high top, but since the place is small, the lower seats are pretty close together, but it is so worth it!  The way we look at it is, you know you are getting fresh quality fish if the place is always busy! Lots of turn over of inventory which is a good thing!

RgNlFh-T9ViopyC-CyPshA.text: Sushi was great. Had the Big Boss Roll and Thai red curry. Staff was excellent. The restaurant is small, and it was packed - almost felt like you were sitting "family style." But really enjoyed it.

f-51jnPduy4OvJyw7cME2A.text: Some of the better sushi in the Charlotte area.  Small place, usually a wait to get in.

cOQV18fVV7FoJkqFJ2clpQ.text: My favorite sushi spot! The place is small, they don't take reservations ahead of time, and the wait is long...but it's been worth it! Their food is amazing, the atmosphere is great, and the service is awesome!

0RiuCZaIjfNbZYvMp558ng.text: We love this place. The food is great. But the service has gotten slower and slower. Granted, it's Sunday night of a holiday weekend at 8pm, but we've been waiting over almost an hour for our food. Seems that to-go orders are getting priority while we still just sit here. Watching to-go people come and go while we wait is VERY disappointing. Maybe they should treat their sit-down customers with a little more priority. I'm feeling we can't keep coming back here. So disappointing.   Edited to add on 8/8/18: we wanted to try this place again as the sushi is so good, but disappointed to see that they still care far more for the to go orders than the diners. We've been waiting over a half an hour. 5 of the tables still have no food but the to go order folks keep coming and going with HUGE containers. So disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Miso Soup. Very good!

Iml1NUnOTWaK6JHRCUUbcw.text: Hidden gem.  Charlotte agenda ranked New Zealand Cafe #2 sushi restaurant in Charlotte.  Great experience at dinner with an array of sushi selections.   For an idea on price, we spent $50 total which got us 5 quality rolls which are larger in size than most competing restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

0mO-w3ziddAxRvg-sguZsg.text: I'm not sure how we discovered this place but I am soooo happy we did! It's located in a strip mall kind of place but as others have said, don't let that stop you.  They offer some of the best sushi I've had any where! It's also super affordable! Their rolls tend to be larger than what I've had but so delish! New Zealand also offers some original rolls (or at least new to me). It is a small restaurant so don't be surprised if there's a wait. It's worth it!  The staff are quick, efficient and friendly.  New Zealand Cafe is in our list of must visits when we are in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love this fish,
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

QeW3SI-XEYL3HIrG2s4t8w.text: I wouldn't say the service is spectacular or amazing but they do their job. The restaurant is extremely small and almost always packed so expect a wait. However, the wait is totally worth it because the food is absolutely delicious. Price is average but the sushi is great. They use quality fish and they have the best spicy tuna in my opinion. If you like diversity in your sushi, I highly recommend their sushi boat. They also have a lot of other choices if you aren't a sushi or seafood guru.

JZBWolnvYhq05ApqEKNNMw.text: Sushi is a funny thing in Charlotte.  You have your "high end" places and you have an expectation, then you have your "standard" places and you have another expectation.  New Zealand breaks the mold, driving up you figure it's a standard, lower end poor quality place....once you are served you realize it's quite the opposite.  I came to New Zealand on a recommendation from a co worker who, so far, hasn't let me down.  Lunch time on a Saturday I walked in and saw a cramped space bustling with activity.  A huge party and everyone smiling.  They handed me 3 different menus and when they were opened I was impressed at the selection.  My Daughter who has celiac was with me and upon telling the server he gave me comfort that they would take care of her, and when then brought the bottle of gluten free tamari I was sold!    I started out with the shrimp soup.  It took a bit to arrive but it was worth the wait.  Broth had these fried onion things which gave it such a great flavor and it was a perfect start to an amazing meal.  I had the Tom Roll which was fresh, and when I say fresh you can tell they take pride and judging by the amount of sushi coming out of the kitchen nothing there lasts long.  The roll was hearty and well done and I smiled while eating it knowing I had a new place for sushi.  My daughter had a special California roll and was happy with what she received.    New Zealand may need to expand soon as it was packed and people were waiting outside.  The staff was friendly knowledgeable and the guys rolling sushi didn't stop the whole time I was there.  Not sure what level I have to order so that I can get my meal served on one of those huge sushi boats but I'm doing it next time, I swear.  New Zealand, I love you and will be back soon with friends......

7VUG1HgCS5sYmf-wx9TgGw.text: Best. Place. EVER. I have come here regularly for the past  8 years and have never been disappointed. Prices are amazing, sushi is delicious, service is exceptional. One of my favorite places in Charlotte.

dcY9nz_kuYUSFLfTHdeQng.text: This place never disappoints. The sushi is always good, they offer gf soy sauce, and the servers I've had understand gluten allergies and can recommend rolls that are appropriate for your dietary restrictions.  The place is small, so expect to wait for a table if you go at peak times.

zZV55nS6Ep2Klt22CcHPtw.text: Hidden gem in mAtthews area. Totally a hole in the wall place but they serve up some of the best sushi I've ever had. They are always super packed so be prepared to wait. Can also call your order in and walk to the back sushi counter for pick up. The restaurant is very small and cramped. Are usually go with the vegetable tempura roll or the chicken fried rice. Love the vegetable tempura roll because it gives you a variety of vegetables inside of the role. Are usually ask for mine with teriyaki sauce And spicy mayo on top.Prices are very reasonable. If you haven't checked this spot out in Matthews area you need to!

5lTJo0qXcYn3fi97lWHpMQ.text: It's far from a secret, but I guess I'll go ahead and put in my two cents worth. New Zealand cafe has got to be ranked in the top five sushi bars in the city. Between the very reasonable prices, huge selection, and wonderful flavors coming from the sushi bar... you'd be hard-pressed to find a better place. We ordered a few pieces of Nigiri, and three rolls (One came separately and has already been polished off in the photo) but they put the rest on the boat which was really kind a cool. All the good things you've read about New Zealand Cafe are True. Go, hit the scene, eat sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

uodZYX4UUVQ2288Uot6k0w.text: I love this spot! They have an awesome menu and a wide variety of sushi and other dishes. Keep in mind, the restaurant is kind of small, and it is the kind of place where you can easily hear other people talking, so your voice and carry throughout the restaurant. Overall, it is clean, the staff is friendly. Definitely my go to spot on this side of town!

X8fspAJDXuinq--N05lrdg.text: Came at about 445 pm and thank god we were able to get two seats at the bar. Small spot but great food. Read from reviews that this place has a wait because it's a small restaurant. We had some sushi for appetizer and it was so yummy. I tried sea urchin for the first time. Lol. I ordered the crunchy scallop and shrimp, my boyfriend ordered the salmon. Both dishes came out like bento style. Chicken on a stick, crab Rangoon, rice, salad, and entree. Also came with sweet and sour sauce and shrimp sauce! Ordered the plum wine and it was tasty. The servers here help each other and they were all very nice and attentive. The sushi chefs were nice and talkative, I was so amazed with all the sushi boats! Definitely will be coming back here again. I will recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plum wine
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy shrimp and scallops
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ salmon

V67t12jQY6R1lo_L3s1KPw.text: Most amazing sushi in the Charlotte area. Truly creative, fresh and worth the wait. We go all the time!

YVccF4cHpjKNo8wKeF_sfg.text: This is the best sushi place in Charlotte. The problem is there is hardly any seating and the wait is very long! However, it is worth it. They have a large variety of options! I wouldn't waste my time on anything other than sushi if I were you. Also, the prices are very reasonable. Be prepared, it can get quite crowded! It has a very "whole in the wall" vice though.

E1PNCD4AKhQ3KZxRy9dyfQ.text: This place has ruined me for all other sushi!! Everywhere else I go, I'm so disappointed that it's not as good as New Zealand Cafe. ;D Yes, the place is tiny and usually packed. (That's part of its charm.) Yes, there is generally a decent wait time for carry out. We call ahead and just add 10 minutes on to whatever estimate they give us, and the timing works out fine. And it is always worth the wait!! We order sushi for our at-home date nights, every time we have something to celebrate, and whenever we have had a rough time of things and need comfort food. Besides my husband, this is the only number I have on speed dial! There are a TON of other sushi options in Charlotte, but none will measure up!

boCvulQlUb2hkb_Rk0BdoQ.text: I'm not an expert on sushi but this is the best that I have had. The other items on the menu are original and delicious. Friendly staff and good service. You should go!

aWAvrpRgm-yZTkRWGYb72w.text: Guess they are so busy they dont need new customers. Took my daughter to lunch had our name on the list sat and waited for a table and they seat 2 tables who just walked in before us after waiting 25 mins. Really? Thanks we were looking for a good place but weather the foods worth it or not customer service is needed i my opinion.

hL0X-68E65nZAUUVH-d0Tg.text: It has been a year or so since I visited this cafe.  I don't have lasting memories of that visit recalling only that the food was okay.  It is nowhere on my daily travels and I had not returned until today.  Yes, the place is quaint, but only three tables were occupied on this evening during a drenching thunderstorm.  In any case, I stopped in today for sushi and ordered:  1. Vegetable tempura (deep fried sweet potato (MY FAV!), zucchini, broccoli and potato) 2.  Favorite Roll (crispy jumbo shrimp, spicy snow crab, avocado soybean paper with a spicy flavored mayo sauce) 3. Chicken tempura  The sushi was fantastic!  I am a sweet potato lover, so the vegetable tempura with a bit of crunch was delicious (am I partial?...yes!).  The chicken tempura was good, and my favorite seafood roll was pretty darn good as well!  I will be back very soon to give it  another try.  Oh, and I also had Miso soup.  I have read of its 'healing' properties so I wanted to give it a try.  Oddly enough, my visit was Monday and I was pretty sick and stuffy on Tuesday :(  Maybe just a coincidence...    If you haven't visited the restaurant in a long while, give them another try. Perhaps the sushi chef has changed.  If not, my taste buds have changed for the better!

j8NJD_6y43O9fVV9W23tYA.text: I guess its True, you get what you pay for. Sometimes you get alot more then you paid for.  1st time I and my girl tried this place, The folks were very rude, but alas, we could put up with rudeness if the food is good.  We were both very far from being impressed. This was obviously not the freshest stuff...I luv sushi. I eat an awful lot of it, including on the boat with the Tuna's heart still beating (cant get better/fresher then that)  While not impressed at all, we gave it a 2nd shot. Went with another couple. All agreed it was not fresh with none of us impressed in the slightest.  But I guess we should be thankful that only 3 of the 4 of us got sick. Very sick. The only one who didnt get sick also loves sushi and after our extensive meal arrived, and being the expert he is, he chose to not even attempt to try it and ordered a chicken meal. While he wasnt impressed with it either, it was at least edible and he was the only one who didnt get violently ill.   There will not be a third visit.

1c77vaA6CSy1ERSWXas_GA.text: So great! I recommend the Crab and Asparagus Roll. Everyone at the table agreed that it was outstanding. The other rolls that we tried and recommend are the Big Boss Roll, the Crunch Roll Max, Dynamite Roll, Firecracker Roll, and Sweet Dragon Roll. Don't forget to get some potstickers for your appetizer. They are also excellent. The red bean ice cream was yummy.  The fried banana dessert was ok but nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried bananas and vanilla ice cream
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Bean Ice Cream.  Very good!
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

TtjbWgA1kUouTGkpJq2I7w.text: Just wanted to write a quick update - I am still crazy in love with this place. However, I've updated my favorite rolls - I am currently completely head over heels for the Big Boss roll and the Crunch Roll Max. I've tried almost all of the specialty rolls, and have really loved every one. I have noticed that they've been busier, so even lunch is packed now. For good reason. You can't go wrong here. And please let me know when you're going :)

rzacA9OceO7TGmNH9a6b3w.text: I've cheated and swayed a few times but at the end of the day, New Zealand holds my heart. He has all of the qualities you would want in a lover: family-oriented, charming, comforting, original and dependable with a little unpredictable spice. He is simple, but knows all the way to please your palate. What more could a girl ask for?  I've sampled bits and pieces of the entire menu, but truly it is the sushi that retains me an addict, yearning for more. Despite the frequency of my visits, I still to this day have a hard time narrowing down conclusive favorites. There are so many innovative and delicious rolls on the menu that it always takes me the time length of 3 waiter/waitress visits before I decide. I do have one roll that I simply can not live without and that is the Century Roll! It comes with 8 pieces and 4 different "toppings" (2 tuna, 2 scallops, 2 crab, 2 octopus). The scallop pieces are what I live for! I also LOVE the Wasabi Salmon roll. It comes with this wasabi sauce that is creamy and oh so delicious! Plus, they have a $1 Nigiri/Sashimi menu! I recommend the spicy scallop, salmon, yellowtail and quail egg sashimi. They literally melt in your mouth because it's so fresh!  This is by far, one of the best gems in my treasure chest!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wasabi Salmon Roll and Sake (salmon), Tai (Red Snapper) and Spicy Scallop Sashimi. They never disappoint!
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummmmm

3WthIW44_YHg7fS04xRYbg.text: Not really a fan of this place it's very small the food isn't good always taste bland and old it's also noisy and dark I've only been here twice but I wouldn't spend my money here ever again

KM9Z3Euk5xpLlzZHLBrm6A.text: Great sushi.  Great prices.  Tiny building.  We ONLY get takeout from New Zealand Cafe, because the inside is crazy small.  Everything we have had has been great.  Salmon and tuna rolls, steamed dumplings, miso soup, and entrees from the grill have all been fresh and delicious.  I highly recommend... just get it to go unless it's like 3:00 on a Tuesday.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charlotte roll and a vegetable roll.  Never been disappointed.

Y8YBrmwnq66tTggKgU5RsA.text: We've only been in for sit-down twice, and carryout from a friend, once, but every time the experience, and food, has been just marvelous. Or last trip in November for our son's birthday was a party from the get-go. We had 2 ladies waiting on us - I think the hostess Sunny (who wanted to hang out with us after her shift! haha), and our waitress whose name, unfortunately, I didn't recall. But she was amazing! So funny and pleasant and sassy. A perfect accompaniment to our fun gang. She could easily do stand-up. I'm remiss in writing this review earlier because I really wanted to compliment them. I'm not ever sure what we ate (or drank) but I can guarantee it was delicious. If you have to wait to get a table, it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. A most excellent and hilarious waitress. Table-side entertainment!

97NVNZOy_dTo_A4pM5a8zw.text: The unagi don is about average, and sushi is okay too. Nothing suprising but nothing tastes bad. Good to have the option to take out.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Unagi don

pv0UoLnzKaTEGLj6Q5UAKg.text: There is not a lot of seating so come early or be patient. It will be worth it. All food is prepared fresh. Sushi bar right up front with nothing to hind. Hot food comes out from the back. The best deal are the bento type meals. They include a whole  meal.

UBG-VlZiPbv5SBez-5nGjg.text: I love all the sushi I've tried here. It's a smaller restaurant but it's very good! Reasonable priced rolls!

tufQX-kagvAk532xOszHAA.text: Friendly service.  Americanized Indonesian entrees.  Average sushi with above average presentation.  Dressings and sauces 2 stars.  Not a bad place but not some place I would go out of my way to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

xc3I-LdqUy91N_jwoDo9dw.text: We love this place,  seating area is small so we don't usually order in.  We do alot take out and drive from Mint Hill.  Always good.

8ewt4Tr_6MMazLiCdgdyfg.text: Food is great. A little salty for me, but I'm very sensitive to salt. So try it first! Sushi is great! I love the super Tom and tempura roll. Stuffed after! Very small space, so come early come hungry!!

axPOYoTC92J9cwStfdrdhg.text: Eat here with your eyes closed. The decor isn't THAT bad but you certainly don't frequent New Zealand Cafe for its strip mall ambiance. Don't let the fake plants and cramped dining room scare you off. The food is at least fifty percent better than you would think.  Service can be a bit slow so grab an app. Rolls are fresh, varied (tons of non-fried options) and affordable. Four rolls at dinner with beers ran us about $37 before tax and tip. This is a great spot for affordable sushi or try the bento box for a little bit of everything.  I wish they had more outdoor seating -only two tables- but this place is the only place in the area with quality sushi. It is packed for a reason.

tKUPvlBME64tU4XmDmoIww.text: This might be my new favorite sushi spot in town! My usual go to spots for sushi would be Yamazaru or Sushi Guru, but my friend recommended this place for me to try out. It's a little bit of a drive to get here from where I live but it was well worth the trip.  My friend and I came here on a Friday night and it was pretty packed. No surprise there, but the wait was only 20-30 minutes which went by fast. Their venue is relatively small and the ambience isn't as nice as say O-ku or Sushi Guru but don't let that deter you.  After we sat down, our server was exceptionally helpful and kind to helping us order and get situated. We went with the General Spicy, Red Dragon, Wasabi Salmon, and Big Boss Rolls. They were all so delicious and very well-priced. The Big Boss Roll was both of our favorites. I also ordered an 8 Oz craft of Sake for only $6.95. They even presented our rolls to us on a sushi boat which you can find in all the Yelp pictures. It was a cool and neat little bonus. It was so much food that my friend and I could barely finish it. Our bill together came out to be only $50 which we thought was a great deal.  I highly recommend this place and would definitely come back, even with it being on the other side of town!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our order of sushi presented on a sushi boat

tkK1Z-03Qh2akjCrAsVKDA.text: Met up with a small group here tonight...and decided to go for the "Discover Roll" again. Yep...THAT Good!! Better yet, the rolls were better designed this time...meaning, more insta-friendly photogenic!  It'll be hard for me to NOT order this yet again on my next visit, but I need to try some of their other fancy schmancy sushi rolls. Given how they have pictured menu of their specialties rolls, this place is ideal for Sushi Newbies. Honestly, there's at least half dozen that I'd like to try. Their Bento Boxes look quite good too.  Given that it's Friday, it was super packed when we arrived...so we had to wait at least 15 minutes for our table...but the food was well worth it.  I do wish this place was a tad bigger. Felt a bit claustrophobic with so many people squeezed in. Somewhat muggy too, but I noticed that they did yank up the A/C halfway thru our meals.  Still, this place makes amazing sushi rolls at super-affordable pricing, so the worst I can give it is 4 stars. Definitely plan on returning!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Discover Roll&#34;

HAxSGhqVGbobsLy5lfNw8w.text: If you are looking for good quality sushi and affordable this is the place to go. It is a tiny restaurant, and it always gets packed. My recommendation will be to get there early that way you don't have to wait outside for the longest. The rolls are big and filling. I like it because they put a good amount of seafood and not just rice. They also have hot dishes, but to be honest I only have the sushi since it's really good. My boyfriend and me always get 5 rolls and we share, so it ends up being 2 1/5 rolls each. It's the perfect amount if you are really hungry which I always am hungry lol.   My favorite rolls are the general spicy roll the, the rainbow roll, the wasabi spicy roll, and the big boss roll. I have tried more but these were the ones I remember from my last visit.   I totally recommend this place. It's a drive to get to matthews, but I rather do that than to not hit the sushi craving the proper way. Go check it out! Don't forgot to check their times out, so you can go early.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wasabi salmon roll and general spicy roll

58vtsfCp-vGEyJLrGRQbaw.text: Great restaurant.. good portions . Delicious meals . Sushi rolls with spice and tasty  choices . Gets very crowded . I order take out now to avoid long waits ...

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Zealand&#39;s Crispy Scallops &amp; Shrimp  scallops &amp; shrimp sautéed in Queenstown&#39;s special sauce (I prefer Thousand island shrimp) 7/15/18

Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mexican Roll Spicy crab, avocado &amp; jalapeño  Dragon Roll  Spicy eel, cucumber, spicy salmon, crabmeat, jalapeño &amp; house spicy sauce 7/15/18
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Holla  March 4, 2018

0F-90D9ZDhUFLzWtIUXxYg.text: I went here for my free birthday meal. It was a Saturday afternoon around 1 pm. It was pretty busy. Our order was taken quickly, but it took about a half hour to get our food. I always get the Big Boss Roll. I think I could eat this everyday.  Everything was freshly prepared ,hence the wait! I will return again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

hxAbM96sGYWYn8ezVUXN3A.text: I understand why this place is voted for The Talk if a The Town every year since 2011. The quality of the fish is good, the portion is generous, quantity of fish is average, and the best part is, the price point. This place is 40% less than the sushi places in downtown (think of Yamazaru and Pisces) and it's 20% less than your average sushi restaurants. They are constantly slammed and the tables are close to reach other at a somewhat uncomfortable way. IDK if they take reservations but I highly recommend to make one when possible! I had the chirashi bowl which wasn't on the menu but it was $14 for a nice sized entree and a side of amaebi nigiri, which I would not recommend, as it was below average

IEOavgPDojIA-0XwguxXKA.text: Love getting sushi here! They are always packed so if you don't want to wait try going during off hours. They have any and all rolls you could imagine and good prices. The quality of food is very nice. I highly recommend!

z5FLyP08yxpPzAS7oUulfg.text: All my friends loooooooove New Zealand cafe so while in the area i decided to give it a try. I'm not trying to be harsh but i do not get the hype of this place. The sushi rolls were just okay. The price was okay. The tables are very tight. I'll probably stick to my regular sushi places and only come here if friends really want to. The staff was nice and very attentive and didn't make me feel rushed when ordering sushi so there definitely is a plus.

RfY1FOBMIR9r36VMlQOeEQ.text: Tiny restaurant  interesting menu but creative  My daughter and family got the sushi boat. That took a long time to get but it was fabulous  Packed full of fresh sushi  Granddaughter had cute chicken nuggets  I got pork chop bento box. Lots of thing in there too. Good pork. Tender. The shrimp were dry and not really edible. If I wanted to eat them I would have asked for replacements. Good noodles and salad  This is a long way for me to travel. Busy 485  But if I get a chance to go again, I will

ya6l9AQo9JFGIkOxjyU6Ow.text: About the only fish they don't serve here is sardine, however, if you visit at lunch or at dinner during peak hours, and can score a table, you will definitely feel like one. In fact, it's quite amazing how many diners they can fit in such a small space, so much so, that you have to walk single file to and from the restroom and in between the three rows of tightly packed tables.There's a reason for this however, which is everything, especially the sushi dishes, is exceptionally fresh, delicious and affordable. As far as its tiny size goes, that becomes part of its charm.  We arrived around 6:30 on a Friday night, and waited only about 15 minutes before being wedged into... that is, seated at... our table for two in the middle row of square tables. (Quick Tip#1: Wait however much longer neccessary for a high top table along each wall - you'll quickly see why.) We left at 8:00 and there was still about ten people waiting for tables and the two sushi ninja chefs were still coolly and methodically churning out order after order of artistic sushi creations.  I ordered the Teriyaki Salmon Bento Box for $12.95. It contained a good-sized portion of tender salmon, four pieces of California roll, tempura shrimp, brocolli, sweet potato and zucchini, a small salad with ginger dressing and steamed rice. I enjoyed every bite but I didn't stop there. How could I when they also offer sushi at $1 a piece? I chose the red snapper, baby octupus (I know, how cruel), mackeral, fish roe and salmon. Loved it all! Did I mention it was only a buck apiece?!  My wife ordered the fried seafood roll which turned out to be my favorite and the Alaskan King crab roll. They ran $6.95 each, which was about half of what our Ballantyne area sushi joints would charge. With two sodas and tip, our total bill was $45.  Service was friendly and attentive and sanitation score was a 94. It's not quite five stars but it is a Gotta Try in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. $1 a piece sushi.
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box $12.95.
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

bKWBPL5sYU14CJVRy62T7w.text: They have a wide variety of options for great prices, but the venue is very small. We were seated next to another couple and were so close in proximity that we could hear their every word, and I'm sure they could hear ours as well. It was not intentional eavesdropping, we simply had no choice. We could not have a conversation to ourselves, nor could we be comfortably seated without constantly being bumped into. It was like being seated in an airplane.   I ordered the Atlantic Seafood Platter (shrimp, scallops, and exactly ONE small piece of lobster meat with a mix of broccoli, carrots, and zucchini). It came with the house salad, 2 crab rangoons, lo mein, and 2 chicken skewers for $9.50. The noodles were supposed to be garlic noodles, but I could not taste any garlic at all. The main menu (not the sushi menu) makes this place sound like an American restaurant rather than an Asian restaurant, but the food was still prepared in the Asian style and was presented in a bento box. I was disappointed with the small amount of seafood that I received because the menu gave the impression that the seafood would be the star of the meal, but it did not stand out.  I also had the Crunch Roll Max (6 rolls of deep fried salmon, sea bass, tuna, crispy crunch, avocado, smelt roe, and spicy mayo, $6.95) and Crab Cream Cheese Avocado Roll (8 rolls for $4.25). I enjoyed the sushi more than my entree.  This place needs to create a better arrangement for the seating to avoid being so cramped and to also make alterations to the menu description and/or presentation of the main course items to better reflect what the customer should expect. It was also irritating that not only did they refuse to honor their birthday special on the night before my birthday, but they also told me to return the following day in order to receive my free birthday meal. The waitress had stated this with such disregard, and then merely walked away. If it wasn't for the sushi and prices, I'd give this place a lower rating.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crunch Roll Max
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Atlantic Seafood Platter
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Cream Cheese Avocado Roll

dZXIHPe2JbzHqGPU9Rpisg.text: My husband and I went to NZC for dinner last night nd it was delicious! We arrived at 7:45pm and the place was packed! We were told the wait would be 30-40 minutes but it was really just about an hour. The restaurants has about 8-10 chairs for patrons waiting to be seated spread between the back hallway and the front of the restaurant. We chose to walk around Harris Teeter and then sit in our car because it was standing room only and there wasn't much room left. This is how you know it must be good!   Once we were seated our waitress came up and offered beverages and I asked for a pen to mark our choices. We took about 10 minutes to go through all of the menus they provide and decided to order the tuna taco, seafood salad, unagi (eel), and a platter that included 9 pieces of sashimi and 6 pieces of nigiri as well as a salad/soup and a tuna roll. We added two rolls to try some unique rolls out and I wish we hadn't because there was so much food!!   Everything came out pretty fast and the fist as be right there! Fresh. One roll was supposed to be spicy and didn't live up to our expectations. Everything else was great! I was a bit upset that I ate a piece of shrimp with the tail removed to find that there were remnants of the shell that I then had to chew and swallow (because you can't spit things out in public right??), but other than that we had a great experience.  The price is definitely lower than other places in Charlotte and the value and freshness is elevated! For all of what I listed above plus a glass of KJ chardonnay and a Sam Adam's our bill came to $70 before tip. I find that pretty reasonable considering we left STUFFED. Next time I would order a few things at a time to gauge my fullness better. I would definitely recommend NZC.

-B_oR1Wdvl6Xp8LoqukOsQ.text: Decided to go to New Zealand as it recently ranked as the #2 best sushi restaurant in Charlotte according to Charlotte Agenda.   Arrived on a Saturday night around 7pm - likely not the smartest as the wait was an hour (the restaurant was small)..... but in hindsight it was definitely worth it.   I was seated as a party of 2 in front of the sushi bar. Most people probably would have preferred a table, but I didn't mind, as I was able to watch the sushi chefs in action!   When my sushi arrived, I was delighted as my Valentine Roll, not only came out in the shape of a heart, but was so tasty! I ordered a few simple maki rolls but would say that the speciality rolls were better and only about $9 max.   Compared to other sushi restaurants in Charlotte, New Zealand definitely ranks near top of the list. All of the rolls are very affordable priced and taste great.   Also a plus - this place has ample parking.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Valentine Roll

3N1ZtElXDyH4q8KnwSQyCw.text: Best Sushi In Charlotte.  PERIOD!   Love this place. Their menu ca be a bit overwhelming but just take your time and ask for recommendations.    You can't go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Island Roll
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallion Roll
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallion Roll

JC8BZaAlPDQ0kP-XvFP9Yw.text: Good sushi for good prices!  We shared four rolls--Firecracker, Rainbow, Caterpillar, Spicy Dragon and my favorite one was the Firecracker roll! We also shared toro Nigiri sushi!! The tuna was delicious!!! The sushi was fresh and yummy and comes in a cool display boat!    I think there are fancier sushi restaurants in the area but this place had good flavors & good service!  It can get crowded at lunch time. It is in a shopping plaza so look for the sign near Harris Teeter.   In prior visits I tried the Dancing eel Roll & Charlotte roll on different trips here and had fresh flavors both times.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi

9dHOuUWhb5L88O6LUF5TkQ.text: Love this place. The rolls are always delicious. The wait can be excessive at times so plan accordingly because it is a small restaurant. The service is always attentive and some what quick. I would certainly recommend them to anyone that likes a great roll every now and again or serious sushi heads!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

3vw93DpQotcyVjHTA1ERvA.text: DELICIOUS and affordable sushi! Every roll I've tried has been perfection and the meals come with so much food for $7-9-it's insane! It's a tiny restaurant so best to order to go or be okay in close quarters. I lived by this place for two years and now that I'm on the other side of town I greatly miss it. The best hidden sushi place in town

UOFVw8hsZPS2Ih0ALLWKog.text: Great sushi....small place, but will definitely get take out sushi. The menu is very overwhelming I will say lol the selection is great though.

otfpqSpj-2fGUK08iTa2Ag.text: The time it took for our order to get completed was too long (busy Sunday afternoon).  At the time we placed the order they told us that it would be 20 minutes until the order was ready. We arrived at the restaurant 22 minutes after we called. Once we paid for the order we were told it would be ready in 10 minutes. The order after that was not ready for an additional 20 minutes. The food was awesome and staff was very pleasant. Make sure if you are calling in your order, give them plenty of time to complete it (20 minutes is really 40 minutes). Even with the long wait, I would recommend this restaurant to others.

5Xkt2gdkjE-rBr2wE5BJTQ.text: Visited on Sunday morning right after they open. The restaurant got packed soon.  Big boss roll included spicy crab, avocado, tuna and salmon. It was delicious! Sushi & sashimi combo is a good deal. 9 pieces of sashimi, 6 pieces of sushi and tuna roll. Also it comes with either salad or miso soup. The fish was so fresh. It is important to choose a popular sushi restaurant if you want to have fresh food lol The service was good but the order was a little behind at the beginning. Didn't like the $1 sushi. The tamago and little octopus sushi were too cold. Definitely want to try different rolls next time. But I am not sure if I can wait for an hour to try those. I'd rather visit during slow hours.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi and sashimi combo
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. House salad
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tamago sushi and little octopus sushi

jiR-J-xr37vKqjGE-_fhZA.text: I'd just like to say as a born and bred New Zealander the only thing NZ about the place is the sign and some wine. I'd understand if this was listed under pacific fusion but after looking at the menu the name makes little sense apart from perhaps capitalizing off our image...

BDddc2M_yhgqJCMV9e7Dkg.text: Still our favorite Sushi in town, have not been here for months just revisted twice in last month. Treated a friend from Raleigh this last visit. They were very impressed. We did have a wait, arrived during the busiest part of evening but well worth it.

VTCMsb6PjmSbxB1O0M3Kkw.text: I love this place. It's my favorite sushi restaurant. It's small, but that makes it more intimate and not full of people. The food is delicious and the service is great. It can be a little bit expensive for me, but that's normal with sushi.

uKzH7fEKa5eGi-DNePHqZw.text: So we were a little skeptical about eating at what yelp advertised as a one $ sushi place but I must admit we were impressed when we sat down. The food is awesome and the ambiance is pleasant. Definitely a new favorite!!!

BRBeOdRCADRh7-I1NMQcIw.text: Teeny tiny, and in a strip shopping center...don't let that stop you from experiencing fabulous food. My neighbors from South Africa discovered it...my first clue that it was going to be great. They have excellent and out-of-the-ordinary taste in food. Good service in small space. Really odd atmosphere, but tons of delicious food. It will take you 10 minutes to read the menu and decide. It's extensive!! Sushi, teriyaki, stir fry, vegetarian, seafood, beef, chicken, platter...holy cow!!! We do a LOT of takeout. Best fried rice in town. You sit RIGHT next to your neighbor, kind of like a exotic neighborhood diner.

W6aNP1DwH_GS5RuYXodfgw.text: My frist time last night and it was excellent. The place is small and there was a wait, about 15 minutes which wasnt bad. We were a two top and were sat next to another two top where the guy talked non-stop about BS the entire time we were trying to enjoy dinner... the BF is the one who eats sushi, I do not (in fact I eat no seafood except the canned tuna)... he orderede the H.O.T. roll, he was in heaven... he convinced me to try and it was amazing. It was lightly battered and fried and had tuna, I think jalapenos too, I liked that it was slightly warm? I ordered the mango chicken with garlic noodles... the dish came with fried shrimp (BF ate and I asked if he liked and got an mmmhmmm) crab and creamcheese fried thingies (I ate one not a lot of filling but it tasted good, BF said it was decent)... the salad was bleh, cruddy bagged iceburg lettuce with some dressing, I passed. Garlic noodles super good and the mango chicken had really good flavor and a lot of peppers, onions and mangos in it, I perfected it with some hot sauce and ate away. BF had some other wasabi roll and he said that was really good as well. I would definately go back and try something different, I was eyeing the steak and pork chops but figured Id check out the chicken first. I think it would be a good place to order take out and I am looking forward to bringing my brother when he visits.

40UohAsfpbWeKQ-FA7kZ2w.text: I love the sushi here.  It's a bit more expensive than your Harris Teeter fare,  but the taste is a world of a difference away!  I think you really get what you pay for.  The food is okay,  but the sushi is really what sells.  The place is a bit small and very tight especially during peak hours.

xx7ZDELzIIPF2sN4QCfKOA.text: I returned again - and I still think this place rocks - their rolls are huge their sushi is good and even though its small and crowded the staff is very attentive.

1Fyz7aHyKTSTM7RrrzRcww.text: GO THERE! is all I can say! The food is delicious! I had it on Tuesday night and I am going back tonight to have this yummy yummy yummy food. I even had leftovers from Tuesday night and ate it as breakfast the next morning. I swear it tasted better, lol. Customer service is wonderful, although the place is a bit cramped... you can tell its becoming popular. I wont be surprised if they need a new location. I am so happy to have found a new place to eat out at, and close to home!!

2NQMV2hO7sTAG6Ng5beN6w.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte, my personal choice for quality food and sushi at a cheap price, and I bring all out-of-town visitors here.  While their special rolls may be priced in the $10-13 range, standard rolls like spicy tuna run about $4, and my personal favorite, the Super Spicy Roll is $6.    If you're in the mood for more filling fare, the bento boxes are the way to go, as they come with entree, salad, rice/noodles, and a small side item - all for $6.  My favorite is the Thai Curry Chicken, but I have tried almost all entrees on the menu and haven't been disappointed.    My only complaint is that this place is small, with only 10-12 tables, so there is almost always a wait.  and, when they are particularly busy, it can be a little while before your food comes out.  but it is worth the wait, and like someone said before - thats a perfect time for a beer.

U21yu_FciO-fIKiG0rVFtQ.text: Great food, friendly staff. There is limited seating (I sat directly next to where customers paid - they would sometimes lean next to my plate), thus the 4 stars. The food was worth it, though!

TMIY0cSlmEcdwtJFe5pZOg.text: No doubt best sushi in town..Jackie rocks.

auGWp7yGGJ0DZbvL3K6yiw.text: Food was AWESOME and cheaper than I would've believed, with no sacrifice of quality.  I got a salad, an 8 pc roll and a piece of nigiri for just over $8.  The service was... polite and prompt, but rather less pleasant than I usually expect.  That being said, I'll happily overlook the somewhat mechanical service and come back for the food on a regular basis!

yUuJ-ikFEKMEMExPKYqLdA.text: Best sushi in Charlotte!!! We just moved back from Europe and know fresh sushi. The staff is great too. Must get there early or you'll have to wait - but it's worth the wait!  Light on the rice and heavy on fresh fish :). Only thing I would like to see a change in is a better quality wine selection.

7fvjyI6w8GNwawd4zL0ZBw.text: Wow.....all I gotta say is Wow. You wouldn't think driving around in Matthews that this random lil strip mall would provide amaaaazing sushi. But yes I did. A friend of ours who had discovered this sushi heaven decided to take us Charlotte newbies for a real sushi treat. Coming from NYC where good Sushi restaurants are a dime a dozen....I was a bit skeptical. I mean there isn't a True shoreline here in Charlotte. How fresh can the seafood really get? very very fresh is the answer. The restaurant itself is very homey and the service is always polite and fast. The sushi chefs themselves are a bit very slow. Probably because its a father son duo doing their thing. But the wait is worth it. We ordered like 8 rolls and the 3 of us ate and ate till we couldn't eat anymore. the menu is extensive and well priced. But the sauces were the real winners for me. Most of the specialty sushi rolls come with this amazing spicy sauces and they are just divine. I didn't care for the rolls with roe in it because it was a bit too fishy for me. But the rest of the rolls were rocking ;o) Definite try for all sushi snobs and sushi virgins too :o)

PLvivAx12vLvPlgKUgXSig.text: Just ate here for lunch on a whim of a co-worker. This place is awesome! Wasn't sure what type of food to expect. It's a tiny restaurant in a stripmall but it's comfortable. Lunch prices are super cheap and food was awesome! Can't wait to go back to try more stuff. Wish it was closer to home.

2Vs6ulgzBQrsQ6pB6mIWlg.text: Really excellent sushi selection - varied and delicious. This place is a tiny hole in the wall, but it is ALWAYS packed. The people are very polite and helpful. Non-sushi meals are delicious too! I get cravings for this place.

Mmh8hfPv2BUFhvC7NB9k-g.text: Awesome prices, attentive service, and great food. The mango chicken was excellent, and their sushi selection was wide and innovative. In spite of being in a strip mall, the restaurant is pleasant and inviting for dining in. The place is quite small, however, so if you come during peak dinner hours, be prepared to wait. It's worth it!

Jy8tVPZTCashuKpHVqt8Dg.text: I took a chance trying this place but I heard some people say that's the only place they'll eat sushi.  I had 2 pieces of sushi and they were very fresh but I was saving room for an entree.  They have a great selection of food and I was very impressed at the taste, presentation and quantity of food.  I'll definitely be back!

9aR7VT_1Iz4lUvCyrnyegA.text: This people are so nice I hate to leave it on that sour a note. The place is great, the service is great.  Please, pretty please find a better chef and raise dinner prices accordingly. Trying to serve a complete quality dinner for $6.95 today is ludicrous.

KlKqpS1oVMDD07GWOZAwew.text: I've been to New Zealand Cafe several times and have never been disappointed with their sushi or service. In fact, this is probably the best sushi I've ever had. It is, by far, the best sushi in Charlotte (Yes, better than Cowfish). You can't go wrong with any of their specialty rolls. Love the christmas roll

HwIHcV9V-ch07z5Waw4Kew.text: Dont let the Dumb name fool you, this is a good sushi place with no "New Zealand" food or flair. It is a small little place with some good fresh sushi! This is the first place in Charlotte that I have actually really liked their food, as far as sushi goes that is. When you do go there, know that you will be sitting very close to other patrons and will be able to hear what everyone is talking about in the restaurant. The staff is very friendly and accommodating towards odd orders which is nice. The Spicy Mayo is very Mayoie or however you spell that word. Go there on your Birthday and you will get a free meal, 21 and over and make sure you bring your ID. I recommend this place as long as your in the area. I will be going back!

3kVmmCV7Wk5D76PWwssBow.text: Go here for the sushi, it's awesome! The spicy salmon skin rolls are the bomb. Prices are great, service is great.

ZHtMq3wl6CQNgX9Zm6OuXg.text: Love it! Excellent place even on a Tuesday night at non-peak time every table was full. Went there a few weeks ago and the two girls serving were attentive and super friendly. Kind of a small place and tucked away near Harris Teeter but absolutely a top contender for sushi in the area!

mVGMfkuVuRBKuKoh-FdkyQ.text: I came here with my wife and kids.  Upon arriving around 7:30 noticed there were a lot of people outside.  The wait was about 40 minutes and for a Friday night not bad.  With that said this place is worth the wait.  Service was excellent and the food was great.  I even got sushi to go.  My kids 4, 11, and 13 loved it.  The price is also a plus.  I would definitely recommend this place.  We will definitely be back to try some mire great sushi!!

n7NAh6D57jnYaNnTX2cXUA.text: Great place and our kids loved it!  Excellent service. Worth the wait, because it is small and crowded.

LSvlK7nVlBDOI3V_ldTjMg.text: New Zealand is one of the first restaurants I ever visited in Charlotte. I ate there before I even moved into town officially.   And no, I'm not sure why it's called New Zealand, as it's clearly a sushi joint...but it's a GOOD sushi joint, and the prices are really good. I've eaten at a few sushi places around Charlotte, and New Zealand is one of my favorites.  I might not be the best sushi evaluator, as I won't eat anything that had a mother. However, I've never eaten anything bad at New Zealand, and I've frequented the place with pleased meat eaters several times.   My favorites are the seaweed salad and the edamame. They've got some interesting desserts, like the red bean and green tea ice cream. I kind of like the tall tables, too...  One day, I'm going to order one of those giant sushi boats!

QYwtuPiGDzc4M7L8rL3Egg.text: Great place with great service and sushi! Everything was very fresh and for very reasonable prices. I spent $56 on tons of food for 2 people that I would have spent double in most sushi restaurants. photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. not happy

2UZGFXrMcO-DzY4MUKJFQA.text: The name, New Zealand Cafe, is quite misleading. We've never been to New Zealand (the country), and are not at all familiar with its cuisine. We also would not consider it a "cafe" per se. Overlook the name and get yourself to New Zealand Cafe at your very first opportunity. A very pleasant surprise awaits you. This is a real deal Japanese establishment. The centerpiece, at least for us, is the sushi bar although table seating is available along with an array of traditional non-sushi menu offerings. We go there for sushi alone, at the sushi bar, and have yet to take a table. I must mention that the sushi bar only seats 5, so you may have to wait during peak periods. Believe me, the wait will be totally worth it. If you are rushed or impatient, fret not, all sushi bar offerings are also served table-side.  Jackie, the owner and Chief Itamae, is an incredibly warm and engaging person. He's also very focused and most passionate about his establishment and delivers outstanding sushi, from his hands to your palate. His assistants are trained by him and he keeps a gentle watch over them, ensuring that we, his patrons, receive top quality at all times. We've been there in his absence, and the quality doesn't falter. His persona, however, is missed on those rare occasions.  We typically order a diverse variety of sushi and sashimi, so much so that it's served to us in a large wooden "boat" - an artfully tasteful and traditional Japanese presentation that never fails to garner the awe of fellow patrons. Our favorites include: Toro, Mackerel, Yellowtail, Albacore, Scallops (both regular and spicy), Uni with optional Quail Egg, Flying Fish Row with optional Quail Egg, Eel, and Baby Octopus. As starters for us, the Calamari Tempura, Spicy Tuna Roll, Crab and Shrimp Roll, Salmon Skin Roll and Tuna Tartare are all excellent.  I've eaten sushi around the globe regularly for 40 years, know it well, and can attest without reservation that New Zealand Cafe offers the very best sushi in Charlotte, NC. Just take a look at the numerous awards and proclamations proudly displayed on the wall behind the sushi bar.  What are you waiting for??? Go there, NOW!!!

wVMzbL4stYbSlE3D5zx6Vw.text: Best sushi restaurant in Charlotte! I've been coming here for about 6 months and never had an issue. We order every single week. Very good taste, best customer experience and they are great for takeout. I've tried other places and always find myself coming back here!

9qZWJljfOW_K_ZMXIKexIQ.text: My fiance and I absolutely love New Zealand Cafe, a hidden gem in a less than stellar strip mall (with a name that sounds like it has nothing to do with sushi). It is some of the best sushi we have ever had at prices half as much as most other restaurants ($7-11 for a roll versus $12-16 elsewhere, for example). With that being said, we no longer actually eat at NZ Cafe. The restaurant is TINY. As in, I hope you want to have dinner with the strangers sitting next to you because you'll be on top of them and vice versa. Also, with only a few tables in the restaurant (maybe 10 tops), on busy weekend nights you might find yourself waiting for up to an hour. Once you're seated, the service is typically great (friendly, cordial) albeit slow as molasses so don't expect this to be a quick trip. One dine-in experience took about two and a half hours from start to finish.  As a result of the less than stellar dine-in experience, my fiance and I order takeout regularly instead. We call ahead (well before we are hungry because take-out can take a while, too) and pick up our sushi to enjoy at home. They have a nice variety and it is great quality as well. I would highly recommend this place for sushi takeout any day.

uMcw93PNiBq4YEEGaAqtdw.text: Don't let the exterior fool you. Sushi is absolutely delicious and some of the best prices around. Definitely give it a try!

TCoBsNxsV1CeT0ic_jz_8A.text: New Zealand Cafe is hands down my favorite sushi spot in Charlotte. They have the best prices around without sacrificing quality. Everything is fresh and service is always good but expect long lines during peak hours. uKv0I5a_OxgM6bjvblafnQ.text: My husband and I came here last night with another couple....this might now be my favorite sushi in Charlotte!! It's a hole in the wall sushi place within a strip mall.   We split 7 rolls between the 4 of us and it was a TON of food. They even brought it out in a boat (ok, ok, we requested the boat because eating a ton of sushi out of a boat is just so much cooler than on a plate!!). We ordered the cilantro roll, valentine roll, dynamite roll, sweet dragon roll, wasabi roll, christmas roll, and volcano roll. All were absolutely delish! My favorites were the cilantro roll (just super refreshing and light....loved the lemon on top) and the valentine roll (soy paper and shaped like a heart!) No man was left behind on our boat!  Prices were very good. I think the final bill was a little under $40 a couple for all those rolls.  Just a note, this place is very very small. So, I would come early or later to avoid waiting for a table. We live in Uptown, so it is a hike to get to New Zealand. However, I think it'll be worth the drive when my next sushi craving comes around!

tsHQozYA8akyrXn4ehMA4w.text: Stayed up the road and did a search for sushi.  Was concerned about the name but gave it a shot. Vw3HuOo986rIXHDbEoY71A.text: I've been going to New Zealand Cafe since they opened.  (Can anyone remember when it was a Sub Dudes? Yea.. Still amazed at how much of the decor they kept--but I digress.)  New Zealand Cafe makes you think you're going to be eating Kiwi foods, but you're not.  I still don't quite understand the connection in that light but it is what it is.  Now if you're looking for a great and fair priced Bento Box, Sushi, or a spread of menu items that are all quite tasty and again well priced then you are in for a treat.  We've roamed the menu over the last few years and while I often get Sashimi bentos or some collection of Sushi rolls, when I am hungry I'll grab a roll and a entree and still feel like I made out great.  The service is interesting; sometimes we feel like we're coming home--sometimes we feel like we need to wave for a glass of water.  Just go with a bit of room in your flexibility for service.  This also includes patience.  This place has got to be no larger than 800sqft of sitting space which translates into a waiting game if you go any time near dining hours.  We will always go early, or go late, but never go during dinner rush.  If you don't like waiting, and you really need to be doted upon there are many places in Charlotte that will charge you waaaay waaay waaay more for the same quality of food.  I'd rather afford a healthy amount of great food than pay for a store owners overhead.  You're going to have to make that choice.  So if you want some great sushi and bento combos head on over.  Hell you even get a free meal on your birthday--now that rocks.

fzUYFzjmcch1WYMUJgDSRQ.text: There's almost always a wait here, and that's because it's sooooo good and so cheap! The main courses come with a TON of food and they are all around $8. Plus, the sushi is awesome. Love this place!

0gd4gTj8PS-5FcAAtlVn9g.text: Best sushi place in the Charlotte area! Only issue I have is the environment. Cheesy string lights, fake dusty plants and a cramped area make it less appealing. But, the sushi is soooo good. Crispy Eel roll is the BEST!

1WcMFlP2kiapcROtW-CeKQ.text: I've been sitting here for 1 hour and 25min and I just received my food. Great food, but order to go. They take priority in that.

leg7J4qkKBFNP1MQ3Nls2A.text: Another on my list of "how have I not reviewed this yet?"  It's easy to pass this place, or to confuse it for the Best Wok next door. New Zealand Cafe is a tiny parcel in a crowded strip mall that is serving incredible Kiwi-inspired Japanese dishes at amazing prices. The bento box is by far the best deal. It's all from the grill (instead of the customary sushi), but you get an unbelievable amount of tasty food for about $10.  Speaking of sushi, they work wonders. They have a sushi bar, where you can dine in front of the chefs and watch them work - their grace and elegance is worth the visit.  Do be advised that take-out is usually be best option. It's very small and quite "cozy" inside - if you have one of the low, square tables in the middle, odds are good you'll get to know your neighbors.  Don't let that deter you though - great Asian-fusion at the Galleria!

xBBHcDMmM2a0AoYnoRLQ3Q.text: Great fresh sushi, over-sized meal options and great service. I lean towards the chicken and shrimp hibachi.
