The service is slow compared to other restaurants but I suspect that is because of the quality of food you are receiving.  The Firecracker Roll is BY FAR one of the best things I have ever eaten.  The Dynamite Roll is very good.  The Hamachi Nigiri (farmed yellowtail) was delicate and delicious.  Their Unagi Nigiri is amazing.  Enjoy!

beF_3HJFwya-41P2W7yTLQ.text: If there was a 4.5 star option, I'd pick that one.   Cons first: smaller space, longer wait. That's it.  Pros: WASABI TUNA ROLL. AND spicy tuna roll. And tiger roll. and... (you get it).  This place has some awesome sushi. I should know by now to not judge a book by its cover, but I was NOT excited when we pulled up to join some friends for dinner.   There were four of us and we ended up completely destroying 7 rolls of sushi. I would have gladly had just one, but our friends couldn't make a decision between some of their favorites, and then we happened to score a free roll because of a birthday in the group (a banana concoction of some sort that I keep thinking about, days later- super creative and delicious). No rolls left. Every morsel of rice gone.   I also appreciated the presentation aspect of this place. The sushi looked incredible- like something you'd find at a much more expensive and upscale restaurant. They also use these large bamboo boats to serve the larger orders on. Apparently that's a "thing", but I've never seen or heard of it. Nice touch.   New favorite sushi in Charlotte. No contest.

cfnQ1qZnYaiSIzW033m0hA.text: This is the best sushi place in Charlotte. Man! It is a bit expensive but it it totally worth it. Close your eyes and randomly pick an item, you cannot go wrong.  Service was great. You feel like family when you come in. You can tell they truly appreciate your business.  It's only flaw, it's located in a strip mall and is very small. Seating is limited and the wait can be long depending on when get there.   You can never go wrong with takeout.

gmZ-SSx1I3ZKtak9vsVweA.text: New Zealand Cafe is such a tiny place. The sushi is among the best I've had though. Great prices and a huge variety of rolls. Friendly service too!

8mV4x86OPZUwP8VWGU4Zaw.text: While the place was super busy and this is a great sign that the food is going to be great, I decided to get something to go. First time here waited at door until I was able to get my to go question answered. Went to register in back where I was promptly ignored by a early thirty thin Asian woman. She continued to ignore me while I waited for her to count money. Then she showed me she could indeed multi task by taking a phone order before she even said hello.   Might still give it another go, just in case she  was having a bad night.

xCQhEU9kXvrsjNUGdVk0SA.text: I love New Zealand Cafe. It is by far one of my favorite sushi places to go to and it is 'oh-so-close' to where I live, lucky me! The restaurant itself is small with just a few tables and decor that might not really make sense. But I'm not here to look at the walls, I'm here to mow down on some sushi...correct?! Correct!  Please try the Poke, it's delicious, and I love the lemon they turn into a snail with their garnish artistry. Eat this, and you won't be disappointed.  Normally I get 2 rolls, usually with eel or shrimp, those are my favorite types of rolls. Sweet Dragon is good, and if you like spicy for for Spicy Dragon. Take some time to try the single Nigri pieces too!  Can't have rice????? That's okay, there are 5-6 rice-less rolls on the menu. Try Bamboo Roll ..............................................$ 10.95 Red snapper, tuna, salmon, flying fish roe, scallion  wrapped with thin sliced cucumber & ponzi sauce  While sometimes there can be a line out the door due to is uber goodness and small seating area I will always come back to NZ Cafe!

V8ChslzTNUNb8B76LSvXsQ.text: New Zealand Cafe is the place to go for some outstanding food! I've been going here for years and it has never disappointed me. Everyone must try the Tuna Poki but instead of avocado replace it with cucumbers!

chm9bBwH2knq3xxa74t64g.text: This side of town does not afford many options in terms of Sushi.  Fortunately, we have NZ Cafe tucked away across the street from us.   This tiny place is always packed serving quality sushi at a great price.   We usually get carry out as most nights there is a wait for a table.   I recommend the spider and sweet dragon rolls.  Definitely two of our favorites.  Our only "complaint" would be the size of the place.  It would nice if they could expand a bit to give everyone a little more elbow room.

5phj3_-RCRAWEhtnalxbAg.text: Always fresh and delicious sushi!  The selection is awesome and has something for everyone.  One of my favorite places.

EzSJuD_jgM70vGCUlZQ69g.text: The food is good but the service is so slow. The restaurant itself is tiny so the time it takes for food to be made & brought to your table is ridiculous. Out last visit it took the waitress almost 15 minutes to bring us water and our food took over an hour. Once the food arrives it wasn't prepared as we ordered it.  I noticed they do a heavy amount of take out and people were complaining  about their takeout orders taking over an hour.  Management needs to get a new business plan in place because if they don't this place will lose its popularity and close down.

H_NsLfILoftI9trLobYm0g.text: We used to enjoy coming here, but the last couple times have been disappointing to say the least. We waited almost an hour to be seated on Tuesday night, after our order, we had to wait another 20 mins. I ordered the bento box which was supposed to come with a california roll. Everything was overfried, chicken was bland and the california roll was pitiful and tiny and looked like it was made by a 5 year old. I couldnt even call it a sushi.  We decided to get a take out couple days ago, figured we's skip the wait this time. We ordered the season platter which was supposed to come with postickers, shrimp and egg rolls. The potstickers were extremely small, as well as the shrimps(they also tasted raw and not grilled as described). The "soy" sauce that came with it was just soy flavored water. I had to toss it. The bamboo sushi was also 1/2 the size of a normal sushi roll. Definitely not worth the $22.  Looks like we'll have to look for another good sushi place

2QfqwSwR7zUqZaGpX61NHw.text: New Zealand isn't the quickest place to get sushi, their restaurant is very small and compact, and it's seemingly always crowded from open to close. I've waited thirty minutes or more several times, but once you sit down and enjoy your first bite, you realize why they're so popular. It's easy to tell the chefs at NZ have a passion for what they do, the sushi is fresh, clean, flavorful, and has great texture. Just trust me and your fellow Yelpers, if you like sushi and you live in Charlotte, this is your place.   I recommended NZ to a couple friends who never tried sushi, and had them try the eel and shrimp tempura rolls, a mild, safe bet for a sushi first timer. Of course they loved it, but I was surprised when they devoured the mackerel nigiri. I'm so grateful that I live near NZ, but if I didn't, I'd go a few miles out of my way if I had that hard to satisfy sushi itch, and once you try NZ, you just may too!

X8pPXmTsWnlki2jTZhNKeg.text: Love love love love NZ Cafe. The best sushi I have had anywhere in Charlotte. I agree with those who say it towers above the rest. I've never had an experience where I felt any of my raw fish was less than perfectly fresh---- even on a Sunday, where the fish couldn't have been delivered that same day. My husband is a chef so we never get to go out Fri or Sat and I've learned that going out on a Sunday or a Monday is the True test of the quality of a restaurant.   As for the "complaints" on the wait times and size of the restaurant I have seen on here-- that's part of the deal when you go out to eat! When something is good people take notice and sometimes, yes you have to wait for a table!   I can't believe anyone reviewing NZ would write anything bad about the staff, as I have always felt them to be extremely friendly, attentive, knowledgeable, and generally a well-oiled team. People who do not work in the food service industry conveniently are unaware of the fact that restaurant staff usually have many things on their mental to-do list at one time and many hungry people to make happy and run around trying to remember everything and keep their heads above water when they are  busy. That may have been a run on sentence but I wanted to make my point.  As for what I order our guilty pleasure is the Favorite Roll. Totally gringo but I don't care it's that delicious. Could go on and on about all the great rolls we've had there, as well as nigiri, and their cooked entrees as well. Looking forward to going back tonight.

vqjzDi8r8J2vJDF7IOi6Bw.text: Yum! sushi is awesome. A lot of deep fried rolls, which I am not a huge fan of. But we ordered 4 rolls and they were all good. (I'm not sure if it was worth the 45 min wait for a table). They seem to have a quantity over quality mindset, when it comes to seating tables and doing to go orders. The restaurant is tiny though, so arrive early if you want want to go on a weekend.

lu8IcY-r5tKWq0jztLaSCQ.text: New Zealand Cafe is a small sushi and Asian cuisine restaurant tucked away in a small strip-mall near Matthews. The sushi is always super fresh, the rolls are creative, prices are a steal and above all the food is delicious.  If i lived closer i would be here at least twice a week. Easily. It's that good. The space itself is pretty small so more times than not there is a wait to be seated. They do a decently paced turn-over on the tables though so its usually not too long and it is totally worth it.  To kill time I usually grab a menu and to read so when im in i am ready to order. Everything i have ever had at New Zealand Cafe has been great! Ginger salad, miso soup, apps. noodles, chicken entrees, seafood entrees, sushi... all soooo good! The sushi is outstanding. Some of the best in town.  If you order enough of it it they will put it on a boat for you. Know someone who doesn't appreciate a good sushi boat? Well, their entrees are awesome too. For around $6-10 the entrees include- the protein (ex: Mango Chicken, Teriyaki Chicken etc) , rice or noodles, a house salad and then 2 of the following: chicken skewers, fried shrimp, crab rangoon. That's 5 items for as little as $6 and no they don't skimp on the portion size either. There will most likely be left overs to take home. It's almost hard to believe how good of a deal these meals are. If your ever in the area, or hell-even if your not, I suggest a trip to New Zealand Cafe. It will not disappoint!

mFOGhg7Dy4vM-KxbiMKOzg.text: Great sushi I think the best around  fresh as always. If you have not tried this place you need to.

yedQTlN5XjynrrCwa8zMeQ.text: Amazing service and very tasty. I'm allergic to fish and they always have good alternatives. I've had a good experience every single time and always recommend them.

u5IpDNJxi3DQPpdl0u965A.text: Small but worth the wait. Yes there are all your traditional sushi items on their menu but then there are some real gems. Unexpected, and crazy delicious. I wish it was closer for us...

uADNga2DQS1tOqa6DPD0PQ.text: We were just in the Charlotte area for a night after an event. This was recommended to us and near where we were staying.  Glad we went! I had the Toro nigiri and a salmon dish. My bf had a chicken dish. The nigiri was SO good. The other food was good as well. I'd go back if in town again. Plus the prices are very reasonable. We thought it must be the lunch menu prices at first.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

PWlfPyHPgBlrIA7ozHerqA.text: First visit today. Excellent sushi. All four rolls I tried were delicious. At 5:45 (!!) there was a wait so get there early. It's too far for my to get takeout from this place which makes me sad but I hope to eat there again.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

we_verFc6mlzYaG_eXNjsA.text: Small spot, but they are cranking out some amazing dishes. I am a big fan of sushi. This restaurant has some of the best presentations and rolls in the city. The prices are great and so are the portions. Great food, great value, great service.

Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some of the beat sushi I&#39;ve had in Charlotte.

9sETn-qYLmJKT8ql4xbw2g.text: Superb!!!!!!!! Hands down the best sushi place in town. Outstanding service too. Now... because they are good the wait time can be a little longer (30-60mim) on the weekends but it is totally worth it. So so so....glad I found this place.  I also see a lot of takeout customers because of the wait time but that also tells me they do excellent food here.

04FQkOvPGLBCLwCH3jI44Q.text: The only reason why I'm giving New Zealand Cafe four stars is because of the space. The owners should just buy both buildings on either side of them, knock down the walls, and expand! It's just too small! Other than that, everything is wonderful. The waiters are polite. The food is great. Even the ambience is pleasant. It's just too small. If they would deliver, that would make everything a whole lot better.

orR02ALm4DIi9WpoKnyjTQ.text: Best sushi in Charlotte, hands down. The Valentine Roll is my absolute favorite and I order it every time. Even if I don't have time to stop and eat, I order it to go almost every time I'm in the area. They don't take reservations so if you're in a rush, make sure you're really early. The restaurant is TINY but the food is incredible. If you're looking for good sushi with knowledgeable staff that can make recommendations, this is your place!

yy1vcuDnf01N4qtdEQcc5g.text: The tuna sushi made me sick. However overall it was great. I would advise you not to eat tuna sushi.

SxZhFITeGXyR-oIdFQvehw.text: My boyfriend and I have been coming here for about 3 years. We have only had one bad experience here and it was with a new and inexperienced waitress at the dinner rush. The food lives up to its expectations and is well worth the wait(sometimes up to an hour/hour and a half at the dinner rush). Staff is always friendly and helpful. The atmosphere is amazing and if you sit at a low top table most of the time someone next to you will start up a conversation. Some of our favorite rolls are: the valentine roll, the favorite roll, ichiban spicy roll, wasabi salmon roll, and spider roll. The potstickers and ahi tuna are great starters as well! Pictures of our various favorites(and other great rolls as well) will be attached!

This is a small operation, a couple of waitresses and two people preparing the meals on the counter prep area and a lady who seems like the main person. Place came highly recommend and did not disappoint, platters seem like a work of art, are tasty and flavorful as well as the most exquisite presentation. Great place for informal and casual dining. Top nothc!

VQcFlqMIjxynmWkXGgQ2Ow.text: Hands-down the best sushi that you can get in Charlotte. It's a very small location so I wouldn't suggest trying to go at a peak time but you can always get takeout and it is amazing!

2To89n6-FNebsaQ9WAdrjQ.text: As a connoisseur of excellent sushi, I am thrilled by the presence of this unassuming eatery. Unbelievably fresh sushi at unbelievably low prices; no other Japanese restaurant in Charlotte can rival its price and artisan quality. Period. Unfortunately, I must "dock" one star as the wait staff service needs improvement, but I suspect language barriers may be the primary culprit. Otherwise, this eatery is 5 star-worthy!

B4yOWNbvdT0c1EYdTdyngA.text: Wonderful sushi at a good price. Only negative was the overcrowded nicely decorated, clean, but small dining room without a decent waiting area on a cold night. Still five star food and service.

iojckScBDkqvn0skwvPJQA.text: Believe the hype .. everything is delicious.. I get the dragon roll .. and remember you get a free meal on ur birthday

ZYq8kBY5T5DwNlPv1OKJXg.text: You know there was a time when I didn't like sushi but this place really sets the bar high when it comes to the sushi.  I took a friend here last night and was impressed by Cathryn's knowledge, empathy and customer service while she took care of us.  The decor and design could use a revamp.  They are usually quite cramped here just because of all the business they receive.  I will say their machine accepts Apple Pay, Android Pay, Samsung Pay, Microsoft Wallet and other NFC compatible payment services BUT GOOD LUCK getting the manager that usually runs the register to let you attempt to use it.  I was successful but she was like next time bring your card.  I won't be bringing my card because I never carry it on me so if they won't accept my method of payment which literally every other merchant will accept or at least attempt to accept then I won't do business at your establishment.  This is no reflection on Cathryn's service as she was trying her best to get it to work and was a star for hospitality and customer service.  You get a very decent amount of food here.  I was full and had to take the rest home.  This place really makes great food and fresh sushi.       If I have cash I may stop back by otherwise if they don't want to let me pay how I want guess I can't eat there

DFSWFoGACj39blGtnBbh1A.text: Best sushi (and best prices) in the area. This is a must try for anyone wanting sushi in the area. The restaurant itself is TINY, and you will probably have a pretty decent wait for dine-in. We normally do take-out and have always enjoyed

3l6o-_rhm3ewyaZn5OZhPw.text: Waited over an hour for soggy salty sushi. Super tight seating, unorganized waitlist situation. Never goin back

l_LGV1_9Wzy61TBTGNc9Vw.text: New Zealand was recommended to us by a friend and we are so happy it was. Hubs and I visited here a couple years ago and then went again recently with friends, and it's still amazing.  Don't judge a book by it's cover - the place is small and it's located in a strip mall, but it's one of the best sushi places in Charlotte. Depending on where you are located, it's a bit of a drive, but again, worth it. The inside is small but it's clean and cute. The staff are knowledgable and skilled; our waitress took our order for 4 people and didn't write anything down. Impressive!  The menu is diverse and they have bento boxes and other authentic dishes besides sushi. The variety of rolls is awesome and they are always FRESH. The prices are very reasonable too - 6 sushi rolls and a bento box costs us $58. This place is definitely a hidden gem!

OXZZqJZFVGcTjrh5D0nlSA.text: Great sushi place. Very small establishment, only 12 tables and can feel very cramped and over crowded. I will definitely come back, next time I will order my sushi to go instead of eating there. We waited about 25 minutes for a table for two and about 30 for our food. The sushi was delicious and tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

K7sUZIXRx6lSIn0ZVMf1EA.text: Fantastic as usual.  Keep it a secret, it's always packed.  Perfect tim to go on a weekend is between 4-5 unless you want to wait.  But it's worth the wait!!!

3i9_dX0_Kh4_skymnZVq9g.text: Good food! More than enough to fill you up. Only complaint is the place isn't big enough. You have to wait forever to get a table. That's why we usually get it to go.  That shows you how good the place is. If a place is empty you don't want to go there.

1UpE2jpiEmbrGW0ytoNrXQ.text: This is a place you would not know about without word of mouth/"best of" lists. It is in a nondescript shopping center off of Independence Blvd. it has kind of tiki bar interior and seats about 40 or so in close quarters. They have multiple menus, but we stuck with the sushi one since we had heard it was one of the best in the city. The sushi was terrific. Very fresh and a great variety. I had the Special California roll which swaps crab stick for the real thing and it was delicious. The albacore nigiri was fresh and soft. My husband's tempura tuna roll was yummy and not greasy. Waitstaff is really nice and attentive. Service was a little on the slow side for our entrees, but they were a full house and since we didn't order any appetizers, the wait was longer. And we're still getting used to the South's slower pace. It gets crowded, a wait for a table for 2 was about 10 minutes--half the time they said it would be. They also have outside seating, if you don't mind the heat or a scenic view of a parking lot and a Hungry Howie's. Prices are great for what you get. We will be returning over and over. Yey, NZC!

1wr_PfY2awf6CKaFgtccjQ.text: THE BEST SUSHI ROLLS IN CHARLOTTE. Having in mind that sushi calls for horse, cow and fish, ( THE FIRST TWO YOU ARE NOT GOING TO FIND IT HERE)this is , if not the best, a great place to indulge yourself  eating this beautiful asian dish!!

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. 4 rolls boat!! Favorite roll, sweet dragon roll, spicy dragon roll &amp; lobster roll, what ambrosia!!!
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shirmp and vegetable tempura, edamame &amp; hot thai sour soup!! GREAT!!

pySC9_YCBOWw-vMbZUMyqw.text: Solid food but always crowded and not worth the wait. Tastes good with fresh ingredients but not worth the hype of being one of the best sushi places in town.

n3s8td3B24D8b0kj71K6qQ.text: Do you like eating sushi? Do you like eavesdropping on your neighbor's conversations? If you're looking to do both, New Zealand Cafe will be right up your alley.  Come prepared to wait. The place is small and it's become very popular over the past several years. The sushi chefs behind the counter are rolling like crazy, but there's only so much room. If you're dining as a twosome, you'll be seated in the center section and you'll be within elbow's reach of the diners next to you. If you're lucky, you'll overhear an awkward first date.   The wait and the cramped quarters are generally worth it -- the sushi is great and it's very inexpensive compared to other places in Charlotte.   The only thing that keeps me from giving five stars to New Zealand is the accuracy. More than once, I've ordered scallop nigiri ("hotate gai") but I've received surf clam nigiri ("hokki gai"). Not a complete dealbreaker, but it's an unfortunate repeat issue.   Overall, this place is great and affordable. Worth a visit for sure, especially before or after going to the movies across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Another boat!
Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. If you go hard on your sushi order, they&#39;ll bring it in a boat. Beautiful!

ygZcRNSGJtc4MGx_cj5qlg.text: Had the worst experience there today. Waited over an hour for my food and all we ordered was sushi. Nothing had to be cooked. When asked what took so long, there was no real explanation other than the guy that makes the sushi the fastest was not there. No apology, no trying to make it right, NOTHING!!!!!! WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!!Although the food is great, it is not worth the wait. I will NEVER go back! Unless you have unlimited time to sit around and wait on your food, stay away!!!!

5px0_Gtj0zB7RIFoMT4Egg.text: I had heard a lot of praise about this place and had been wanting to try it for a while. Unfortunately I will not be returning, as it took us(2 people) nearly 2 hours to complete dinner. We ordered crab salad to start and 4 rolls to split. It took over 30 min for the crab salad to come out and nearly 1.5 hours for the rolls. Being that the place is so small we could easily see the issue, they were filling every single takeout order prior to the dine in orders. We could clearly see the sushi chefs working on nothing but takeout orders. Orders should be filled based on when they hit the system and it blows my mind that they would neglect the customers that chose to dine in. After leaving I scanned the reviews and noticed that this seems to be a common issue here. It's truly unfortunate that they have such a poor system in place because the sushi was actually good and if not for this major issue I would absolutely return.

09atw9LeXgDAUUf7CR0O9g.text: The food was really good. Spring rolls and pot stickers were good. The hibachi chicken was good. The rice was excellent. The teriyaki chicken on the side was overdone and dry. Seaweed salad was good as was the chicken with noodles. Didn't try the sushi, but what I saw was good. The biggest complaint was the size of the seating area. They have several tall table that can seat 5, but the space is not being utilized well. The service was good. Small wait for the entree's (25 minutes). Overall, good food, prices are reasonable. Other people have argued about the service time. We went at 6:00pm on a Monday.

Sz-LdEI31gJv55YS65fr0A.text: We went based on what we had heard and read on Yelp. I'd have to disagree on the 'best' in town. Until the food was served, everything matched the positive reviews. There was a line. It was small and quaint.  I order two different rolls. I think one I ordered was a H.O.T. Roll which was described as spicy tuna, cream cheese, with jalapeno and lightly battered. The tuna tasted like it was from a can.  The other roll was a safe order meaning that it is a roll you could get anywhere and it would meet expectations. I think, with anything, you must try a place for yourself to make your own judgement. Service was friendly but the food was nothing to get excited over. It's not a place I would be excited to try again.

rUyZoT7nhYgdKRqr1JBJcQ.text: Our favorite sushi in charlotte! We always order take out because the restaurant is small. We love the crispy California rolls and vegetable tempura roll as well. Can't really go wrong with trying any of their rolls.

sjkaaK3xVQ_tvOOYNNDTag.text: Our favorite sushi spot! While we love to eat here, but we almost always get take out because it's so crowded (fairly small dining room) and very large fan base. (I've never stopped in and not seen someone I know.) The restaurant has mix of table heights- regular and high tops. FRESH, FRESH, FRESH. Dazzling displays of fish boats for presentation. They have good selection of cooked meals as well. Love NZC!

9MOq80_TLVPdsHsLfHI4Pw.text: Very unsanitary restaurant. I went against my better judgement and got sushi from New Zealand Cafe and all of us got sick. My friends and I will definitely not be returning. My recommendation would be to spend a few more bucks to get fresh fish and avoid food poisoning...

jmu6OmcHSBPfaUr8sij4fA.text: Plan to arrive early if you want to grab a table, particularly on a weekend, because New Zealand Cafe does great business. Yes, it is in a strip mall, and no, the ambiance doesn't draw you in, but the fresh sushi and range of rolls sure does. The pricing is more than fair although I can't say that I've tried the $1 rolls. Seems a little risky to me unless you are vying for a sick day from work. I'm a sucker for a good caterpillar roll always as well as anything involving unagi, and there are plenty of eel options. My mister tried some tuna sashimi when we were there last, and it was outrageously good.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

9o4GovalZ7VwFvkM01Rgdw.text: This is the sushi spot I have been looking for since moving to Charlotte a year and a half ago!!! I am so glad someone gave my boyfriend a tip to try this place out. We went on a Sunday night and it was packed!! It's tiny and we had to wait for a table. I will say as much as we enjoyed the sushi, the dining experience was a little uncomfortable because the tables were so close we were basically sitting with two other couples and the servers could barely get around.   The rolls are so cheap! I think the most expensive one was $11. We got four and enjoyed them all besides the hot tuna, just not our style. Favorite was the big boss roll! Everything tasted fresh and of good quality.   Will definitely be back the next time we want sushi. You get twice as much for the money here than other places I have been in Charlotte and it tastes just as good, if not better!

L6kg0xMSDE94DpNE8ijT2g.text: This hole in the wall is a nice little hidden gem. Aside from being a little cramped and limited seating the food was delicious very good sushi and reasonable pricing for the availability in the area. I will frequent without reservation when the mood hits for some sushi. Try it you won't be disappointed.

DIAIMGQ3QXKfumB5g3PmHw.text: I decided to come here thanks to all of the raves on Yelp and I kind of regret that now.   My friend and I showed up around 5:00 on a Friday and we were able to walk right in and grab the last of two tables. As everyone has already mentioned, it's very small inside. There are six high top tables and then about four to five standard tables in the middle.  We were originally at one of the lower tables but a party of four consisting of small children came in and we were kindly asked to move to a high-top table. We weren't disappointed with that at all. The high top tables afford you some conversational privacy.  I ordered a glass of the plum wine (which was delicious) and then placed my order for a rose roll and vegetable tempura roll. The menu is not only sushi-focused, there are also bento box combos, fried rice, teriyaki chicken and steak, etc.  Our food arrived and it was decent although my rolls were wider than expected. What I will say about the sushi is that this is a good place to bring sushi newbies. They provide a lot of tempura options as well as rolls with mayo/cream cheese. The rose roll I ordered consisted of spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, avocado, cucumber and cheese sauce on the side. I didn't have any of the cheese sauce. The vegetable tempura consisted of fried broccoli, sweet potato, and zucchini.  The waitresses were great, friendly, and super willing to accommodate any needs. After we were done with our food, my friend and I both agreed that we've had better sushi.  Unfortunately, hours later (in the wee hours of the morning), I was struck with sharp stomach pains that led to me having to spend some time near a toilet bowl. I didn't have anything else to eat that night after leaving New Zealand Cafe so I'm utterly confused as to why my body reacted the way it but, needless to say, I won't be going back to find out.

photos.caption: Photo of New Zealand Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rose roll and vegetable tempura roll

CLzX1d-5k9dYGzfNmP-yBQ.text: Always good Sushi ...Although the place was packed with a waiting line out the door (always) Lacey got me a seat at the bar within minutes. She is one hard working hostess..when she is not getting grief from customers, she's refilling drinks around the restaurant handling small issues. Lacey is a pleasant asset to New Zealand Cafe and she needs get a raise .....Spartacus  ;)

IBCxhfV0iW3BZAgfT91c4A.text: Love love love the food!  It's the BEST! But I really get claustrophobic in such a tight and always crowded place. I hang in though because their sushi us incredible especially for the price.

n2Z5CfpPuBm96q5bt3-2ig.text: I just moved to the area and really, really, really wanted to like NZ Cafe. Based on the Yelp reviews, the typical lines and the fact I really wanted a good sushi place within a mile from where I live. So much so that I even went twice.  I should note I have only had the sushi, and I try to stick with sashimi and rolls without fried anything and I stay away from the entire fried rolls. Maybe their other stuff is better. I did like their bamboo roll, which is basically just fish wrapped in cucumber in a little ponzu sauce. Their eel isn't bad.  Everything else? Completely average at best. The rolls are way too large and have way too much rice. I popped the avocado off of a roll only to see a pencil-sized bit of filling in the middle of a giant wad of rice.  The fish seemed to be a bit fresher than average but I struggled to eat it or taste it around way too much rice. Some of the rolls are just bad. I couldn't manage to eat a grilled tuna roll.  I'd give the food about three stars (average), but the super-cramped space and the lines (why are there lines?) drop it down to about two stars. I'm regrettably driving farther for sushi now.

IeqKWZQBdOQC9uYbKXPThQ.text: The best sushi in Charlotte hands down. This place is amazing and I come here twice a week. When friends want sushi I bring them here. The wait is long but well worth it.

41Id7XB_yvxnfdWxT-kyFQ.text: Worst sashimi I've had in Charlotte.    I imagine this place has such high reviews because people get rolls with fried shit and spicy mayo all over it... so, of course it tastes good and masks not-fresh fish.  I had a sashimi platter and a bunch of nigiri a la carte.  It was all bad.  Some of the fish tasted frozen/half-thawed out, some of it tasted like it was soaking in water... watery sashimi? I don't know, that was a first for me, too.  My friend loved his salmon skin hand rolls, but I declined to try some because I was so over it.

8ArpjzuZuSBqbcGCKG-xHA.text: great food! I order the teriyaki chicken noodles and it's always delicious, their ginger salad is great and I love their rice with shrimp sauce! my hubs gets the queens town chicken. we love this place. it fills up quick and is on the smaller side but it's worth it

F2L3mR0KVi44TudNCIe8TA.text: Nothing special. They serve what most of the Americans call sushi.  They make rolls with care, which was impressive. The pictures on the menu looked disgusting and made me lose my appetite, though.  If you live close, it's convenient as Harris Teeter or Publix deli sushi.

PFYGjBNJyyYIb4AsjPdYcQ.text: Great spot for inexpensive lunch or dinner.  Try the combo bento boxes- hard deal to beat.  Great, fresh sushi as well and super friendly staff!  Come early or late, or be prepared to wait!  This place is no secret!

J1OL-8Et9oih7vXkZ-VZcA.text: Why am I just now finding this place?  We arrived early on a Saturday night thinking we'd for sure beat any crowd if a crowd was going to exist in the first place.  The only seats available were at the sushi bar - this little place was packed!  I later decided this was the best possible seat in the house because you get to see everything Jackie and his buddies are slicing up and ask all sorts of questions.  A ton of food.  High quality sushi.  Great service.  Cheap - Really cheap. We had a squid salad, 2 specialty rolls, a chicken and shrimp hibachi platter, and adult beverages....total charge was in the low $30s.  Can't wait to go back.  Even if it's for carry-out.  Diamond in the rough.

N57poVbmMmYGWh5RN5sCjA.text: Strange name for a sushi joint! The menu said that it was actually a chain that offered Asian and New Zealand cuisines. I'm not sure which items were more New Zealand-esce because I mainly saw typically Japanese dishes/sushi options.   After getting past the restaurant name and confusion, I was able to concentrate on their extensive menu. As their sign outside indicates, they offer some sashimi between $1-$1.75. In addition, they have a lot of rolls to choose from. I got the spicy tuna and veggie tempura rolls ($4.95 and $4.55). Very good! The pricing was great!  Like others have indicated, the space is small with seating for maybe 12 in the middle, 6 high/stool tables on the sides, and a sushi bar to fit 3 at the front. The service is okay, but lacked on refilling drinks. When you go, be assertive or you may go without.   This location is in the Harris Teeter strip mall area. It's tucked away next to a nail salon. I wish it was closer to where I lived because I'm sure I would go here more often (I get sushi cravings regularly). If you love sushi, try this place...all of the previous reviews are right on!

9MEDFFoFeFuBhF0e-0HzJg.text: Who knew? This little gem is tucked away in the Harris Teeter shopping center in Matthews. It's small but apparently regulars know about it - there was a wait at 6pm on a Thursday! Chilly outside temps meant our table by the door was rather unfortunate with so many people coming & going & holding the door open for extended lengths of time. Brrrr!  Now, I should point out that this place is known for their sushi. I don't each fish - raw or otherwise, so I can't speak to what they're known for; other than to say my friends all raved about the Tiger Roll & Christmas Roll. I did, however, order the Daily Vegetable Special and the Vegetable Tempura rolls. This was my first time trying anything remotely sushi-related and my first time eating with chopsticks (they don't readily provide forks!! Well, they might if you NEED one and ask for it.) Our food was served in a very elaborate wooded boat, which was fun. The servers were very quick with our drink orders & refills.  I thought the food was flavorful & fresh. I'd skip the fried bananas & bananas sushi for dessert, but others seemed to enjoy the green tea ice cream for something unusual.  Next time, I'll probably try one of their pork or chicken meals for what seemed like a larger portion at a reasonable price.

UhVO-LukaOcpF9UNxwsRkA.text: By far, the best sushi in Chsrlotte. In terms of variety, quality and price it TOWERS head and shoulders above the rest. Fyi, usually a wait at dinner time. Their quality holds up for to go orders as well.  2 people can eat very well here for around $40, which is a steal compared to some places and their $20 rolls.

XV4asTG_vfeKmzbHZPoToQ.text: Amazing!!  Found this hidden treasure after searching for new places to try and I'm so glad we did!!  Fresh and delicious every time!  I drive 40 minutes so I can dine here!  Best sushi in town!!

VR5J8RtyoC1_GcvNnvUcPw.text: Slowest service ever!! Arrived at 6:45pm waited 40 mins for a table for one. Ordered my food around 7:30 my order came out after 8pm AND IT WAS WRONG!!  I wanted Salmon sashimi. Thats it. No rice, no salad.  Just salmon. What I got was a sashimi combo plater of several other fish that I didn't want. After waiting over an hour for my food I just picked a few pieces, paid and left. My waitress clearly didn't understand what I wanted.   I also ordered the poke which was good. However it was served in a martini glass so all the soy and delicious juice was pooled at the bottom of the glass and the top portion was bland. The glass is a cute serving idea but not good for the person wanting to enjoy flavor with their food.  I watched the staff fumble around and deliver the wrong food to many tables.  It was so small and cramped. The atmosphere was poor.  This place needs to be on that show "Kitchen Nightmares".

OLBXuH7QSzWS63jieAGrHA.text: Excellent choice for amazing sushi, excellent prices. Went in Tuesday night and the place was packed. Great prices.

The sushi tastes somewhere between grocery store and buffet with the grocery store being the better of the two. Will not be eating here again and I hope I do not have food poisoning. FQUhbgXawRdjbL8uFOk02g.text: This is a very intimate space, with tons of good choices and a great value!

m8OLJGwhs2xXoM9r7KXzpQ.text: Best sushi we've found... Maybe ever! Big creative rolls & always great quality! The space is a little small, so there's often a wait, but it's worth it!

kAgOPI_lQ3sbFlzae29b6A.text: My wife and I love coming here for dinner. We moved to a new house nearby and learned about New Zealand Cafe from the previous owner. The sushi rolls have always been terrific and the service is friendly. Don't be put off by the low key setting, you won't be disappointed. Though I've never had to wait when I've come here, I suppose it can get pretty crowded at peak times.

V5c3ZXeZiSqoK2AJglVBYg.text: Can you say over-rated?? The sushi, food, and service is all subpar. I've had much better sushi in this city without waiting 30 minutes for a table

y9TxArJ9HlAB2kg-G-mgmw.text: We randomly discovered the New Zealand Cafe in this little strip plaza at the corner of Sardis and Monroe and noticed that every time we saw it, it looked quite busy, even during weeknights.  We decided to give it a try one Wednesday evening and understood why.    They have a pretty extensive Asian menu, including a wide variety of sushi.  We tried a tuna crunch roll to start and I literally could have eaten about 5 or 6 of those for my dinner and been completely satisfied (not to mention very full).  The roll was so full of flavor and only very lightly fried.   Nevertheless, I also ordered one of their hot chicken entrees, the spicy Thai curry chicken, too.  It came in a bento box with the chicken entree, rice, a few fried shrimp, dipping sauces, a salad with ginger dressing, and a crab cheese wonton.  All for under $6.  At dinner.  Wow.  It was VERY delicious and well worth the price.    What a find the New Zealand Cafe was!  We'll definitely be back for a very reasonably priced, hot, delicious meal.  I can't wait to try more of their sushi and hot entree options!

Y-JjJDzxXnOMxaRSl_jc5w.text: Fresh and yummy sushi. Great prices. Friendly service. I get a lot of take out though because it's always busy and the seating area is small.

C0j3G-WycTdh8fxgffGV0Q.text: After reading a ton of great reviews on this teeny little sushi spot, hubs and I just had to make the trip down to New Zealand Cafe. We're both sushi fanatics, loving (and eating) everything from yellowtail sashimi to creative maki rolls.   NZ Cafe really is tucked away from the street - hidden in a strip mall off of Sardis Rd. The inside is interesting and super small. When we stopped by here we counted roughly 40 possible seats in the place - and that would be a tight fit! Regardless, we were able to grab a four-top and sit comfortably while we perused their menu(s).   And what a menu it was! We were each given four different menus: one solely for sushi, one dinner menu, a specials menu and one other blue menu that I didn't even get a chance to look at. I was a bit overwhelmed! The service was attentive and friendly and our waitress was please to offer up a few suggestions from their specialty roll menu. Here is what we went with:  Steamed Potstickers (Pork): Six tasty postickers served with a nice, light soy sauce. These potstickers were nicely flavored, especially with the sauce.   *I'm not a roe fan, so we chose to abstain from all fish roe from every roll.   Dynamite Roll: Spicy yellowtail, crab and avocado. While I wasn't super impressed for this roll (a bit mushy and lacking flavor), it was $4.95. That's a steal in anyone's book.  Tuna Crunchy Roll: I really wanted to love this roll, but it was just way too fried for my taste. The outside was super crunchy, stiff and too heavy. Plus, the roll came out piping hot and I'm not a fan of hot tuna rolls.   Pink Roll: Tempura shrimp, spicy tuna, cod wrapped in soy paper. This was a pretty good roll but HUGE! So large that I had to gnaw off half at a time. I'm sure that looked super hot.   Ichiban Roll: Spicy albacore tuna, crab, avocado, topped with spicy tuna and wasabi mayo with a dash of Sriracha on top. I liked the flavor of this roll quite a bit, as it's definitely got a kick. I wish it had a little more texture, though. Maybe some crunchies on top would help?   While I definitely see the appeal of New Zealand Cafe, the cheap rolls, generous portions and creative combinations, it didn't blow me away like I thought it would. Considering it's a bit of a hike from my house, I'm not sure I'll be coming back often, but I definitely want to give this little gem another try in the near future.

sOUOUbyOWa7MY8YFuBh3hw.text: We went here after eating (bad food...kingz) at another restaurant, the waitstaff immediately seated us and said hello, took our  orders, they are awesome, the food came out in a timely manner and everything was tasty and seasoned properly, great little place,only down side tables are close and hallway to bathrooms is tight

My family and I got 4 rolls (2 were the most expensive on the menu), 2 bento boxes, 5 nigiri pieces, & miso soup for $63. We're on vacation for a week and will no doubt be back before we leave.   If you're looking for sushi, absolutely go here. It's a small place but it is absolutely worth the short wait to get in.

qKKbTMahLH4vqM6_sRJOnw.text: I love the sushi here. My two favorites are the bigger roll and the super spicy roll. Decent price for the two rolls. I dine in every now and then but its more convenient for me to order to go. Its always busy here so you have to catch it before rush hour.

rELW7ibBOjIqaRXvxo6ZlA.text: It might look like a hole in the wall but don't let it fool you-always fresh sushi when I lived in the area I dined here 5 days a week- the seaweed crab salad is always a favorite of mine love the golden crab roll and favorite roll- the plum wine is delicious as well as the fried banana!

mGeRSNVlCR0AESGtdm1auA.text: I am very conservative on accolades on yelp.  Charlotte is devoid of a selection and variety of restaurants but this place is an absolute gem.  We drive 45 minutes across town to eat here.  Prices are fair, service is good, the sushi is excellent.  Presentation is great, the rice is perfect, and the portions are abot 20-30% more than anywhere in town.  Try the Ichiban roll!  Went on monday night at 7:00 and place was full, but only waited 5 minutes for table.  The dining room is small and a bit tight, but the food makes up for lack of elbow room.

-VmX3Vws8wCfLYJEOPp6Sw.text: Hmmmm...I was hoping for better.  Much better.  It was lunch and the place was slammed.  So excited to try some good sushi.  Was rushed to the bar.  Was rushed with the menu.  Had some questions and was rushed through those.  Hmmm....not yet impressed.  No lunch specials really for sushi.  There are Bento boxes but they are about $13 for ones that include sushi.  So I ordered two rolls including a basic spicy tuna.    One person making sushi....it took a while.  Got my order and the spicy sauce on the tuna was a mayo based sauce.  In 20 years of eating sushi I have never had a mayo sauce on spicy tuna.  Also it wasn't very spicy.  Also was rather warm for sushi.  Rice was good.    I think this place may be a good intro to sushi but not for the seasoned fans.  Hmmm...I was hoping for better.

rcIw-mOykOLWtaQbQOqoMQ.text: First went there asked hostess if they we're busy and had a table available she said no they were not and yes there was tables available I told her I was waiting for someone she said okay and nothing else the person came less than three minutes later we walk into sit down mind you I have a baby and a toddler she says oh we don't have any tables available it's going to be a 30 to 40 minute wait she said someone just walked in   why didn't you take my name and hold the table when I walked in there!  okay besides that we decided to eat outside so we only had to wait 10 to 15 minutes we got our food it was okay not excellent not bad so we get home about two hours later I get the worst stomach pains and cramps I'm pretty sure I got food poisoning I was in the bathroom most of the night my husband who also ate chicken also had extreme pains and was in the bathroom most of the night my daughter didn't eat chicken she had sushi when she woke up in the morning she was vomiting we did not all eat the same things but we all had pretty much the same symptoms of food poisoning I only had breakfast that morning so it was nothing else that I ate and I had a bowl of cereal my husband was at work and my daughter ate her lunch at school that I packed for her so 100% positive it was the New Zealand Cafe just glad that the baby didn't eat there. He was the only one not sick. honestly I just don't think that they handle their food sanitarily probably cross-contamination with fish chicken not cooking things properly or just plain dirty or not keeping things at a proper temperature. If you have a sensitive stomach I suggest you don't eat there and find a cleaner nicer not so cramped seafood place
